reviews.review: Yum-zo!  I'm typically a purist - chirashi, sashimi, miso - sign me up!  But the inventive rolls here caught my eye.  Photos in the menu don't hurt.  Nice, quick friendly service.  I think they put crack in the ceviche (actually maybe just lime and sugar) but I wanted to eat it (garnish and) all.

Open really late and great sushi

I have stopped in here on numerous times to Vegas. Mainly because i get into town late and after a full day of traveling i need somewhere "non vegas strip" to eat and relax.

There best roll is hands down the "sexy roll" but ill let you be the judge cause there all good. The waitresses are nice and the place has a nice layout. Nice top 40 hits with a huge screen where they play the music video to whatever song is playing. Kinda cool to watch if you dont wanna chill at the bar and watch whatever sports game they have on.
Great service. Very good food. Nice ambiance. We for Nevada roll, Dragon roll and Rainbow roll plus Kaizen ceviche. Super fresh fish all around.
The environment is calm. Foods are awesome! There are a wide variety of options on the menu. I would highly recommend.
I've been coming here for years & always a great time! I usually get the hot night roll or chicken Katsu bowl, which is consistently yummy. Also a great late-night spot close to Las Vegas Blvd.

i can't believe i'd forgotten to review this place!  i was there last month and was so pleased by my meal here that i couldn't wait to yelp it.  but then i got distracted.  :/  it wasn't until a friend asked for vegas food recommendations that i remembered.  

anyway, this place is SO good!  here are my top 5 reasons for saying that:  

1.  it is open late... as ALL things should be in vegas, and sadly are not.  
2.  it is very reasonably priced.
3.  the traditional sushi is great, but some of the more creative rolls are freakin' rad!
4.  the service is polite and attentive... even in the wee hours of the morning.
5.  it's not quite on the strip but not on the other side of the vegas world either.

my only sad is the it's not in LA.  certainly belongs on my must-eat-there list whenever i am in vegas now.

I am no sushi expert, but both my brother and I agree that this may have been the best sushi roll we have had and not a bad price. The service was great as well, I drink a lot of water and my glass never even got empty.

The only reason this has 2 stars is because the food was decent, and another waiter came and asked if we needed anything after we had sat there for 45 minutes, waiting for our waitress to come ask us for our order. Then our second waiter forgot about us as well. The food was cold after 2 minutes of getting to us, and we literally almost left them a pile of barf to clean up. $0 tip for you guys! And we are normally the type to give 20-25%
Love this place! Huge selection! Something everyone will love! Wish I lived closer, I will definitely come here again when I'm in town next!

Very attentive service with great food.  Had the server suggest a few popular rolls and we were not disappointed.   Clam miso soup, orange blossom and TT rolls were excellent!  Will recommended when in Vegas.

Rolld here are super good and service was great! They had shishito peppers and chili oil which not a lot of sushi restaurants have nowadays. We came here late after a night out and they were open until 3am :).
This place is great. It was located right across from my hotel (Hard Rock). Everything I ordered was absolutely amazing. The rolls are a good size. The service is great. I loved the BBQ roll.

JUST LEFT Kaizen. Sat at Sushi bar with owner/chef Danny- Let him create me dinner. TOTALLY DISAPPOINTING. Charged me $162 for absolutly mediocre sushi...stay away from this RIP OFF place. NOBU across the street, might be just as expensive, but the fish would be fresh and taste much better. A total rip off- NEVER again. If you go, don't say you weren't warned. HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!

I only gave this a star because the food was good. 
Let's talk about the service...good lord they were so gosh darn RUDE I am baffled. I came in with a couple of friends and it's 12am on a Friday night, I would get if it was super packed, but it wasn't. So we had to share a menu, 3 waiters were "waiting our table" the reason for the quotations because they were doing anything but tending to us. Not like we asked for much. Just some more water since we had to wait so long to order, get our food just everything in general. Then we look over and see one of our "waiters" taking sake shots with his friends instead of taking care of other customers. Also don't asked for anything else after they bring you your food unless you wanna get hit with a nasty attitude like it's an inconvenience. Terrible service, whoever did the hiring needs to be let go cause they aren't a good judge of character.

Oh my. I can't gush enough about this place. It's across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. We were craving sushi while gambling there and almost went to Nobu. Thankful for checking Yelp we came here instead to save a few bucks. I can't tell you how happy I am that I came here! We had the Kaizen cheviche which was heaven. Then we had the Kaizen scallop dynamite which is baked with mushrooms and cheese. I would have ordered another had we not ordered rolls. I'm a scallop fan and this was just mouth-watering good! The prices are reasonable and I'll admit I'd pay Nobu prices for this deliciousness. Don't be fooled by those high end places. Come to a local spot like this and have a great meal!
Good stuff!  I would come back.  Oh wait, here till Friday.  Ill be back tomorrow night!
Been here since it first opened..  Still good to this day.  Love the music video playing..  Also enjoyed the strawberry nigori

Ate here last night. It was pretty good. I had the spicy tuna crispy rice, the fire cracker roll, and the Crispy soft shell crab appetizer. The spicy tuna crispy rice was very good. and the firecracker roll was great as well. I wasnt a big fan of the crispy soft shell crab. I usually am, but this one had a pretty heavy batter on it much like the cheap frozen breaded shimp you can buy at the grocery store. Overall it was pretty good, and the staff was very friendly. They were out of large Sapporos, so they brought me 2 small ones...at the same time...I probably looked like a lush double fisting it in a sushi bar, but I dont mind that. :)
The menu had alot of very interesting and different combinations of sushi that I'll have to go back and try sometime. I'd recommend it if you are looking for a semi-modern take on sushi.

PS. I went to the one off of Eastern and Horizon ridge...not the one by on Paradise.

I really enjoy a sushi fix when in Vegas.  In addition to my standard fare of gyoza and edamame, I have tried a couple different rolls and haven't been disappointed. I haven't eaten in the restaurant, but take-out is quick and the food is packaged for travel well. I will continue to come back.

They now have a section where rolls are half off.  The last time I've eaten here was probably 2 months ago.  So hopefully they will still have it.  I thought this place was just a little expensive.  They do have a lot of creative sushi/dishes.  I see I'm writing for the paradise location.  This location has been much more busier.  The henderson location seems to be slower and less crowded if that suits you.

Wow! In Vegas looking for late night sushi, Kaizen was close to where we were so we had to try it! The menu has so many amazing dishes it's hard to choose! We tried the orange blossom roll and it's so good! (And the Salmon deep fried shrimp) highly recommend coming here you won't regret! Friendly staff, parking, fair prices and nice atmosphere! Definitely try this place! We will return!

So far so awesome. Patient staff, nice atmosphere, and the music is on point. I'm just waiting on the food and if it's as good as it smells this place is gonna get all 5 stars.

Update: yo! The food is bomb and if you do the review for free menu item get the cold sake. You get like more than four shots of cold delicious drunkiness. Also the food is goooooodddd. Don't get the Hungry Roll that was just fried tempera batter with bits of fish and rice.

Kiss of fire! Kiss of fire all day and everyday. Haha and the severs here are just beautifully brilliant. 10/10 will come again. 

-Pumi
Most fairly priced sushi anywhere close to the strip. An okay selection of rolls and kitchen entrees as well as great, fast service. Would gladly return here if we stay at the same hotel next year.

Ate here twice while in Vegas- once Friday night around 11pm... Place was packed but still sat down right away. Second time was Sunday around 9- much quieter. Tried 9 different rolls and they were all superb! Pricing is typical for sushi anywhere between $9-$20 per roll. Eat. Here. Now.
The atmosphere is excellent! Love the decor and the bar situation. I had the beef udon and i loved it. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal.

Awesome spot to get late night sushi off the strip! My large and rowdy group of friends rolled in around 2:30am with late night sushi cravings. Sorry we were so loud! Wait staff was great in accommodating this very rude group of friends. If your friends yell very loud inappropriate sexual things that may or may not disturb the other diners, this place will still not kick you out! Believe me, they are great! 

Do not under any circumstances order the baked scallops or some roll with jalapeños on top of it! Both my friends said those two items were gross. However, the roll I ordered that has ponzu sauce on it was delicious and I heard the Poke is phenomenal so could be hit or miss. The menu has excellent pictures so you can use your best judgement to make the right decision. Although, making right decisions and being in Las Vegas usually don't go together.
As soon as me and my boyfriend walked in we were immediately served , the place is beautiful and great customer service ! Will deff come back here for our sushi !

A funning thing about the name of this restaurant "Kaizen", according to my Japanese colleague, means continuous improvement of something and is the motto for Toyota motors.  

They said nobody in Japan would name the restaurant "kaizen". I guess it's because it implies that the dishes are not at their best if you are constantly trying to improve. 

Anyhow, this place is somewhat of a novelty for the Japanese because they usually do not see nor tasted American-style sushi rolls. We ordered the tuna poke, 16pcs sushi combo, 20pcs sashimi, calamari tempura roll and a spicy rainbow roll.

Nothing is really out of the ordinary. The poke tasted a bit odd but the sashimi and spicy rainbow roll were decent. A bit on the pricey side.

There's an overhead projection of random music and videos playing. A large bar on the side. The location was easy to find with plenty of parking.

amazing amazing amazing. By far the best sushi I ever had in my life. I am happy to admit Im a local here. I come as often as humanly possible.

I first discovered this place about two months ago. Everything is good. My favorite is the crispy rice appitizer. It's just yum.

matter of fact... I am heading there now! they're open late, perfect for the casino workers and late night crowd like us!

my second time here and I will be returning. We picked up some friends from the strip who were visiting and they wanted sushi. I tried another local favorite but it was an hour wait. Kaizen was just a 30 minute wait and I'm glad we did.

The service was great. The orders were taken almost as quickly as our drinks were brought out and rolls were quick to follow. They all had excellent flavors and our out of town friends agreed we made the right selection on where to eat. Very clean and a friendly staff.

It's open late, it serves sushi(meh sushi) and the prices seem to reflect the fact that it's across the street from the Hard Rock. That combination is not something that will ever make me want to come back. Not to mention all 3 of the rolls I ordered were sloppily made and didn't seem to be the freshest of fish. Pass!
I came to Las Vegas during the SEMA convention, and I been coming here to eat every day! The food is amazing! The atmosphere is very nice as well! I highly recommend coming here to eat!

Probably the best sushi I've had and I've tried several spots in LA. sushi is fresh (pleasantly surprised by the real crab in the Rainbow Roll), service is fast, and it's a nice relaxing spot to go before you start your night! May even be back here later since they're open til 6 am. 

Very close to the Hard Rock!

Looks like our new go-to spot for sushi when we come here.

WOW! This place is so good! The quality is fantastic and there is So much variety!  There is something for everyone. Keep in mind it's near the strip so it is a bit pricey,  but most good sushi is and this place is worth it.

The environment is good, looks fancy. And they have pretty good food here, vegetable tempura roll tastes awesome! BTW, the server Michael is awesome, FYI. LoL great place for hanging out with your bf and gf. Check it out.
Always good food and good service. Love the lobster tempura roll. The miso soup is delicious too.
My first time here and I had the king crab roll and the King of Ocean roll and all I can say is amazing! I have lived in Las Vegas for almost 20 years and never had sushi this good! Who knew?!?!?

I had friends in town and wanted to find a local sushi place. Walking inside to a very clean decor relived the stress of a sub par sushi restaurant hole in the wall.  At first glance I was impressed! The service was good with very attentive servers. The sushi selection is above average and the sake was good! I would definitely revisit for a casual dinner.

This isn't my first time eating at kaizen but decided to do a review. I love their food here. It bums me they no longer do all you can. I remember the last I went they do all you can eat. I don't know if it was seasonal. But my favorite entrees here would have to be the baked salmon or the beef teriyaki. The serving fills me up. Other than that, I do love their baked rolls. I would definitely recommend the baked lasagna. Super duper good. If you're into tempura roll I would recommend the crazy boy roll. 8 pieces for only 7 bucks! I love the eel sauce. The food is great overall. For service wise, it's fair. You'll have the good waiters and sometimes the bad ones.

I know everyone 'loves' Kaizen, but I've been here a few times (7-8) and I've never really loved it.  The eastern location is better though bc they do have the half price sushi but still.  Their sushi is high priced, and they dont have all you can eat, so you end up spending a fortune.  The few good things I've had were the jalapeno roll, which was actually really good, but I feel this place is more 'americanized' sushi which I hate.  I love authentic food, but this place is just ok.  I hate to give a less than spectacular rating, but I've never had a great meal from here.  If you come here for late night sushi, hit up musashi! Its down the road on paradise and way better! They have happy hour EVERY night from 11pm-3am.  

The service has always been good, but the food is just ok to me.

Nope. The sushi rice wasn't cooked properly. I admit I am an idiot for ordering uni but it came out a little darker of a color than typical and it didn't taste quite what I am used to. Maybe not 100% fresh. Edible not enjoyable. They were nice enough to take it back though. Not what I am used to very under par.  Maybe you need to get wildly intoxicated. Terrible place. The worst sushi I've ever had.

Spectacular service and food. Our waitress was very attentive and genuinely friendly. I am local so its great to find restaurants i enjoy. I am defintely a Kaizen fan and would recommend it to anyone looking for great japanese lasagna.

First, I have to thank Mary P. for this suggestion.  Actually, she suggested the location in North Las Vegas. But still glad I came here. 

I was staying at the Hard Rock and wanted some sushi. Had Hamada's 2 nights prior (see review) and it was horrible. Had to redeem myself.

Service:  Tons of staff to the point that you will always have someone at your needs.  Good job Team Kaizen.

Now for the food.  Tried their Spicy Tuna, Chicken Katsu w/Brown Rice, Baked Salmon,and Caterpillar Roll.  All were tasty, fresh, not fishy, and made to order. My co-worker had a special roll created exactly how he wanted it.  Always good when they can improvise. 

Can't wait to try the location in North Las Vegas.  Only issue with this place is that they lack AYCE. But they stated they were better than the north location.  We'll see, I will be the judge

I wasnt wild about this place. I have 3-4 different sushi dishes and none were great. All were pretty average and forgettable. I was also kinda blown out by the bar bill, so didn't leave me feeling like I will be back. There are many better places in town.
Super good. Have not been diappointed by anything we have had. Totally recommend this place.

I'm shocked at all the good reviews this place is getting. We could hardly eat our sushi and had to return it to the chefs! Its nice that this place is open late but thats about it. The food was priced high so I was expecting incredible sushi. Turns out, the sushi you get from Costco or the buffetts at any LV strip hotel tastes way better. I was so disappointed at the quality and will definitely never dine here again. 

Here's a sampling of what we ordered:
CA roll - super dry
Tuna roll & various sashimis - the fish wasn't fresh
Chicken Teriyaki bowl - chicken was dry and inedible
Tamago roll - this one we sent back because it tasted funny

After a long night  and a long drive, I wasn't too impressed with this place. We ordered 3 different rolls and they must've thought that we were ordering from the kiddie menu. Even the sauces could be measured by a squirt. I don't know if this is the norm or if they figured that we wouldn't recognize the bite sizes until we reached home. The only good thing was that it was open at 12:30 in the morning.

The UNI here is fresh! I know it's hard to find a good UNI, and I've tried everywhere. Kaizen tonight had a fantastic UNI, bright vibrant color to it and a fresh quality taste. 

All the sushi was exceptional. 

Our waiters Joon and Irene were amazing and went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was enjoyable. We will be back!

Phenomenal!!!


Took my girlfriends here for a birthday celebration and they can't stop thanking me!!! The presentation of these dishes are perfection!!!

Came here for lunch one day and was happy with the food and service.  I had the chicken katsu bowl and an order of California rolls.  Both were good and was a decent portion.  My friends had the kalbi short ribs and the bake muscles.  Both were delicious!  

If you have a sushi craving while in Vegas come here and you wont have to pay the outrageous hotel prices!   Decor was really hip and modern.  They blast hip hop music and have a large projection screen playing music videos while you eat.

Wasn't so impressed by this spot. The location is conveniently close to the strip, but the sushi wasn't anything great. Given that many of the Vegas sushi spots are AYCE, I expected the non-AYCE sushi restaurants to have higher quality fish. 
They have an extensive menu of Japanese fusion dishes. Seems like the popular thing to get here are their specialty rolls. My rolls were poorly put together, but I was okay with it, given that it was late at night and I was craving sushi.

Love this place! Go weekly since we were staying nearby when we first moved here. Get the same thing every time - tempura shrimp or lobster roll and chicken katsu. And of course sake and beer. The place is lively and there is a video screen which is a bit loud, but works in this place. 

Service is excellent. We love Tom. This place is also kid friendly and my daughter's favorite place to eat.

This is by far my favorite sushi place in town. I highly recommend the Rose roll.  And the staff is the coolest ever. Each visit to Vegas I bring my guest and we're never disappointed.  Thank you rocking sushi!
This place is amazing! Friendly staff, good music, contempo/urban decor with sporting events on tvs. Great happy hour specials! Definitely coming back when I'm in town. Bonzai!
We ALWAYS come to this sushi place when we are in Vegas.  NEVER a disappointment.  Service is great and they will fabricate any type of roll you want, just tell them what your tummy desires.  =)

Great service everything is amazing and the food is great 
Kate serve us with a lot of love
Sushi roll are very tasty, sashimi are fresh. Our favourite dishes are: Kaizen Roll, and spicy tuna salad. So good! My parents love this place!

Holy mackerel... I was not expecting this dining experience. Just arrived from LA to visit my grandparents for the holiday, got out of the care home way later than expected, hotel check-in was a mess, all the boyfriend and I felt like was sushi. It was 10:30 and everything was about to close at 11. We gave up on the "epic Vegas dining experience" and just picked the highest rated sushi joint on yelp that was open. Some place in a strip mall. (Eyebrow raised)

Just upon walking in, we were shocked to see and feel such a nice and trendy vibe. Clean, classy, good music, nice bar, neat tables. We sat at the bar and opened the fabulously photographed menus. Sushi spots with photos is a major plus for me and they had EVERYTHING photographed. We picked a bunch of stuff and were blown away with not only the taste/freshness/quality of fish, but the presentation, price/portions, service... Just everything. The bill ended up being $122 and trust me... we were really going for it. Anywhere else back in LA would have racked up to $200+. 

We stayed and hung out well after we were stuffed to the brim. The ambiance is nice and I felt like I was getting a special type of Vegas experience without all the hustle and bustle. I will absolutely be showing this place off to friends who join me on future trips. What a treat!

Oh yeah... And it's open until 6am. AND they have a happy hour that starts at midnight. GENIUS!!!

I posted photos of what we ate - albacore topped with fried onions, filet mignon salad, white rose roll, sea bass & unagi. We also had saki bombs, the largest portion of edemami ever, uni and crispy tuna tostada things. YUM YUMMMMM YUM

Came here for lunch before leaving Vegas. The service was pretty fast and friendly. We ordered the miso soup, spicy tataki, salsa dancing roll, beef tataki, and the poke appetizer. All were pretty good, especially the poke.
Excellent service, great menu and very friendly attentive staff! Our favorite place for when we are in the mood for sushi!

The ambience was great! The layout of the restaurant has wood polished tables and benches in the middle while the back wall has booths and the front has a long sushi bar. I went with my son and wife. We ordered Unagi, sashimi appetizers, pork ribs, and Kaizen roll. The food was fresh and prepared well. The ribs took longer to cook then we expected. Overall a good experience.
Best sushi I have had anywhere in the U.S.  The service was outstanding as well. You must give it a try! I will be back every time I'm in town.
Definetly would recommend this place for tempura rolls. staff is friendly. came here outta the blue and wasnt dissappointed.

Service is outstanding and the sushi was good. The rolls are good and creative. If you like spicey with sushi this place will treat you well. It also has basic rolls but their own spicey creations are good. Also got the the gyoza, after living in Japan for three years wasn't inpressed with the gyoza. Decent but if you come and are looking for an appetizer I wouldnt go with this one, but nonetheless the food and sushi and service was good, so I would check it out if you're jonzing for a cool place and some good food.

My Cali sushi style home away from home when in Nevada.  Was introduced to Kaizen by a local back in 2012 and now hit this off-yet-close-to-Strip spot most times I'm in Vegas (5-12 times/year).

They have a relaxed, nice vibe with friendly, efficient service and a great spread of rolls and solid quality fish.  

A great spot to sink some cold beer/sake and fill your belly with friends after a massive few days on the town ;)

Hmm I love sushi so always willing to try a new sushi place. On a friend's recent birthday we decided to stop here after enjoying Yelp's happy hour at Rumor. Perhaps it was a big mistake to come to sushi hungry after indulging in quite a few drinks. Let's just say it would have been beneficial for us and our pocket books to do AYCE elsewhere. Between 3 of us, we graciously cashed out at $100 on sushi on individual rolls not AYCE. Well it wouldn't have been that bad, however, when most AYCE places are around $24 a person, it would have been cheaper to go elsewhere! The rolls were enjoyable but not mouthgasmic and overpriced. I do give them credit for surprising the birthday girl with a tempura green tea dessert, which we enjoyed greatly. I'll stick to my sushi joints off the strip.

I'm based in LA and have become a sushi snob.  I was in Vegas and craving sushi and thought I would take a chance at Kaizen b/c a local recommended the place to me.  My skepticism quickly disappeared - this place is amazing!!!  I continue to yearn for their seared ono - I have yet to find another restaurant who makes it as perfectly as they do.  

This place is perfect for a date or a big group.  Highly recommend!!!

I love Kaizen.. actually.. I love Kaizen's First Kiss Roll. I admit, it's the only reason I come back. =P It's a cute place and I have no major complaints.. except that it is a bit pricy. Oh well. It's open late and since the boyfriend and I work in restaurants on the strip, we're always out late.. so it's nice to just get off the busy strip and have some good sushi after work. =)

Food is delicious and fresh here. The servers and host are friendly and young. Very cool urban pace and great food. If you are on a low carb diet try the rock and roll roll it's wrapped in cucumber and pretty delicious!

Decent rolls for a decent price.  I would put this on the same level as some of the sushi spots i frequent in the Bay Area.

What puts this place apart is that they're open late, till 6 in the morning!  Also, i was impressed with the service.  We ordered miso soup,  tempura & sushi and got our food in the correct order!  Its a win-win!
This place is awesome for lunch.  Came here twice back to back for their spicy fresh fish bowl!
A Very solid sushi experience. Nice variety of rolls and other traditional dishes on the menu. Fast and polite service. Not bad considering it's in Vegas.

2 rolls, a beer and a large hot sake for under $40 bucks...in Vegas...yeah. Almost unbelievable, but true.
The rolls were just ok. It was only better than fast food because it was fish and rice. Had it been coated in grease, it probably would have tasted about the same. It was just ok.
The price was fantastic - the sake was good. Cold beer is always cold beer. The waitstaff was friendly and sweet - the sushi chefs looked like they were biding their time until something better came along and you could taste it in the rolls.
It was walking distance from my hotel...a little off the beaten path from the strip... and I like this.

I walked over to get sushi from here and it was quick and easy. They have quite an extensive menu and the prices are very reasonable. I got the crab salad, Hard Rock Roll, and King of Ocean Roll. I don't feel like the crab salad was very flavorful, and they other rolls were good but nothing that I thought that was better than other sushi that I have had.

Kaizen isn't cheap.  It's not sushi genius or the best thing you've ever eaten.  It's just really good fresh fish served till the wee hours of the morning so in my book thats pretty sweet.  

When I first moved to town from New York and had no car.   I lived in the ghetto area just north and would walk the 15 minutes in blistering heat for the sushi.  Well that and check out the boobs across the street at the hard cock.

Worked for me.
I would recommend this place to any family because they have good food like the udon noodle. It has good service and they are very nice people.

When it comes to food service and price point I would give Kaizen Fusion Roll five stars as far as customer services goes however they'll come in rolling at a 1 lowly star. So this review will average itself out at 3 stars. 

Here's the situation. My friend and I went driving around looking for a place to eat at around 4a and yelped the nearest location. Boom Kaizen popped up near UNLV. 

The food, for the price is awesome, I got a baked salmon roll. Delicious. Unlike all the other all you can eat places here and original. He got some type of calamari roll and something else. 

Adding an $11 lychee flavored sake and a green tea tempura ice cream (but they don't serve vanilla flavor which didn't really make any sense to me but who am I...) who couldn't be more pleased?

Well... let's start from the beginning. 

The serve here was beyond poor. Upon entrance the two girls that we were working had just the most unengaging attitudes and missed so many marks. I had to ask 3 times for the same 7UP, the miscommunication was so obviously there that the poor service just had to be mentioned.

I mean and I'm not to be a stickler about table courtesies, but all the servers that took our dishes away or served us just stuck their whole bodies right between both my friend and I - based on my memory as a server, aren't you supposed to come around the side or wouldn't that just make more sense? Anyway - it was an odd experience. Given I understand it's 5:30 in the morning at that point everyone wants to go home and they're shoving people out, but the place is still an establishment and the restaurant clearly strategically placed itself across certain hotel&casinos for a reason, but the place was dead on a Saturday night for obvious reasons...

I mean it's obviously not the food, the food is great and decently priced.

Worth it if it's LAST LAST minute late night dinner and you're near the UNLV campus.

I am jealous of you Vegas locals!

You have a place to get sushi at 4AM on the weekdays and up to 6AM on the weekends?!

Yes it is a TAD bit more expensive then other places, but the rolls that we purchased were delicious. 

We had Spicy Tuna, Las Vegas, California, and Night roll.

The hot tea was one of the better ones I've tried as well.

Sushi is not overfilled with rice, the crab (if not imitation) in the California roll is not drenched in mayo. 

The staff was friendly, and service was good. 

It is also easy to order because their menu is loaded with pictures, so if you are not sure, feel free to order with your eyes.

The restaurant is located in a strip mall by the Hard Rock. The inside decor is really "cool" and what I guess I can describe as "fusion". On the outside you wouldn't really think anything of this place, but hey it's whats on the inside that counts. They even have a DJ playing some 90s music for that extra "hip" feel. It was more than welcomed.

For late late late night-- or early morning cravings of Sushi, check this place out.

Really enjoyed this late night sushi place and after 5 hours of playing blackjack I was grateful to find a decent sushi place open after 2am.  All the other late night sushi places seem to close at 2.  Sat down at the bar, at 3:10am the place was surprisingly seated with about 10 other late night eaters. I ordered 2 rolls: King of Ocean Roll (topped with lobster, shrimp, tangy sauce and contained avacodo, asparagus, cucumber) & Sunrise Roll (salmon,avacodo on top, with spicy tuna inside and ponzu sauce).  The food was satisfying and tasted fresh, moreover very satisfying.  Service was friendly and prompt, 2 young Japanese sushi chefs working at the bar preparing the sushi.  Waitresses were young and cute, overall a very satisfying experience and exactly what I was hoping for.

Wonderful place for lunch!  They have these lunch specials and all are big portions for a good price.  The sashimi combo was very fresh and the tempura was good too!
I have been there several times and my boss goes there almost every day.  The only waitress i have seen can work the whole lunch by herself and does a great job.
I am sure we will be back again!

I'm still in love with Kaizen! I hadn't been back to Vegas in a year and a half. I wasn't about to skip going to a Kaizen before returning home. My boyfriend and I ordered the garden salad, octopus and cucumber salad, octopus sashimi, the tuna and shrimp in a cucumber roll, an avocado roll, and a chicken teriyaki roll. We love food! Everything was delicious, so much so that I was ready to go back the next day!! It's nice to get away from the craziness of the strip and have something so close by!

Took Yelp advice and this was the closest place to eat.   Couldn't print their coupons but they said they would honor them....NOT!!  We ordered sake bombs because we had coupons and they only honored one and called it a birthday coupon, after telling us both were free.  Food was good, presentation great, service not so amazing.  We aren't the Hard Rock crowd, but came for food and deserved better service.  The presentation was amazing and the sushi good, but the service lacked for us old ladies.

Food is always good service is excellent love the quaint and family atmosphere the Miso soup is excellent the curry the chicken bone and especially the sushi is always good my favorite is the Monster Sushi

This a a great little place off of the strip. Everyone on my group was craving sushi so we decided to hit this place because it was close, in a little shopping center across from the Hard Rock.  It's small but don't let that fool you.  We were quickly seated and orders were taken right away.  Talk about great sushi. Everything we had was great. I had a dragon roll and crunch roll. There prices are pretty good for the quality and size of your rolls.  Pineapple sakitini is a great cocktail to order.  

I almost forgot that they stay open until at least 4am everyday, a must for vegas if you are into hanging out late. So if you have a late night craving stop it.  If you haven't had enough to drink they have buy one get one free.
Great all you can eat, amazing Saké, have never tried a roll I didn't like ! Service is fast and friendly and location isn't too far into the strip but still great view of hard rock and other casinos

Outstanding customer satisfaction ... I don't say customer service because Kaizen sushi goes above just serving their customers they anticipate and satisfy every craving you might have..the sushi is phenomenal and the friendly smiles and sincerity  is beyond expectation... I am always so pleasantly surprised by the level of expertise and mastership of their craft that i am left euphoric every time i eat here
Our favorite sushi place! Spent 5 years in Japan - this is as close as it gets!! Fast service amazing fresh food!
Place was recommended by the Oyster House and its absolutely wonderful. Glad we tried it.

This place is awesome! I've been here a few times already and haven't been disappointed.. They have a variety of sushi rolls for everyone and it's worth every penny.. Taking another trip here with my girls the next time in Vegas!

This place is amazing!  A sushi place open until 6am? I thought it was a typo, but when we got here at 2am  and saw that it was open, we were in for a very pleasant surprise. We were not expecting great food,  but this place is so legit! Everything that we ordered from the menu has been great.  It is surprisingly not crowded considering how late it's open. Our server, Kate, remembered us from the night before and greeted us with own arms. I wish that they had a place like this in the Bay Area. I would go here everyday after work for sure!

Fresh fish good service nice buzzy ambience at a fraction of the strip prices. 
Amazingly broad selection of sushi rolls.
Two thumbs up!

the sushi was a'ite.. but way way way overpriced.  we've had better at an all you can eat joint.  

it's clean.. and the service is good,  but nothing wowed me or made it stand out... the names of the sushi were clever!  i'd probably never go back.  plus i think it's overpriced.

it was ok.
Fresh and delicious sushi walking distance from the Hard Rock Hotel. Extremely affordable price. I've been here over a dozen time in the last couple years. Highly recommended.

Yelp, you're fired. Four stars?! All I wanted was non-AYCE sushi, rated decently,  and near the strip. Jesus H. Christ! It's a fail when you come into a restaurant starving and you leave with everyone in your party invoking the Lord's name with his middle initial.*

Things started out okay with them seating us promptly. We drooled over the menu and ordered enough to feed every child in Botswana. It went downhill from there. The first piece of sushi, two pieces of uni, took almost an hour to get to our table. WE WERE WASTING VALUABLE GAMBLING TIME! Everyone at the craps table is depending on me to get back in the game.

The sushi man was a little stingy. It wasn't like I was ordering a 49 cent taco from Del Taco in South LA and then complaining to the cashier, and then to the manager that there wasn't enough meat in my sub-dollar taco, all the while getting approving "um-huh"s from my significant other standing behind me. You know? They could've been slightly more generous. 

What's funny is I think they were Thai. Thai reminds me of Thailand. Thailand reminds me of my vacation to Phuket. In Phuket, we journeyed to a steakhouse that was highly, I mean HIGHLY, rated by Tripadvisor. So I thinks, maybe we's getting a good deal on expensive steak. My partner orders a ribeye, bone-in, because that's how us gangsters roll. The waitress retorts, "Just to let you know, it's a little chewy." My partner responds, "What do you mean?" Waitress says, "Are you Malay?" My partner, looking confused, says, "No." Waitress replies, "Have you had a steak before?" HAHAHA. Okay, screw you guys. It was funny at the time.

ANYWAYZ. You're better off going to some of the better AYCE in Vegas and not stuffing your face. You'll pay the same amount, or less, and get better quality sushi.

*In almost a decade spent in church, they never taught me what what Jesus's middle initial stood for, although the whispers say it may be Herbert, but it wasn't from me.

Great sushi.  Terrible service.
The restaurant is set up very nicely.  We were seated in an elevated area between two other tables.  We waited about 10 minutes before any employee came by.  We were ready for drinks and to order when a server came to a table next to us (only because a diner at the table hollered for her to stop by).  She almost walked away when one of our diners asked her to come to our table because we were ready to order.  She told us she wasn't our server and would have him come to our table.
A couple minutes later, he arrived.  He suffered through taking our order.  He was writing it down, but we still had to repeat ourselves a couple times.  I had our drink order memorized at that point and slowly said it to him again.  Then we ordered about 7 different items.  We were really worried about getting the right items.  
The food began to come to us, before we got our cocktails.  I chose to wait a couple minutes for my drink before I started eating.  We ordered quite a few items, but I only tried a couple.  The cucumber salad was fresh, crisp and delicious.  I thought the beef sashimi was delicious, but my friend thought it was bland.  I had the chicken teriyaki roll and substituted with soy paper.  I highly recommend it.  Inside the roll is piece of chicken teriyaki, crab, avocado, and cucumber and they are placed on teriyaki sauce.  It was delicious!  The best part was the serving of chicken teriyaki with broccoli, mushrooms, and onions next to the rolls.  
4 cocktails and 7 dishes came out to about 90 dollars; not bad.  The funny thing was, when we wanted our bill, the gal who said she wasn't our server was able to bring us our check when we asked her to have our server do so.  Next time we're in Vegas and want sushi, we'll probably go here, but sit at the bar for more prompt service.
On a funny side note... one of the nearby diners was Carrot Top.
Great environment，fast service，foods are tasty, lots of choices. Sushi are delicious, I like it a lot. Must come back next time!

This place it's amazing the food and the service are awesome. Every time we come to the Platform show in August we have dinner here! You can't miss the Spicy Tuna Salad and the Avocado Train delicious. We were there last night a have a great time! If you stay at the Hard Rock it's waking distance!

By far a great experience,atmosphere and service. Stop in to just get a drink and a little bite to snack on and left full. We tried the egg rolls were crisp and fresh and light, also had the creamy shrimp with Wasabi sauce also nice app with the spicey sauce to go with it. The avocado train the last Vegas rolls all had amazing flavors. I would recommend for happy hr lunch or dinner the meet all the standards. It gets better the have dessert and also have specials on 1 thing from rolls to dessert of day I give 5 stars and highly suggest you come by David is a great host
Excellent sushi. Great for a little stop for a craving or an entire meal.

One of my favorite sushi has been made here:The  calamari roll.

This was my go-to place whenever I had a lunch break. They have good lunch specials. I would always get a katsu bowl ($8.95, I believe for the price).  It is pretty good and my favorite bowl that they have.  I have tried the beef bento-box that they offer but it was not very good.

The service is great, the host is very personable and knows my by name since I used to go there on a daily basis.  

Great atmosphere and the sushi chefs are great people you can have a conversation with!

Cool Sushi spot, right across the street from Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas.

I had sushi at this spot after a gig in Vegas at 4:00am in the morning. Place was jumpin' at 4am....lot's of people out eating sushi in the wee-early early morning hours. Kinda pricey...but if you're really craving sushi late night, this is the spot to go to.

Check my pic....this is one of the rolls I had, Bake Lobster Roll...was pretty good.

My personal favorite when in Vegas. Four of us went again tonight. Had four or five different controls, some sushi, some sashimi and even some oysters. As usual, everything was fantastic. Maybe a little less attentive than I'm used to Kama maybe could have improved on that but overall another great time at one of the best sushi restaurants in town

 I've been to this place on three or four occasions. It never lets me down. From the sushi to the sushi me to the cut rolls, this place is top-notch. I also like how it's not so formal. It's a place where you can be somewhat formal or completely laid back and just enjoy some amazing sushi

Food is alright, nothing special tho. The restaurant itself is beautiful and servers are very polite.
They're always checking on you.
They have a nice menu, nice sake selection. They're not expensive or crowded. It could be a very good restaurant.

Here's why I'm giving this place one star, hygiene. 
As soon as we sat down I noticed a piece of hair on the small soy sauce dish, not cool! But I decided to ignore it since my husband gave me his, as I was the only one who was going to eat.
A few minutes after we started eating I asked for paper napkins and as the server was bringing them to me one fell down on the floor. Surprisingly she picked it up and put it together with the other napkin she was bringing me... After giving me the clean and dirty napkin she took the dirty one with her saying it was dirty, and I honestly believe that if she knew we hadn't seen it she would have given me the dirty and the clean one. 
That was the end for me, I could barely finish my meal as I was disgusted.

It's a nice restaurant with good food but they could use hygiene.

Kaizen is a destination restaurant worth the flight to Vegas.  The sushi chefs are incredibly talented and come up with some really fresh combinations.  My favorite?  The Rose Roll!  Why?  Because it has no rice or seaweed, it's all fish wrapped in fish.  I have them add some jalapeños on top to give a bit of spice.  Amazing!  Fresh sashimi and nigiri, doesn't get better than this. Also the prices are super reasonable, we fed 9 people for less than $900 and this included drinks, food, sake etc.  Will go every time I'm in Vegas!

This is off the strip so it was decent.  It's located inside a plaza like corner with CVS, hookah joint and some other restaurant/stores.  The waitresses here were friendly and sat us down very quickly.  I ordered the rose roll and something else I forgot but it was good.  I do feel like it was a place to pick up hookers or something...

We came in the waiter was very friendly and professional. The seats are very comfortable! We had unicorn roll and chicken yakisoba. It is not our first time to this restaurant. This restaurant has always exceed our expectation!
Fun little place with good decor. Sushi is good. BIG variety to choose from. Orange Blossom is my pick. Reasonably priced. Strong on service.
Good sushi spot in Vegas with some innovative rolls. The restaurant has a good vibe away from the strip
This place is the worst.  I saw a cockroach running out of the kitchen and i don't blame him.  Same old strip mall sushi you can find on any streetcorner these days.

There are a few times in life where you stumble across a little gem. I just had this experience. I'm a sushi aficionado and going to the many sushi places I've been to, this one rates at the top! Beautifully presented yet so delicious you can't stop ordering another roll. I highly recommend this place and their 'Sexy Roll' and 'Rose Roll'. Pure genius. I'll be back.

While in town for a work convention my partner and I stopped by for dinner. We were on a budget due to being on work time. Fortunately we both had a decent amount of food for about $50. 
The sushi itself was a bit pricey; $8 for an order of salmon sushi. However, their cut rolls were the right price for the money. I had two full sized cut rolls for about 25. Not only was the price right, the chow was DAMN tasty. One roll had a house sauce made of a spicy mayo mix. YUM!!!
The one down fall was the sake. I didn't notice a house sake and the cheapest bottle was $10. Now please keep in mind I'm only criticizing this because I'm on the work budget. $10 for a bottle of good sake is very reasonable. I definitely recommend this place for the location; right off the strip; the price, the menu and the quality of the chow. DO IT!!!!

In essence...

No AYCE. Overpriced because it is so close to the Strip. $60+ with tip for 2 people.

My husband and I managed to land here for sushi on a Friday night. We did this because the line for Yama Sushi (which is my fave sushi spot in town) had a line waaaay out the door and to be honest I just did not want to wait that long. So. Enter Kaizen, which had good Yelp reviews, but alas, was somewhat of a disappointment. 

First with the good, the place LOOKS fabulous. Dark exterior, plays with lovely lighting and the tables are large with good spacing. Dinnerware and presentation is superb, but it better be since this place is so close to the Strip. Customer service is so-so. Although the entire staff yells as people enters/leaves, our service with food to our table was only okay. I ordered a hot green tea and it was brought out in a large cup, which I dislike because I enjoy my tea HOT. As it sits uncovered it cools down quickly and not once did a server ask to refill it. I prefer smaller cups and pots of tea for this reason.

Ordered:

- Edamame 
- California Roll
- Tuna Roll 
- Shrimp Roll
- Spicy Rainbow Roll
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll

Pluses - size of rolls at least (kind of) make you not feel so bad about how much you are paying and that you cannot get AYCE here. PLUS, again, presentation is great and sushi is very good quality. The only qualm I had was with the Tuna Roll being a bit on the warmer side when it arrived at our table than I would have liked.

My husband is a super picky sushi eater (hence the very plain rolls we had). The place does have some interesting rolls, the spicy rainbow roll was decent, and large, I'm glad I ordered it as it did fill me up.

BEST - Edamame, just stinking amazing for some reason. Served steaming, with a good amount of salt, and a LARGE portion.

Not the best... again, price wise you can find just as good sushi elsewhere and Vegas, except you don't have to pay for the atmosphere and Jay-Z music videos in the background.... HOLY GRAIL!!!
Nice lunch bento set and teriyaki bowl. The grill Saba fish is a must try! Nice, cosy and attentive staffs!

If you have read some of my other Vegas reviews, you will know that I am not local but I visit very often and for extended periods of time.  I also have a lot of friends who live in Vegas and work in the service industry.  As a result, I have tried a large number of sushi bars and restaurants both on and off Las Vegas Blvd.

A friend of mine who has lived in town for 18 years took us to Kaizen one night and we sat at the bar.  The food was pretty good, but nothing to write home about.  The nigiri was average, but the rolls we had were nothing special.  It might have just been the night we went, but something did not seem right with the items that came from the fryer (like the tempura).  One plus is that the price was fair and the place was open late.  The service was friendly, but a bit slow.  Overall, I will not likely go back.  With so many options, this restaurant failed to make an impression and for the price point, I prefer Hamada down the road.
This place is fantastic. Quick and friendly service, well priced, love the atmosphere, and the food is absolutely delicious! I will absolutely be coming back, and soon!

I have a 2 years baby and unfortunately they asked us to not feed him with the pasta plate we brought for him!
We were very disappointed since my wife had to go feed him in the car!
We spent over a 100$ and this is the last time for us there!

this is one of our favorite dinner hangout spots in vegas!!!

great hours, great location, great atmosphere, great service, great food/sushi! 

tons of sushi options and if you want something that isn't on the menu-- the chefs are great and will make whatever you want!

 can't wait to go back!!!!
Yum! Great garlic edamame, wonderful fresh sushi, and the ceviche was delicious. Cool vibe, creative menu.

Fabulous place. First time here with my wife and daughter. Clean and open space. Service was great, sushi was fresh and the cooked food was great.  Price is decent for the quality. We had agedashi tofu, chicken karaage, rainbow roll, calamari tempura roll, and a chicken teriyaki rice bowl.

Absolute best place in Vegas to grab the best sushi. Fish is always fresh and delicious and the staff is always friendly and very attentive. Also they always have great specials. So do yourself a favor, come eat here and dont forget to check out that board on the way in the door!!
This is our favorite sushi place locally! The staff is super friendly and you can customize the menu on AYCE- a rarity in any sushi restaurant.

Kaizen is a great sushi spot in Vegas that fits right into the lifestyle here as it is open until 4am on weekdays and 6am on weekends.  When I used to work on the strip Friday/Saturday and get off work at 4am we would always hit up this place routinely for some good food and a drink after work to wind down. 

They have a nice sushi bar inside and plenty of tables for small or large groups. The lighting is dimmed a bit and there is always music playing giving off a fun vibe. I've become friends with quite a few of the staff that work here.  Good people, good service. 

The food is really good and the rolls are good sized. They have some great rolls like Silver State, Orange Blossom, Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna, Avacado Train, Super White Tuna is really good too. Everyone I have ever taken to Kaizen from out of state while visiting us has really enjoyed it. 


There are a few Kaizen restaurants in Vegas but this one is by far my favorite. It is located right beside the Hard Rock Hotel 7 Casino.  When or if I start working on the strip at nightclubs again I will definitely be returning to Kaizen on the regular.
Walked across the street from HRH for a late lunch Feb 26th, and we're glad we did. Our favorite was the Spicy Rainbow Roll.  We enjoyed the hip music and videos that were on, too.

So we're in town and we think of w place to go to sushi at 4:21 am and where else but kaizen on the strip it's a chill atmosphere and our lyft drivers name was dyker and he was super chill. He go us here safe and did I mention he was chill.

This is one of my favorite places in Vegas. The ambience and food are the best. Definitely will come here every time I come to Vegas now! Also, they are open till 6am I've eaten here at midnight once and it was pretty busy, and 3 am they are still busy.

The service was horrible. The girlfriend and I decided to try this place since we were craving sushi and it was walking distance from our hotel. The food was mediocre. We will probably not try this place again.

my cousins, friends, and i each ordered the two for one drink special and shared a couple large hot sakes. in addition to our drinks, we ordered the calamari roll, kalbi rib roll, crazy boy roll, and a tako appetizer that also had cucumbers and vinegar (i forget it's name). we thoroughly enjoyed our late night meal! i love how pieces of what is in the roll is also on the side, so you can tell what you are eating and enjoy more food! also, when we were ready for our bill, our waitress told us that we still had one more beer from the two for one special. she didn't have to do that!

Very peaceful and possitive atmosphere,  This is are second time here, living in California. Every time we come to Las Vegas we just have to stop here. The sushi was fresh. My fiancée loves this place. Great service are waiter was very attentive and helpful both times that we've been here. The rolls are amazing. The parking situation could be a little hectic.

Such amazing flavor,  the staff was extremely friendly and very quick.   To say the food was outstanding is an understatement.   We had the Zenith roll,,  the orange blossom and sake.   Wow!!!!!!! 
We will be back and tell all our friends!!
Best sushi in the world!!!!! Now my favorite and it makes you happy because it's so cool inside! EAT HERE!!!!

Their sushi is nothing special and its rather over priced for what you get. The happy hour over at the Henderson location is better for getting drinks before hitting the club (10p-2a). The only thing this place has going for it is that it's open late.

A-OK sushi place located across the street from Hard Rock. The sushi prices are a little steep but im sure its because of the high rent location. The quality of the sushi was just ok and the decor was boring. The service was a little slow and had to order not from the sushi chef but a hostess/server. Dont think i will be back if i am in the area and want sushi.
The atmosphere was very nice. I liked the vibe of the place. The sushi was fresh and our waitress very kind. I would recommend it. Will be back when I'm in Vegas next time.
Great sushi place! I am hooked and it's right next to campus. I will definitely be back for more and I plan to bring many of my friends. This was a great choice for dinner

Even though the atmosphere is more like "club sushi" I still like this place.
I can put up with the big screen playing trendy music videos and the elevated volume for 3 reasons.

1. The fish was fresh, the rice was good and the selection of fresh fish sufficient!

2. They are open until 6am and I have another option for late night/early morning sushi cravings.

3. Great service!

Fun little sushi spot open late with a casual vibe.  I ordered salmon sashimi and the spicy tuna salad.  Both were delicious. My friend ordered a roll (maybe hardrock roll?) that had lots of fish and no rice which was also tasty.  My complaint is that the prices are too high for a casual sushi spot.  I would come here a lot more if they were more reasonable or if they had a better happy hour.  There are so many great sushi spots in town with better deals unless it's really late i'll probably go elsewhere.  The happy hour starts around midnight and is only 1/2 off on booze and not much discount on any food other than certain hand rolls.

In a word? 

Omnomnom...

Wait? Is that a word? It's a sound, for sure. And we made it a lot devouring our dinner at this great place!

Fresh, plentiful, tasty, creative. Oh man. I have a new favorite, fo' sho'. A little slower than some places (as others have pointed out) but worth it, I think. They take their time to make sure it's executed perfectly. Service with a smile and we lacked for nothing. 

The shitake mushroom roll was earthy and perfectly balanced with the crunch of veg and a touch of crispy tempura. Served with some tempura fungi on the side, and it's a complete dish! 

The Rose and White Rose rolls have been entered into my foodporn um, brain bank... ;) No rice (perfect for me): it's amazing fish, sauce, and a touch of veg here and there... WRAPPED IN MORE FISH. #winwin

We also had a soft-shell crab roll (the name escapes me and it's not on the online menu) that was similar. More fish wrapped in fish. Really. #happyMuse

We had a few other rolls, including the Rock and Roll, the Firecracker, a crunchy scallop roll (served with additional panko-breaded scallops! Yum!), and an unagi/avocado roll. All very, very good. The sauces were not overly used - Bonus points! - just enough to go with the flavor profiles they were trying to create. No sauce-drowned fishies here!

To taste the fish on its own (as Bentern says in his review, without the "tacky" sauce), we did order some nigiri including salmon, tuna, and uni. The uni, my favorite but not that of my dining companions, was fresh, sweet, and perfect. Always a great sign of a great place, IMHO.

Again I have to point out that I like that they don't pack their rolls with rice (and have a LOT of non-rice options). The menu is *extensive* (the online menu is a fraction of the options you actually have). In addition to the sushi and sashimi, they offer some entrees as well.

I don't mind a lack of AYCE because I don't eat enough to make those "deals" worth it. However, I could see the draw in having something here... They can be on the pricey side. That said, Friday night we had a hell of a meal between the three of us... a ton of great food, a couple cucumber salads (meh... just a lot of cucumber in a martini glass... wasn't impressed), some soup, and all those rolls. For... 70ish bucks? Three people? Not bad at all for what you are getting.

And now I am hungry... Dinner, anyone?

Nice atmosphere, service, and food. Not too far off the strip to save a little $$$. Great for lunch. Try the Kiss of Fire if you are into spicy rolls. Our servers were very attentive and brought our food promptly. You can't go wrong especially if you are staying in Hard Rock.

This place is phenomenal and open super late night.  The quality is breathtaking and it won't break the bank.   I strongly urge you to try the kiss of fire.  They say it's super spicy but it's perfect and not to hot.  There are more expensive sushi places, I'm looking at you Nobu, but they aren't worth the extra scratch.  Come here when in Vegas.  It's across the street from the hard rock and it's skipping distance to the double down saloon.  Great service and great ambience.  Come hungry! The portions are big.  

Also don't just focus on the awesome sushi, their dinner plates, particularly the fresh fish, are worth ordering and are quite memorable.

I have sushi several times this week in Vegas and this is far and away the best that I have had. Tastes amazing (ask for the fresh wasabi!) doesn't break the bank and is super fast. I was incredibly impressed. I will happily drive from LA to eat here.  So good!

Average sushi at best.  We ordered yellowtail appetizer, Kai roll, Salmon killer, and Kiss of Fire rolls.  Good but not remarkable.

Service was basic.  Recommendations were not anything more than pointing to a menu.

Even the recommended Chocolate truffle dessert was average.

This is our second dining experience at Kaizen Fusion Roll. We we very happy with the friendly service and the wonderful rolls. We drive in from Boulder City but it is worth the drive and we will come in more often. We tried 3 different rolls and each was excellent. Experiment, you won't go wrong!
Awesome food and many varieties of sushi and other items. Service is excellent always greeted as soon as you enter the door and a nice place to go late night.

It's open til 4 am!!!  I love that it's close to the strip so I can satisfy my late night sushi cravings after partying in the clubs.  

My favorite roll is the First Kiss Roll.  It's kinda expensive at $15 but it's SOOOOOO good.  Besides that, the only thing I really get is the $5 spicy tuna rolls.   

Gone here many times and it never disappoints me, except for the one time where it was 3:40am and last call was at 3:30am =(

This place is amaaaaaaazing!!! The rolls came out fast, they were reasonably priced & they had amazing green apple flavored sake.. It was so smooth you couldn't taste any alcohol!

Service was great, atmosphere was nice, they play music videos in a huge screen, and they also have large tables for groups, as well as private tables for couples.

I'd definitely come here again, their menu is large with a lot of great choices!!

First time here! Decided to take a break from the casino fare and walked over after reading some yelp reviews.was definitely not disappointed! I had the sashimi special ...8 pieces of chefs choice sashimi and choice of California or spicy tuna roll.The sashimi was amazing. Fresh and buttery with perfectly cooked rice. The Spicy tuna roll was delicious as well and wasn't rice heavy. My friend ordered the baked salmon roll, polished it off and immediately ordered another! They also get points for being open until 4am. Try it out!
Those is our goto place for sushi in Vegas.  You can walk across the street from Hard Rock.  Great rolls, great sushi.  Cooked foods are great too.  Highly recommended!

My previous Vegas trip on Aug 2010 a group of my friends (living in Sin and HI) and I came here. And being from Hawaii we are exposed to excellent sushi, so I already knew I wouldn't find it as high-quality as I would back home. BUT it actually was pretty decent. The prices where very reasonable to for how good, big and fresh it was.

I tried the "First Kiss" being raved about from my friends which was exactly what they claimed. I also tried the salmon and hamachi negiri. 

I'll be sure to hit this spot up again on this years Vegas trip!
This sushi is the best in Vegas! Awesome service. The freshest fish. We go here all the time.
I don't yelp... but this place was so good I am sitting at the table writing how amazing the sushi is! Screw Nobu. Walk across the street!
Good service, I like chicken Katsu. Green tea ice cream and red bean ice cream is good. Fast service.
I came in around 230p on a Monday so the place was not busy.  Service was good.  The California roll broke too easily but the salmon, tuna and unagi sushi were decent.  Green tea ice cream was good.

First Impressions:
Clean place. Nice decor. Good atmosphere. They have a TV.
It's a nice and quiet place, but there weren't many people there, so it might be different when it's packed.

About me:
I'm Japanese. I love sushi. I go out to eat sushi once a month or so by myself. I was in Vegas just for the weekend.

Summary:
I went at around 8:30 pm, and they were out of uni & toro. I ordered mainly nigiri sushi and not much stood out. I also got the chicken katsu, which wasn't bad but nothing special.
Food: 3/5 - Average
Service: 4/5 - Good
Overall: 3/5

Review:
I went at around 8:30pm on a Sunday night with a friend. I made a reservation twenty minutes beforehand, but the place was almost empty when we arrived. The first things I always order at a sushi bar are toro and uni. They were both out, but it was 8:30pm, so it was understandable.

I started out with albacore belly, mackerel, salmon, ikura, and tuna. I usually always order albacore belly, mackerel, and salmon as they're a few of my favorite sushi. The ones I had here weren't bad, but they didn't taste great either. I was here with a friend who doesn't eat sushi as often, so I ordered the tuna (something common) and ikura (slightly obscure) for him as well. The tuna and ikura tasted better than I expected, but my expectations were set a little low after eating their albacore belly, mackerel, and salmon. I may have ordered something else as well here, but I'm drawing a blank.

I didn't want the bill to get too large, so I ordered chicken katsu to share with my friend. The chicken katsu was a little thin, and they were cut into pieces the size of a pencil (in terms of thickness/width). This is personal preference, but I preferred the pieces to be a little fatter/wider.

I wanted to finish off the night with some more sushi, so I asked the sushi chef for a recommendation and ordered the madai. It was actually pretty good. Possibly the best sushi of the night. I ended up ordering another serving.

The bill came out to be ~$100 for the two of us, which is average for a sushi place (not too cheap, not too expensive). I paid $60 ($10 tip) for the meal.

During the meal, the waitress made sure I didn't run out of my tea (she asked if I would like more when I was low), so that was nice. She also asked us multiple times how our meal was going. So the service here was pretty good.

Conclusion:
It's a decent sushi place, but it wasn't good enough to make it a go-to sushi bar every time I'm in Vegas. I think it's worth exploring other options.

Food: 3/5 - Average
Atmosphere: 4/5 - Good
Service: 4/5 - Good
Overall: 3/5 (weighed on food score)

Other thoughts:
I went to a sushi place in San Diego called Sushi Ota about a month prior to visiting Kaizen Sushi in Vegas. The sushi at Sushi Ota tasted incredible, so it raised the bar for my future sushi outings. I may have rated Kaizen Sushi higher if I hadn't visited Sushi Ota.
another one of my great finds! just like firefly. delicious!  if ur in vegas, def plan a pit stop.

It's pretty disheartening that I've had my favorite roll, to date, a thousand miles from home. 

Went to Vegas in March and stayed at the Hard Rock. The fella and I had a craving for sushi, and found Kaizen in the strip mall right across the street. We strolled over and proceeded to order an obscene amount of food. Everything was good, until we got the Kiss of Fire, which was AMAZING! Nevermind that we already scarfed down 3 rolls, tempura, edamame, and nigiri  - we HAD to have another one. That good.

The atmosphere here was nice. Clean, modern, bright. The service was great. The price was definitely reasonable. If I lived in Vegas, I'd be there pretty consistently. 

Seriously. Go. And if you don't order the Kiss of Fire - you're just dumb.

We stopped by for dinner. Elegant atmosphere, modern, attentive service. We asked for the chef's recommendation and very quickly the roll Kiss of Fire appeared along with 10-piece sashimi. The roll has slices of jalapeño and a dab of hot sauce, and along with a vinegary sauce was full of flavor, without completely masking the flavor of the tuna, which had a fresh, buttery texture. 

The sashimi tasted fresh, nice texture without any gristle and interesting sauces. Our favorite was yellowtail with a wasabi sauce. 

Tempura green tea ice cream was perfect, firm ice cream with just the right thickness of batter. 

Service was quick, friendly and polite. I think we are coming back tomorrow :)
This place rocks! We were starving and in a hurry. Super fast service and delicious fresh fish! Very nice staff as well. We will be come back

Great food and great service.   The place is located right next to cvs.  Clean environment and the severs are very pleasant.  Although my friends did complain it was a little costly but I thought the price was fair for the area.
I don't normally write reviews but this is the best sushi that I've had in years.  Try one of the restaurant's special rolls.

As a local, I usually stick to what I know, especially when it comes to sushi..my boyfriend and I found this place during our "staycation"..we have come back again and again. The prices are great, hip vibe, excellent sushi menu. We have never ordered the same thing and are very pleased with our yummy choices!! This is our new "go to" place when I don't want to cook :)

Thanks Yelp for helping me find this great sushi place! The flavors were wonderful and the fish was so fresh. Gotta say it was much better than a lot of places at my home town...and I'm right by the ocean!  The service was excellent; friendly and fast. Love that it's open super late, too. Will definitely be back next time in Vegas!

The service was excellent!  Servers came many times to refill water and check on our meals.  The food was exceptional, restaurant was very clean and the atmosphere was perfect!  We were impressed with the quality of the food for the price. Definitely a great spot for sushi!

Across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel, this place is totally convenient and super yummy. They have a ton of fun rolls to share, including a few no-rice rolls that low carb LA-eaters interested in drinking their calories in Vegas can appreciate (myself included).

Of course, I recommend the HARD ROCK ROLL and the SPICY TUNA SALAD that has huge chucks of tuna and nice, light dressing.

5 stars for being the only sushi restaurant open so late (conveniently across from the Hard Rock!)  The service was on point when I went and the food came out very quickly.  Only downside I see is that there aren't any private tables.  The Saketinis were delicious! I tried the pomegranate and lychee and would highly recommend the lychee.  The rolls were delicious, and if youre a raw food/sashimi fanatic, definitely try out the Rose Roll!  My server was very attentive and continuously checked in/out with me and my SO.  If you're drunk or hungry at 2AM and you're looking for an amazing sushi restaurant, then stop by at Kaizen!

I am in love with this place! From the ambiance to the food; I have no complaints. I have been going here for about 3 years now & have had my birthday here twice. I work as a hostess at a restaurant on the strip and get off pretty late at night, so it is very convenient that it is open til 3 or 4 am. The staff are all friendly and accommodating; I usually dine at the sushi bar and always have a great time with the sushi chefs. The decor is modern and fun, which is a nice change from your typical sushi restaurant. The pricing of the items are reasonable and not too expensive which is nice. Everyone should definitely try the baked New Zealand mussels; I get them every time.

Kaizen Is not the cheapest sushi spot out there but the service and quality of the food makes up for the price. They're happy hour is on every night from 10pm to 2am and If you go on they're website you can print out a coupon to get a free Saki Bomb with a purchase of 15 dollars or more.

Seguimos novamente a indicação do Yelp.

Nossa melhor experiencia em Las Vegas em termos de Sushi.

If you're a tourist looking for sushi this is only 1 of 2 places farily close to the strip. It's open til 4am Sun-Thurs & til 6am on Fri & Sat. They have quite the selection of rolls. However the rolls are a bit smaller than other sushi places I've been to. The food is good though & comes out rather quickly regardless of what the wait staff tells you. The wait staff is a bit slow at times even when it's not peak hours. Try a saketini if you get a chance they taste a bit like sangria. If you're like me & order a Sapporo you expect it to come w/ a beer glass chilled not a Modelo Especial glass. Deduction of points on that fro me. The atmosphere is well lit. You can sit at a booth area or at a table. The tables are picnic style so you could be rubbing elbows w/ neighbors during busier hours. 
If you're a local this place a bit pricier than other sushi restuarants for less of the food. Again great food, just need to eat more to be full. Normally 2 rolls & an app w/ a beer will fill me up. It took 3 rolls & an app w/ a beer to fill me up here. 
Tried 9 rolls last night out of our group:
Shrimp Killer - Good
Spicy Rainbow Roll - VERY GOOD
Teriyaki Roll - Not so good
Silver State Roll - SO GOOD
Dragon Roll - ok
Avacado Roll - ok
Tiger Roll - Good
Firecracker - SO GOOD

Was there last nite. Friend took me to this place for a light dinner. The food was great and the price was reasonable. He has some sushi and steak and the screaming salad was delicious. Your money is worth at this place. Not to crowded maybe because it's a Thursday but no doubt I really enjoyed the food. Thanks for a nice dinner.
I recommend the avocado train. It has lobster and soft shell crab. Has all my favorite things in sushi rolls in one!

3.5

we were craving raw oysters.. again. gosh, what is it about Vegas that makes me crave oysters all the time!?

we stopped in for a light meal. we got a plate of sashimi ($20), a roll, and of course, oysters (5pc for $12). 

the roll was just okay.. not to mention the spicy mayo was sweet (ew?) .. however! that plate of sashimi must have been one of the freshest and tastiest sashimi i've had. this was also my second time having yellowtail sashimi in vegas and i must say, Vegas gets shipped some darn good yellowtail. seeee ya tuna

our oysters were pretty good too but i like mine naked, how most oyster bars do them. Kaizen puts a little green onion, the orange eggs, and a ponzu sauce. still yummy and satisfying!

i'd definitely come back here again but only if im in the area for undftd/stussy or staying at the hard rock hotel.  also, come at night.. i think theyre popular for their sake specials during that time!
It is close to the hotel and convenient.  It fulfills food needs and in a tasty fashion.  But compared to other sushi places it is ok.  Let's leave it at that.

Kaizen has a pretty big selection of rolls, and some quite different from other places in town. They also have a great spicy garlic edamame which was hot and fantastic! I would definitely like to try more of the rolls as I like the unusual ones. I would need a few more tries to see if I might become more of a regular here.

When I think sushi  in vegas I think Kaizen. Fresh fish, tangy ginger, and a standout staff. Couldn't ask for more!

The only downside was the temperature, it was rather chilly inside so bring your coats cause you'll probably  shiver.

Have fun during your Vegas getaway, and make sure to stop by!

Go for the avocado train if you're a fan of avocados like I am. From the outside it looks every other strip mall in Vegas. Whether you go 2pm or 2am, it's a funky nite-club with cute decor and great music! 
They are clever with their roll combination.  I can be funny about eating raw fish but this place dishes up some of the freshest seafood. Not bad for being in the middle of the desert!

Came in on a Sunday evening for dinner and was greeted well and seated quickly. Not a super busy place during the evening/dinner time which is nice because we needed someplace low-key to eat. Being from the Pacific Northwest, I am picky with seafood and sushi and I was impressed with the sushi here. The tuna was very fresh and the roll was made well. My friend got salmon and it was delicious and fresh. The price is not crazy which is also what attracted us here. Overall great place to have a low-key dinner.

I saw the amazing reviews and really craved sushi so I came here with my mom. I hardly go to vegas so I'm not familiar with anything. Everything on the menu looked really good and sounded appetizing. Or it could've been that I was starving. We ordered a few plates. The seared salmon appetizer was way too salty. I had to tell them to take it back. And all the items on the menu was mainly tuna. Halfway eating I was starting to get sick of the smell and taste of tuna. This experience wasn't what I hoped for. If I'm ever in vegas, I probably wouldn't come back.

Fresh and delicious sushi! If you don't want to spend lots of money at the casino sushi bars or at Nobu@Hard Rock (which is across the street) go to Kaizen. They have a GREAT AMBIANCE!, cool vibe and current music/videos! They have a long sushi bar with a couple of plasma TV's where you can watch sports. The menu has many options- our favorite was the roll that had salmon, macadamia nuts, avocado and jalapeno! YUM!  DO NOT GO TO Yokohama for sushi which is diagonally across the street. I don't know why it got so many good reviews. Go to Kaizen...you won't be disappointed.

I love this place...they are open late and also they have HAPPY HOUR FOR ALCOHOL after midnight on week day...Food is very good 
I love T.T GIRL roll

While visiting LV, my friends and I really wanted to eat some sushi. The first place we "found" seemed to either not be open or no longer in business, but just our luck Kaizen was right across the street. They have a fun atmosphere and a sizable menu. I couldn't decide what to pick!  I chose a few interesting rolls, and they were very good. 

Good job Kaizen!
Not as tasty as i like.

Nope, not buying it... Non japanese sushi joint with large screen tv playing hip hop music video... Why???? Nice interior though. I usually don't like to give negative reviews... but this wasn't my place (sorry).

Came here late night to eat with the family.
About 5 couples, a family of 4, and 3 people at the bar. Waitress sat us down immediately but after 15 mins no one came to acknowledge that we were even here.
No "hello I'll be with you shortly", no "can I start you guys with some drinks", NOTHING.
I get that there's only three of you, but why bother sitting down somebody you're not even gonna take care of?
Obviously the visit was already at a bad start and I was not happy, after getting the waitress' attention, the one that sat us down -- she asks "has anyone helped us?" LIKE SERIOUSLY?!!!
After 15 mins you FINALLY noticed?!
Food was a hit and miss. 
But honestly it was really hard to enjoy the whole experience with the terrible service provided. A revisit is unfortunately not in the near future..

If I could give it 3.5 stars I would! I will start on a positive note, the tuna nigiri melted in my mouth and the service was tag team so never had to ask for any refills. I ordered a few rolls, the ingredients were fresh but it just missed the mark. When you've had exceptional sushi in all parts of the US you know what your looking for. This place may be fun for late night or actually any time if your goal is to lap up the liquids as there was a really rowdy table in the place at 6pm. Lots of colorful loudness while one eats sushi, not my thing!
Great place & very friendly service, I highly recommend this place. Love the rainbow roll and spicy garlic edamame.

Great spot. I been here many times and definitely recommend it.  Food is fresh and service is always excellent. 
They have a late night happy hour.
