This is our to go spot while we are in Vegas. It is a very hip place and it is right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel. The food is excellent and the service is good as well. Will we return? Yes, it is our Vegas sushi place.

After my husband has raved for years about this place, I go a 2nd time to see if I will finally like it. It is AVERAGE. The tastes of rice, crab, fish are pretty flavorless. And the fact that this is not AYCE, their portions should be a lot bigger. This place tastes like an average AYCE place -nothing special. The one nice thing are the hours. At 2 in the morning we wanted sushi and went here. I guess if you're walking by this place and want some sushi, go. But otherwise you are missing absolutely nothing.

By simply crossing Paradise Road, I'm pretty sure we ate two or three times the amount of sushi we would have received for the same price in the Hard Rock. 

Service was SUPER fast. That probably contributed to why we kept ordering roll after roll... we arrived hungry, and the food emerged as each dish was ready, seemingly two beats after we'd spoken the words. Delicious spicy hamachi, tuna sashimi in garlic ponzu, rainbow roll, unagi, various maki of salmon persuasions, I could go on... The vegetarian among us was also pleased with her rolls. I was quite impressed with the freshness of the fish (a feat of modernity I've never gotten over since inhabiting landlocked states).  

Even after several add-ons to our orders, sake for the table, and mango mochi, the total bill was still impressively moderate. Unless your heart is set on Nobu, give Kaizen a try. Just be careful of those speed-demons tearing across Paradise.
Excellent sushi, fabulous salad and soup.  Peaceful atmosphere.  Will definitely be back.

Sushi was ok but one of the nigiris had bone in it and we saw a bug next to our table :( the toro was 20 dollars for 2 pieces which was too much in my opinion because it didn't even taste like anything special or mind blowing. This place I believe is overpriced and overrated !!! I would've given 3 stars because the other sushi was good but service was slow and they weren't even busy that day :(

I love this place, my favorite sushi in Las Vegas.  The mango lobster roll is fantastic.  Only negative is that sometimes it can get weird in there as drunks from the Hard Rock wander in.

Important tip: After midnight, bottles of booze are two-for-one.
First time trying a sushi place out in Vegas! Green chili tempura is super good highly recommend trying out this place if your in the area!!!

I go to this place a few times a month for dinner because of the tasty food, shockingly good services and reasonable prices. Always stuffed by the time I leave.

Made the decision to go there for lunch and was happily surprised with their lunch menu.

Although I ordered my regular Chicken Teriyaki bowl, my friends ordered the "boxes" which is only available at lunch. Will order the Box next time since you get a lot of different types of food for the same price.

Love this restaurant!!!
TUNA POKE WAS AMAZING. Sushi was fresh and sashimi pieces were nice and thick. Everything was on point  even for being open til 4am
Came here late starving. Sat down and ordered. Food came unbelievably fast with great quality. Definitely exceeded my expectation! Recommended!

A great solid place for sushi, and even better for lunch. The bento boxes are probably the best deal on the menu in terms of quality, quantity and price. The thing that threw me off was the tempura shrimp bento was solid minus the tempura part. Instead of traditional tempura batter, they used the same batter as that of the chicken katsu which was a big let down for me as it was not as I had expected. My girlfriend had the pork katsu which bowl which was excellent as I picked off her plate as well as mine. If your in the area, give this place a try. I do hope though the tempura shrimp thing was a fluke and it was because they ran out of the proper batter. Otherwise, it would be a big strike against them as far as I am concerned.
I go to Kaizen Sushi about once a week and I love their food I recommend anybody looking for a good sushi place to go there and their prices are very reasonable

High quality fish, fusion cuisine. Their sushi is incredible!!! Good selection of wines.Very good service , cozy atmosphere. Expansive, but reasonable if you take into account organic ingredients. Furniture must be updated / changed as soon as possible. We go there for good food and willing to pay the price , stays open for industry till 4... give it a shot.

The Rose roll is something else.  Seriously.

I went here with my cousin because he raved about the place for a long while, claiming it was the best sushi he's ever had.  Since he's from the West Coast and I'm a Midwesterner, I decided I had to see about this for myself.  Not sure if it was the saki bomb or the sushi itself, but damn, it was good.  A little on the pricey side for what you get, hence the 1 star reduction.  I guess that's in comparison to the sushi prices I'm used to in places that aren't Vegas, so it's probably good for Vegas prices.  But I'll definitely be back if I ever find myself in Vegas again, as unlikely as that is.

Good quality and creative interpretations.  Ambiance was good for a social gathering on a Monday night, but not too loud. The limited beer and saki selection was the only gripe I had, but by no means a show stopper.
AMAZING! I would definitely come back here when I visit Vegas!!! Dragon roll and kiss of fire is delish!

This place was AMAZING :) 

The sushi chefs were personable, friendly and had some awesome sushi recommendations :) 

The restaurant was clean, had a great atmosphere, good bar selection and fabulous service.

Must try the avocado train and orange blossom roll
Sat at the bar.  A bit of a wait, but great food and friendly service.  Sake and sushi!

First time here and I have to say it's all around refreshing! The restaurant is very spacious (along with contemporary decor/furnishing) with a bustling atmosphere. Food was fresh and the cuts were truly silky and smooth, I had the screaming "O" with seared tuna. If you don't like heavy sauce ask for the spicy ponzu mayo dressing on the side instead of on top. The garlic edamame is the BOMB (olive oil, crushed garlic, a little shoyu stirr fried with FRESH crisp edamame --straight and to the point). All the waiters were super helpful and did not leave me unattended. Side note it doesn't hurt that there bathroom is even squeeze clean. Not an AYCE place (for all the fish lovers out there (:  )  but this is a place where the quality overshadowed quantity (but forreal i love AYCE with quality too haha) I will definitely make another trip again soon!
Food is absolutely amazing! Not an AYCE and somewhat pricey but the quality is well worth it. Try the shrimp tempura. It's the best I've had in Vegas.
Beautiful location and really close to campus.   The food was fresh, the hostess very kind, and the lunch special had healthy portions.  I'd definitely come again.

Wasn't really in the mood for sushi after a long week in Vegas working a trade show, but my pal saw Kaizen in Yelp, and insisted we go. Quiet at 8ish on a Wed. evening (thankfully; woulda had NO patience for a loud party scene that night). The drinks were great and the food was remarkable--fresh, beautifully presented, unusual combinations--all delish. I will definitely return!
Don't bother going here. The workers were rude and unprofessional, the miso soup was old, and the sushi was too fishy and just off. There's too many better places to eat then here.

I wish I could say that I was drunk and stumbled upon this sushi joint... but instead, I came here to grab a take-out lunch while I was staying at the Hyatt Hotel supervising a group of tourists to a trip to Vegas.  It would have made it much more entertaining if I did.

In any case, Kaizen Sushi is not a bad place to get your sushi fixing in Vegas.  They specialize in fusion rolls, so right off the bat, you know that you should focus more so on them instead of simply nigiri or sashimi.  The atmosphere inside reminded me of a very fancy bar, both very dark and roomy.  They have a pretty sweet deal for those night owls (or those trying to be) where much of their food becomes half off.  Considering that this place is open late, this place is definitely for those post-clubbing events.

For my mini lunch, I ordered the Calamari Tempura Roll, which came out to be about $8.  I love eating fried squid, and was interested in seeing their take on combining it into a sick sushi roll.  What I really loved about this roll was that even though it came in only five pieces, they gave me the extra calamari on the side.  It also came with a sweet dipping sauce.

My roll was okay.  Nothing to rave about to be honest, but it was a good way for me to get my sushi fixing for the day.  Everything else on the menu seems to be way overpriced, especially in Vegas when there are so many other eating bargains out there.

Definitely worth a try, but go ahead and gamble at Hard Rock and make some moolah first before you come here.  Then you can fest like a KING/QUEEN!

Parking is available outside in the plaza.

Always come here for some late night sushi. Amazing service and great sushi.

When you order expect your food to be prepared right away, no downtime or waiting like other places. 

When you walk in you are greeted nicely and feel comfortable with the atmosphere.
Great food with excellent atmosphere! Really recommend the spicy tuna roll. Love the music videos playing on the wall and the bench styled seating
Teriyaki chicken bowl you can't go wrong ! I may have had this dish about a dozen times . It's big very filling and extremely tasty . For the price you definitely can not go wrong .
The fish doesn't taste fresh and it's a little over priced for the quality. The service is friendly

Hands down an awesome sushi bar! We were staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and saw this place across the street. Boy are we glad we tried it. The menu was a bit overwhelming since it was our first time there. The server was very nice and great service. She made a few suggestions and they were so good! Their prices are typical of sushi places. Anywhere from $10 and up per roll. 

We tried a baked scallop roll that was full of scallops. The don't skimp on their ingredients and I love that. I tired a lobster and crab roll wrapped in halibut...FRESH! We also tried their banana roll. Different because it was slightly sweet and savory. 

I love the fact that there are real Japanese people working there and making sushi. Maybe it makes it feel more authentic. You just feel like you get the whole experience versus a Mexican guy making the sushi for you. Even though he probably has no problems making delicious sushi.
This is a great sushi bar.  Very creative rolls, great atmosphere and acceptable service.
Delicious sushi! I got the combo and couldn't finish it, and I've never been unable to finish sushi.

Great fast service, awesome selection of speciality rolls. I'm a sushi fanatic and I have no complaints. My favorite was the sunshine roll and the rock and roll roll. Give them a try you won't be disappointed!

My favorite sushi bar in Las Vegas! Open all night (I think until 5 or 6 AM!  Very friendly, cool atmoshphe3re, great music and of course FANTASTIC fresh sushi! I have been here several times and it never disappoints. In a good area across from Hard Rock. Reasonable prices, great drinks... the only thing I would suggest is that they put seat cushions on the middle tables... they are cool but seats are hard!

came here by accident. the  korean bbq place nearby was closed. but turns out this place aint too shabby.  i love the decor and with our big group of 15+, we sat at the long tall table by the door.  i can't review what everyone else had but my ahi tuna salad was BOMB! too bad it didn't stay in my stomach long =\

the service was good probably due to the fact that we went during lunch time when it was pretty much dead.

Unique sushi like giant clam and abalone sushi..I didn't  like eating either one of them. The giant clam just didnt have much flavor. The abalone was like eating cartilage.

The fatty  tuna was good and some kind of fish belly sashimi was good. Service was soooo slow in the beginning. It took forever just to get started with our beer/sake. The sashimi is a bit better than an average place, but not great. Uni was not fresh. Sweet shrimp was not that great ($28 for 4 pieces).

We ordered 3 bottles of sake and 2 bottles of beer for 11 people. We couldn't finish 1 of the bottles of sake and asked if we could return it. They were ok with it.

Ok let start off that this place is probably where they invented sushi and the Japanese stole the idea from this establishment can't tell you how many times I go to this place everytime I go to Vegas but the amount of different sushi rolls they have are very unique

Happy Hour on drinks start at midnight Monday through Thursday and it's the best place to go and get budget stuff I do my sake bombs and then head out to the club after

Here are the things I tried so far
Bbq roll - out of this world

Great place for the afterclub drunken munchies or lunch with the parents! I can't help but always ordering a snow corn roll and a scallop dynamite. This was the place that put "Vegas Sushi" on the map for me and distinguished it from sushi restaurants in ANY other city.

This place is amazing! Came back two days in a row since we enjoyed it so much! The salmon cheese stick appetizer is super yummy. There is a good selection of rolls. I enjoyed the Unicorn the most. Great teriyaki as well, and better than your typical. 
The service and atmosphere is great for families and date nights. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone, and am sad that we don't live closer.

This place is great. The way it's decorated gives it a really nice ambiance. The vibe made us wanna stay there longer just to chill. The service was great. And of course the sushi was fresh and delicious! The portions are big and the presentation is excellent.

Seriously underwhelmed. I came here after seeing numerous good reviews for this place. Wow, all I can say is wow this place was terrible. For starters I think it's in bad taste when they add mandatory gratuity for service. I feel a tip should be based on the service provided, which was decent but not out of this world. The iced green tea tasted like fish water. Waitress tried to tell me they add some special leaves or whatever but fish is fish is fish and that tea tasted like fish!!! The short ribs were greasy and burnt. The other rolls were decent but nothing I would come back for. Matter of fact we were left so unsatisfied we're on our way to get tacos now after leaving this place!
Very nice sushi experience with reasonable prices for Vegas. Cute atmosphere for a casual date. Off the beaten trail but well worth it.

First time coming here.
Service was friendly.
The rolls were so good!
A little on the pricey side but well worth it!

We ordered the avocado train which was my favorite.
It is avocado lobster soft shell crab and crab. 
I had my usual spicy tuna roll. 
And we had a rainbow roll.
We then asked for another roll that they recommend.
He made us the orange blossom I believe it was called. 
It was great too!

The menu is huge, wait staff is amazingly helpful and the food is great.  Excellent atmosphere, open late, happy hour Sunday through Thursday buy one get on on the drinks from 10p-4am!  Second time here and will return when in town!

We went here one night very late.... though it's more expensive than other sushi restaurants we like here in vegas it was delicious. We indulged in a couple bottles of sake and had some of their rolls and sashimi. This place is a classier atmosphere, definitely a good place to bring a date. But as far as pigging out on Sushi... I wouldn't go too hungry unless you want to get a big bill.
Great sushi, good atmosphere. Unusually odd music choice (DJ techno dance music? Insert gag reflex here. Was i supposed to BYO Molly?) but it IS Las Vegas so what do you expect?
This place is super legit! Probably some of the best sushi I ever had! Parking is really accessible and it's only a short ride off the strip. Do yourself a favor and come on over!
Food is great. Spicy salmon salmon was great. Service was fast and pleasant. Will visit again.

2 for 1 happy hour from midnight to 4am Sunday to Thursday is great!  Prices are a little higher than I had hoped but they made up for it with the portions there.  Easily the best late night sushi place I've been to in Vegas and I plan on going back soon.  Its closer than "I Love Sushi" in Henderson which is my fav so I will just come here when I can't schlep it all the way over there.

I was so skeptical, as I am a total buffet girl when it comes to Vegas.  I've heard any other ethnic cuisine in Vegas is absolutely disgusting... but this place proved me incorrect.  The baked scallops in their sauce was so good.  No words can describe it.  We walked over (not a great idea, but we were hungry and didn't want to wait in the cab line) from Hard Rock after partying it up at Center Bar (awesome time too) and ate there at 4:30 in the morning.  I especially liked the cheers we got when we walked in, looking awesome I'm sure, after a night of excessive drinking and partying.  The place is a like a club that serves sushi.  There is a deejay spinning tunes and with the exception of the sushi bar, most of the restaurant is dark.  The food though, was absolutely fantastic.

Well I have mixed feelings about this place. It's close to my apartment so that was a plus. Looks nice and upscale inside. What took it back down was the wooden chop sticks. I think if you go upscale make the chopsticks upscale too and stop cutting down trees. The menu is huge!!!! 

Ok so the BBQ roll isn't good to me. The meat was chewy. Too chewy I swallowed many bites whole because I couldn't break it down. Crunchy roll was good. Tried the crazy boy it was interesting. Not bad but I just didn't like it. I had ordered the Katsura roll to try it but it never came. They charged me for it and then I told them I never got it. They took it off. 

Ok so here is where I get picky. One if I order something bring it to me. Two 3 different people came up to our table asking if we are done eating and paid yet. Seriously I ordered rolls a few times relax and let me eat or wait for the goof.  When I'm done eating I'll let you know. And three when we walk in and I tell you we want a table instead of sushi bar don't suggest the sushi bar over and over.

Sit at the sushi bar and you will immediately notice that something is off. The counter height is at least a half-a-foot too high - check it out.

Their spicy crab hand roll ($5.50) looked something out of a scary anime movie. It was a crumpled up sheet of imitation crab soaked in a warm red mystery sauce sloppily stuffed into a sheet of nori. By the time it was handed to me it was soggy and clearly unappetizing. I've *never* seen a spicy crab hand roll look like this. I would even go as far as saying it was really gross. I dare say it tasted even worse than it looked - warm, chewy, and messy. Somewhere in Japan, this has got to be considered illegal sushi.

Our sushi chef's demeanor was deadpan and straight up unfriendly. I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt but we soon caught his drift and decided to leave after another order (a scallop sushi roll which was ugly as shit, and made without care).

Just when I thought we cut our losses and were off to another establishment to save our supper, I was given the "Sorry, sir, our system is down, can you pay with cash?" What complete crap. I should've called their bluff. It's been 5 years since I've encountered that in Vegas. Visa, Mastercard Inc., and the Better Business Bureau should be notified.

The industry folks love this place, and I don't understand it. Avoid at all costs.

Yup! Super good. Highly recommend the "sexy roll" good roll, great sauce. Late night happy hour for late night revellers. 

Buy one get one for ALL ALCOHOL from midnight to 4am sun thru Thursday.

How we found out about this place....amazing....

Kara and I decided to leave my boyfriend at the hotel for a girl on girl bonding dinner shennanigan.
I remember i was drunk...and emotional. and drunk.... and a limo driver gave us a free ride. 
He asked me where i wanted to go to. I said. SUSHI.

And luckily, without any attempt of harm, or kidnap or rape...we made it safely to the sushi spot...in a LIMO.

fly!

Tip: Girls. we just got lucky our limo driver isn't a douchebag. But do not attept to hop in, to any limo just because it's a dashing limo..I didn't think at that point. Thank god we didn't get killed in our short skirts.

Anyway....

So...my girlfriend and I ...along with our drunken hungry stomachs..ordered so much sushi, which we devoured in less than an hour....

Service on a saturday night was great. No long wait. and they are really friendly.

I had to take my boyfriend here....so we came back here on Monday...again....

What i've tried here so far..i really did like...

here we go: (this is from two nights of being here)

*First Kiss: Deep Fried Shrimp topped with soft shell crab, tuna and white fish. 
It comes with a subtle tangy sauce with a flavor that's just about right without overpowering the natural flavor and tast of the fish.

*The "O" Roll: Chopped deep fried soft shell crab, spicy tuna and avocado, topped with Yellowtail. 
As the name says.... This is a full blown Orgasm in your mouth. Definitely a must try. It gave me multiples. I had to order this twice.

*Palm Springs Roll: OMG. This is an orgasm within an Orgasm.
Cubed Tuna in Spicy Mayo and Ponzy Sauce galore, with crab, avocado and cucumber. Soooo Goooooood. This is really amazing.
We ordered this on our two nights we were at Kaizen.

*Kiss of Fire: If you like Spicy...you'll love this roll. Inside: there's crab, avocado and cucumber... Topped with Spicy Tuna, White Fish, Jalapeno. Sauce: spicy garlic ponzu and hot sauce..... Down this with Asahi or a shot of Sake. you're good.

*Kaizen Roll: Who doesn't agree that anything deep fried is just oh. so . good??? and unhealthy? whatever sushi pooper. This roll is a must try as well. IN: Deep fried soft shell crab, lobster, avocado, asparagus, yamagobo,cucumber, radish sprouts.. Topped with Tuna, Salmon and Yellowtail. sauce: eel sauce.

*Chicken Teriyaki Bowl: Even their Chicken Teriyako Bowl is not ordinary. It's yuuuummmmy!!!!

What i like about this Sushi Joint is that...it's not over-rated and doesnt try to be fancy shmancy like other sushi joints on the strip. They keep their quality and deliver freshness fish after fish..after fish. Service is fast and excellent. Prices are decent. Fish cuts are thick and generous. Selection is different and unique.

Definitely recommend this place to Sushi Lovers in Vegas!
This place has a great salmon tempora roll. The service is wonderful as well!  Will be back for sure for another round. Sad they don't have an all you can eat though.
Horrible service. . I am accustomed to being told of sushi bar specials and chef's recommendations.if  you want cheap bad service ..this is then your spot. . DON'T WASTE YOUR  TIME...

Hands-down, The Best Udon I've ever had. Period. 

Living in Pasadena, I'm constantly searching high and low for good quality udon. I don't know why it's so difficult to master. It seems like good ramen is easier to find in LA than good udon.

I had my fingers crossed when I ordered the udon at Kaizen but wasn't expecting too much. But my first taste had me closing my eyes in ecstasy.  I was in heaven.  I was incredibly starving at the time, so that might have swayed my opinion a little, but the broth was delicate and complex and oh-so-delicious. The noodles were the perfect texture.

The only downside is that the service wasn't good.  After waiting forever I had to flag someone down to take our order. Then they forgot our order of edamame. Food took a while to come out too.

But it's all worth it for the Udon!!! YUM!
Grabbed some rolls on the way home. Great food & service. Can't wait till next visit. Yummy
Kiss of Fire roll was not that great, but the service was prompt. Appreciated the late open hours. There probably are better options in town for sushi.

I've been coming here for years and it's still great. Fresh fish, huge creative rolls and friendly customer service. They are open late and the atmosphere is sleek but not snobby. I've never had a bad experience at Kaizen. One of my favorite sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.
Great little gem open late! I preferred the sushi here than at the upscale expensive Nobu. Fish tastes Fresh and they have an amazing variety.

The sushi was pretty good, a bit expensive though. The atmosphere is alright if you don't mind tourists in the midst of their Vegas vacation.. I found the staff to be very rude, I was asked if I was ready to order at least 10 times in the first 15 minutes I was there.. .It made me feel very uncomfortable and unwanted, I ended up ordering something random just to get them off my case... Then I waited 25 minutes for my bill, after they didn't bring the bill.. I dropped my money on the table and walked out.
I found the staff to be pretentious and rude...and the sushi was somewhere below par..

I must point out that I did not have any sushi here! So in order for this place to get a fair and unbiased opinion on their food,  do not count on this review. 

I came here simply because I was staying across the street at HRH and it was a walking distance for a drunk person. I got tired of burgers and pizzas, and I wanted something different. This place had teriyaki bowls at $8.95 a bowl. It wasn't a restaurant quality teriyaki bowl as I expected. Infact I have had way better ones in Socal at mom and pop places. However I m must say I do like the ambiance of this place. They got a sports bar style counter setup with some flat  screens. And behind the bar were the chefs making sushi on the fly. If I was into Sushi, I would definitely come here.  I was just so hammered that day where raw fish would've been a trip killer.  

This place is definitely worth checking out if you need a good walking distance munchies spot from the HRH.

"Unique Rolls... slightly overpriced"

Unique offering of rolls and specials. Interesting interior, nice staff, easy access but a little overpriced. Try the baked rolls... I was very pleased.

atmosphere: 8
price: 7
food quality: 8
parking: too easy

Every time I come to Vegas, I make it a point to eat at Kaizen!!! Food is always delicious and menu is 14 pages! Best of all, happy hour is 10 pm to 4am! Buy 1 get 1 free alcohol! Love the service too!!!!

I lived in Japan for two years and ever since then (almost 10 years ago now) I have been searching the U.S. For authentic and amazing sushi and this place had it! The "beef sashimi" (they call it something fancy but that's what it is) is AMAZING! And the three rolls we got were just as good! I would be be surprised if my boyfriend and I came back before going home!

This place suck, everything I order taste fishy!!!!, they are over price! Server was impatient to answer question about their menu! These people did not care about me!
We Will not return!! Ever!

Don't come to this plaza unless you're strapped with weapons....or at least pepper spray. Even a stun gun would be nice.
Kaizen was okay but damn...this plaza was one hot mess!!!
We haven't parked for 2 seconds yet and bums are already asking for money.

But this sushi place is nothing to write home about. Service was spotty....even though we came on a late Sunday night. After they brought us our drinks and water, we were ready to order some sushi rolls. We had to flag the waitress down, TWICE. It wasn't even busy!!! There were about 5-8 other tables. They didn't bother checking back on us....what if we wanted to order more sushi?!?! I totally would have by the way. We ordered a spicy tuna roll and also a Sunrise Roll. Sushi was delicious and their menu was never ending. I would've loved to try a few more...but DAMN...it was pricey!!!! Our sunrise roll was $13!!! Most of the sushi rolls ran from $10-14 per order. Umm, yeah...no. You're better off going into the heart of Chinatown or even further...(wayyyy further) off the strip for better priced sushi.

Also..side note: if you get cold like myself, BRING A JACKET WITH YOU!!!! They like to keep their fish and customers fresh and cold. Thought I was in their freezer box for a second.

Won't be coming back again. And this side of town is enough to scare the sushi out of me.

The surprising thing about Vegas is how few great dining options there are late-night.  Sure, every hotel has its late-night restaurant but they're generally pretty average.  This place was great!  They had funky rolls and good drinks and at 2am we weren't expecting anything this good.  Would definitely return.
We will always eat here when we come to Vegas (we come here every year). Unique rolls, traditional rolls, great service and no loud slot machines!

This is by far the number one sushi joint I have ever been to in my life I've probably been to over 100 sushi bars. There's no comparison!! Unfortunately there is no all you can eat but everything else makes up for it the service is amazing and the food is amazing. I'd recommend the energy roll and sit at the bar for the experience. You also have to get sake bombs..

I frequent the Kaizen establishment closer to my house on Eastern Ave. I had friends in town and they were staying at the Cosmopolitan. I picked them up and took them out for lunch to Kaizen. I was surprised to order my usual items that I was used to but they were served differently. Not a bad thing, but it did catch me off guard. 
The service was ok, had a little issue with my wifes soda being frozen. They did bring a new one out. Overall, a good dining experience. Would recommend and return.
This place has great specials. Happy hour buy one get one free on all alcohol drinks! Great place to go to get away from the strip. Guaranteed to see a Virgin American flight attendant here also!

This gem was hidden in a strip, crowded with other food vendors. I ordered take out, as it was right across the street from the hotel I was staying at for business, and I was alone. :( 

I skimmed through the menu for a while, when the server came and asked if I was ready. I asked him to suggest some good rolls, hinting that I loved salmon. He recommended the sunrise roll, so I took that and an order of salmon sushi (2 pcs). 

I went back to my hotel room and was pleasantly surprised. The fish was very fresh and the sushi rice was nicely seasoned. If I am ever back in town, I'd love to try their other food!

Delicious! Would definitely visit again.  Their rice was not sticky enough for me and fell apart quickly after picking up w chopsticks.  Had their sushi combo w California roll.  Awesome!

And all this for $10.76...great food at bargain prices

Love this place! 

First thing you notice is the decor! Beautifully designed and there is different types of seating, so if you're in the mood for high chairs at the bar or high end picnic style tables for a large group or a more intimate setting with regular tables and comfy chairs, you can take your pick! This is Super important for me as I don't do bar chairs and usually the non bar chairs at sushi places are terrible, packed in tight and just uncomfortable especially if you happen to be the owner of a larger behind! 

Next is the service, they are Super friendly and welcoming every time we came and after our 3rd visit our waitress even welcomed me back like an old friend and gave me a hug! They make you feel comfortable and that is awesome. Everyone is on point with their service providing refills and just checking if everything is ok. Speaking of which one time I had ordered something that I didn't particularly like and they took it right back no questions asked. 

Of course the most important part, the food is super fresh and really well put together! Having gone about 7 times recently, we always had at least above average to perfection each time. Their chefs clearly know what they're doing and you can taste it. 

Favorites: 
Screaming o salad 
Charlie's angels 
Unicorn roll 
Super spider roll
Palm Springs roll
Miso soup 
Fuji Apple sake 
Korean bbq beef 

We have visited probably 30+ sushi restaurants in Vegas and California and I would easily rate this in my top 3 for overall experience. It is probably a good thing I live in Arizona or I would go broke coming here all the time! 

Also they are open super late and we have been there both for lunch and at 3 am and received the same service and quality each time.
I tried the tiramisu glass for dinner tonight but I didnt expect the ice cream consistency. When it comes to tiramisu, I preferred a warm sponge cake texture better.

One of the best sushi places I've ever been to in the U.S. I was skeptical at first with reading some of these reviews. Im so glad I listened to my daughter and came. It was her birthday so her wish. We ate the Unicorn Roll, Orange Blossom, and the T something girls roll. Delicious!!! And highly recommended. We'll be back.
Amazing and flavorful sushi, great happy hour (1+1 on alcohol, till they close). Very nice atmosphere, great service, it was the best food experience throughout this trip. Thank you so much!

8/11/14 Came right when it opened so there was no wait and the host seated is immediately! I think we came to roll heaven!! There was a binder full of different rolls, it was amazing! 

The husband ordered the Rock & Roll, it has tuna, salmon, white fish, crab, radish, asparagus, radish sprouts and yamagobo, no rice and is wrapped in cucumber...I ordered the nabeyaki udon.

We liked the interior of the place all wooden tables with a long sushi bar and very nicely insulated, keeping us cool in the heat...We definitely plan to come back!

I am a big fan of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi. Sometimes a restaurant fits perfectly into your day or even your week. In the fall of 2014 I had been in Las Vegas briefly and had quickly grabbed takeout from here. I remember thinking the ambience was fun. Returning to Las Vegas in December of 2015 I used Yelp to track down this sushi restaurant that I remembered enjoying but couldn't remember the name of.

Since I was traveling for work I was often on my own for dinner. Walking into Kaizen I was instantly welcomed and the staff was more than happy to give me a table to myself since the restaurant was not too busy. 

Over the three separate visits I made to Kaizen I got to sample a variety of rolls, all of which I enjoyed:
-Philadelphia Roll-specially requested for this to be made with salmon and cream cheese inside and salmon on top
-Sexy Roll-spicy tuna inside topped with fresh tuna, smelt eggs, and tangy sauce
-Crunch Roll-deep fried shrimp, Yamagobo, cucumber inside topped with tempura crunch and eel sauce
-Red Rock Roll-deep fried shrimp and cucumber inside topped with spicy tuna, seared tuna, and spicy mayo
-Hot Night Roll-deep fried shrimp and cucumber inside topped with spicy tuna and eel sauce
-Orange Blossom Roll-deep fried chopped shrimp and crab inside topped with salmon and tangy sauce

Everything I had was delicious and the service is polite and quick. Definitely great to stop in for dinner when traveling for business. On weekends the restaurant can get significantly busier so expect to sit at the bar if you're dining solo.
Been back to Kaizen like three more times now and they never fail to impress me.  My favorite sushi place in Vegas.  Try the mussels.....they're great.

I love, love, love this sushi! I can't always dine in so it is good to know you can call in an order and pick it up, easy peesy! The food is fresh, the service is fantastic, and it is a great place to take people visiting Vegas!
Nice interior with good service, waitors and waitresses are the best thing in this restauran

Let's paint the picture. I show up for dinner alone, slightly before rush so I sit at the bar. Wow! Just wow! The Sexy M roll was so freaking good. I mean I could have ordered three of those! But my stock definitely couldn't have taken that kind of work. I also got the Palm Springs roll, this was also wonderful but that Sexy roll stole the show for me! The guys were wonderful! I wish I was in town longer so that I could go again!

Went here 2 weeks ago as Gangnam Asian BBQ had an hour wait at 9pm on a Sunday.  Based on other reviews, looks like they get overflow from Gangnam often.  Food is mediocre, although plentiful.  Service is friendly but we had different wait staffs coming by.  They check on you verbally but they don't seem to notice that your drinks get low! Overall very average, we don't intend to come back.
I had RoadRunner delivery from there. I always really enjoy their rolls. Especially the Japanese lasagna. It's the best I've had!
This is the best bang for your buck on Vegas if you want sushi. Amazing.

We were staying at Hard Rock & walked across the street for dinner. What a gem this place is!

My husband had a Philadelphia roll & said it was so fresh & delicious. 

I was looking for something vegan so i asked if they could make me a teriyaki bowl (which was on the menu but with meat or shrimp) with tofu. They did & it was very good! 

We were very happy with the food & service.

I would go back again.

Very clean and modern ambiance. Friendly staff and well priced rolls. They offer a diverse combination of rolls with various seafood and meats, as well as entrees, desserts, and drinks. You can sit at the bar or tables.

I absolutely love this sushi restaurant! I have eaten at Nobu , Katsuya, and Koi. This place is definitely the same quality of food and service is great! It's my second time here and everytime I come to Vegas from now on I'll definitely be stopping in. I ordered the spicy yellowtail roll and the crunch scallop it was delicious

Love this place ! Sushi is yummy and affordable!
Eaten here like every night while working in vegas.

My friend and I just landed in Las Vegas after a very long flight and we hadn't eaten in ten hours
We came to the plaza where this place is because we wanted a foot rub
We went into some barbecue place but they kept saying that everything took a really long time and I was very hungry so we came into the sushi place which is the most amazing place that I've ever eaten in Las Vegas
Food is incredibly fresh everything was good we ate several rolls soup salad sake steak and I would come back here every day

It's completely delicious the service is very fast everyone's very attentive and it's totally got a clean Vegas five

I would highly suggest this to anyone and the guys who work in and sushi counter is very cute

Waitress was nice the seaweed salad is excellent the Mississippi is delicious the Eda mommy was fresh and steamy in the Orange Blossom Hill is the best get that and don't miss the steak salad it's yummy

This place is a most pleasant surprise! It's in a little strip mall, a 5 min walk from Hard Rock and The Alexis. Quick, friendly, attentive staff. I like the layout and how they compartmentalized the "booths". Food comes quick. Quality sushi so good i had to order same thing twice (snow white roll, YUM) cos my bf devoured the first plate even before he got his own (banana roll). One thing i really liked is that the rolls were tight so things aren't falling around the plate. 
This place makes me think we've been to the wrong places! Lol
Great happy hour: buy 1 get 1 free drinks. Sushi is fresh, and chicken katsu tempura roll is delicious. And it's open 24 hrs!
It was ok :/ and kinda felt rushed when ordering. Over priced to and no all you can eat

This is the spot you hit for solid good sushi. I don't think it is too inventive however the quality is high the prices are more than reasonable and they are open late so late night place for sushi this would be it.
Excellent ambiance and not too packed! A good place to get some quiet from the craziness of the strip.

Very good sushi--4 stars
Service----2.5-3 stars

Customer service is questionable.   We waited about 50 min for a table although we were told 15 min.  Don't order wine here.  Stick with beer or sake or soda.  She paid $13 for a GLASS of wine which sells at Costco for $8 A BOTTLE.  The person who settled our check didnt split the bill among the card but charged one person the balance.  It was really a mess and there were only 5 people in our party.  I would return but will keep these things in mind.

Where do i start.. Kaizen Sushi is a Japanese restaurant  in front of the hard rock casino. Or at least it tries to be.. First, it's korean owned (like most sushi places..
In case you didn't know, sushi rolls were invented in korea, not japan), they serve Japanese food, but not traditional Japanese cuisine, if that's what you're looking for (try Ichiza). I came here for sushi, and to my dissapointment, the sushi was not fresh, I've been here twice and both times the fish was old.. From tuna to uni, the sushi was old and dry. Not to mention the size of their cuts.. For the price they charge they should at least make up for quantity. I've had an order of $6 nigiri that filled me up more than their $22 chirashi bowl (mix sushi bowl). Ok maybe not... but you get the idea.. The only reason why they dont deserve a 1 star review is the fact that they have friendly people working there, and they are open later than most sushi places in vegas (they close at 4am).. so prepare to order a couple of Sapporo's and Sake, and hope it makes the food taste better.

Good place for sushi i go here for lunch with friends they have good lunch specials and i also can go here at night there open late and its a nice place. Also the fish is always fresh which keeps me coming back.
Really fast and incredibly fresh. Lots of options to choose from. I'll go again. The staff was very friendly as well.

The perfect spot for your late night sushi craving! We came a bit late (pass 3am) and still got greeted with smiles. The service, the ambience is great here and the food is amazing! It totally worth going off the strip for this one! Thank you Kaizen, we'll definitely be back for more :)
GREAT SUSHI!!!! Favorite spot to come to. Best late night Happy Hour!! Food and drinks are always on point.

Worst service ever!!!!! I'm never coming back here again! Our server sucked, he was rude and extremely unprofessional. We were a party of 6, out food took forever and when we complained about it, an employee who claimed to be the owner, yelled at us!

Prices are up to par with most average sushi places.  Nigiri Sushi is about $5-8 depending on which fish.  Cut rolls are $5-12.  The spicy tuna salad seems to be a favorite.  Alas the salad seemed to be just a generic salad that they bought at safeway/vons.

The Hamachi was fresh and the two pieces were nice and big.  I wasn't that hungry so I didn't try that many things.  Though the korean bbq roll was a nice try to something new, it wasn't that special to make me want to order again (may as well just get korean bbq shortribs with rice), as there are so many other rolls to try.

I'd go again, prices and quality are up to par, and this time I'd try the other rolls.

Good for rolls, decent for nigiri (it's no sasabune).
Kaizen is great. The atmosphere, service, and food can't be beat! Definitely try this place out if you are looking for sushi!

Service was ok, but not the best. Ordered dinner for two from the sushi menu. We were looking for some soft shell crab. They delivered a breaded and deep fried something - was hard to even tell it had crab in it. One of the unagi pieces I ordered tasted a little funky, but one was ok. I read many reviews before opting to come here. I can't imagine even going to an AYCE sushi restaurant. To those who complain about price, we paid $60 for a light dinner here, but would have much rather paid the $200 elsewhere and gotten ten times better food and service. Couldn't go there though, because it was Wednesday. :(

Went with some local friends while visiting Vegas. Did not look like much from the outside, but the interior is well done. Simple with an open feel. There is open seating in the middle of the room to utilize its space and to keep it from feeling crowded. Both the food and service were good. As noted by others it is open til 4 AM on most days which is a plus in Vegas. I was told by my friend that they have a DJ's performing during the late night. 

Will likely return when in Vegas next.

We have eaten multiple times at Kaizen and they never disappoint, fish is fresh and the staff is friendly and prompt! Being from LA we are blessed with great sushi and don't eat sushi in the casinos so it was great to find Kaizen a few years back on one of our trips to Vegas!

Lunch at Kaizen?  Heck yeah.  Why does eating sushi on your lunch hour feel so scandalous?  Probably because spending $35 for two people is a little much for lunch hour. lol  It could be worse.

I got the lunch special California Roll with salad and miso soup.  Pretty good.  California Roll was really small but Im not really expecting much for it being the lunch special.  My friend got some sort of dragon roll and sashimi.  Her roll was much bigger than my baby Cal roll.  Both she said was pretty good.

My one gripe for this place is that they don't serve white meat chicken!  I love myself a teriyaki chicken but not with gross dark meat.  I understood back in the day the cheap way to go for these places is the dark meat, but now in a health cautious world a place such as this should have white meat for Gods sake. 

Anyways, food pretty good.  Service good...they guy actually remembered I needed a fork for my salad. hehe  The place is always empty for the most part.  I sometimes wonder why being that its across the street from the Hard Rock.  So yeah just an "okay three star review" because of the "no white meat".  Get with the times Kaizen!

If there were more than 5 Stars, I would give them an extra star for consistency! They weren't just fabulous the first time, but every time I take someone there (it is now on my "tour" for family and friends when they visit), they have a great meal and a great time!

Best sushi we have had in a long time! Highly recommend this place Great Sushi excellent service. Very cozy and welcoming atmosphere, love the area under the little lights your facing the bar basically. It's a small place but it's delicious sushi definitely   recommend the Nevada roll and the avocado one so tasty!!
First time here. We wanted to try a fresh roll and a baked dish. We were not disappointed. Service was also excellent! Would return.

I enjoyed every sec of my visit here. I was completely excited to go to sushi at 1am in the morning and everything taste fresh! The menu was very nice gave plenty of options including 2 for drinks for happy hour. It was my friends first time for sushi and our server was super knowledgeable and informative on what he should try which I really appreciated. She told us what she likes and dislikes which is a big deal to me. I'm a HUGE fan of Eel and that have an appetizer with 8 pieces of will served on a sizzling skillet with onions and peppers it was delicious! I had the King Crab Miso Soup it was beyond amazing! I had a great time and love how small and cozy it was. Can't wait to go back when in vegas!

Came in a few times with my boyfriend, once with his dad & another time with our friends. Both times the food was tasty- our favorite was a  salmon roll topped with a creamy sauce and macadamia nuts, and this has been the only place to have it. But at $20 per roll, it's the kind of place we go to only when we'll be sharing with many people. It's close to my work and open late, which is great considering I get off work around late some days- but if I can't afford to eat there then it's not a viable option. 

The interior is nice, with long wooden tables and an open feel despite the small size. The music doesn't really jibe with the asian food theme, and there are large TV screens along some of the walls playing random video.

Overall the food is tasty but expensive. For the same price range I could have multiple courses at Ichiza. The salmon killer roll IS especially good, so I would go back for that sometime, but expect the bill to run a bit high. It can also be awkward navigating out of the parking lot given the location and all the one-way streets.
This sushi place is amazing! The servers are very attentive & friendly. Cold drinks & tasty sushi rolls; what more could you ask for?!

While I was in Vegas for my friends birthday, we decided to get some sushi. This place came up when I searched, "all you can eat sushi." Sadly, it wasn't. But we stayed and gave it a shot. 

The service was awesome. Our waitress was friendly and patient with all 7 of us. We ordered a variety of rolls, and every single one of them was delicious. 

They also had some late happy hour, which is after 12am, and it's buy one get one free.

Very clean place as well. 

Give it shot!
Good spot to get your grub on. Music wasn't to loud. Friendly service clean. All around good eats
Tried this place thru Groupon since it was close to my work. Rice was undercooked and I had scale in the spicy Tuna roll. Overall, sushi and rolls weren't tasteful much.

Thank goodness for this sushi restaurant. We are staying at the Hard Rock And had a sushi craving.
I'm in love with how good the food is and the price point.

Sashimi was spectacular and the shrimp tempura roll I had was spot on.

I'm coming back if I'm ever in the area again.

I suggest you make it out here! So delicious.

Oh and I should say that the service was so friendly and fast. Yay to Kaizen!

I recommend the Nevada Roll it was super tasty! I also had the Lobster Tempura Roll, that was just good, not really what I was hoping for. 

BUT THE COSTUMER SERVICE MADE ME WANT TO ROLL SOMEBODY OVER WITH MY CAR! It was Horrible! I sat down at the bar and waited at least 10mins before the sushi chef asked if anyone has even took care of me. I ordered my rolls with him, only for him to delivery the order to a staff member. Even then nobody asked if I needed anything to drink, then the sushi chef had to remind someone to help me. They took forever to clear my area of plates and took forever to give me the check and come to pick it up! I am very unhappy with the Customer service here. 

But the pineapple saketini were great

eh.
way too expensive for the mediocrity of the sushi.
there are SO many better places to choose from.

I've eaten quite a lot of sushi all around the country, but this was NOT good sushi.  It wasn't awful.  But it was about as good as the sushi you might get pre-made from a grocery store.  "Mediocre" is the best I could possibly rate it.   

The decor in the restaurant was beautiful; a lot nicer than I would have expected for a strip mall restaurant.  And the service was fine.  But the menus were that cheap laminated stuff you find in low-end Chinese restaurants, with poorly lit photos of the rolls.  And the descriptions were all so formulaic:  Inside - tuna avocado, on top - shrimp, sauce - ponzu.   They all read like that so that none of them stood out to you.  They all sounded pretty much the same.

But most importantly, of the 4 rolls we ordered, none were outstanding.  They were all just blah with a slightly fishy taste to the sushi.

I would NOT go here again and I would certainly not recommend it to anyone. We should have spent the extra $$ and gone across the street to Nobu (in the Hard Rock) for some seriously amazing sushi.
Some of the best I have had, fresh and the staff is great! If you like sushi you need to try this palce.
Freaking love this place! Come here every time we are in Vegas. Went in with a party of 18.. Awesome service and extremely timely. See you guys in a few months!

Great sushi and service! I love sushi and this is about the best I've ever had. I had 2 rolls and they were so good I got a third. My girlfriend had a nabeyaki udon and it was delicious. Friendly staff and fast service, better prices than the strip restaurants

I can't begin to explain how amazing this sushi bar is, To Start Our Dinner We Had The Miso Soup Very Delicious, Also The Monster Roll With The Spicy Tuna So Delicious Next To The Soft Shell Crab So Rich In Flavor But The Main Dish I Tried For The First Time Was TORO! oh let me tell you how fresh it was and the way it just melt in every bite was something else! I love this place! And the nice staff is a 5 star experience  definitely the place to eat and sake
This is a great sushi restaurant. Visiting Vegas for the first time and loving it. The chicken katsu bowl is delicious. Ask for a side of eel sauce to make it 10x better

I came here because of a friend's recommendation and I'm so glad I did. It's a bit off the strip, near the Hard Rock and the area (I guess LV in general) isn't the safest... but the restaurant itself is cute and cozy inside. We enjoyed all of the rolls we tried and found the fish to be fresh and the service to be friendly.

Totally average, non-memorable. I think a lot of other working girls go there. Also the wait staff is beautiful. Nothing to really report other than that.

nice ambiance, upscale motif, a bit classier than most local places tend to be. The Sushi bar is very uncomfortable though.
Transfriendly- A

This is another late nite, post-partying on the Vegas strip spot!
It's funny because I have never eaten sushi @ 2am before!!!
And it was so yummy!
I especially enjoyed the bulgogi roll and Sexy roll.
So if you are craving a late-nite sushi, check this spot out because they close @ 6am!!!
YaY!
Excellent food and excellent service. The Kai roll is a must. The location is perfect. Definitely will come back again.

Perhaps one of the worst dining Experiences I've had in a long time.  I was part of a large party.  First they got the orders wrong.  Then their Chicken Katsu was dry and tough as shoe leather.  Then came the bill, which they didn't have correct and couldn't separate successfully.  To add insult to injury after each person telling the cashier what they had (in order to pay correctly) they insisted that they were going to add their automatic gratuity to each bill.  #nevergoingback
Probably the best sushi I've had, reasonable prices for good sushi. Good sized rolls. We had five rolls, only one we really didn't car for. The raw scallop roll. Defiantly thumbs up!

What a great surprise! In here our first time and the ambience, rolls, service and lighting was great!!
Loved the rolls and loved the late hours they're open.

I've been here a few times and let me just say, avoid on Saturday nights at all costs. The atmosphere is awful, a trashy crowd lingers and don't forget the extremely loud and cheesy music, its uncomfortable for anyone wanting a dinner where you don't feel like you are in a college-esque nightclub. The hostess couldn't be any ruder either, saying we couldn't get our food at the bar, and then she changed her mind after we were seated at a table- its like we are at a sushi bar at a strip mall not the Queen of Englands quarters, no need for the snobbery. Anyways, the sushi chefs are awesome and very friendly, and any other day or time is great to grab a bite to eat here, they also have Saketinis that are soooo adorable and delicious.

Walked in and was greeted right away, the server took us to a table and it was a good size table, the atmosphere seems pretty chill although it is my flat time here, I didn't want to order something so heavy this late so I stuck with chicken teriyaki bowl, I hope it's good, will check back later

My favorite late night sushi restaurant. As long as you're having a good time and of course ordering food and drinks they will stay open. Usually close about 4 am, it's also a great meeting spot before hitting the strip. The vegas roll is my favorite!

Incredible Delicious!!! Open late night just across the Hard Rock Cafe without the eye-gouging prices from the strip.  Was actually suggested by the valet at the Cosmopolitan ( In Vegas always pay attention to the suggestions of the Valet and the Taxicab Handlers on the hotels) 

Have eaten before at Sushi Roku and Shibuya and this place is as good, maybe even better than those! Try the Unicorn Roll it was amazing and a steal at ($14)

Me and my wife loved it and we will be back.
This is my first time eating sushi. Absolutely wonderful experience. Great service and very prompt. The location is close to UNLV. Must try and I plan to come again! I recommend the KAI rolls

Good sushi spot close to the strip but not directly on the strip. Prices are much better than on the strip. Very cute decor and clean. We came on a Thursday night and it was not busy. We were seated immediately and got our food quickly. We ordered miso soup, edamame, teriyaki bowl and two tempura rolls. The food was fresh and tasted great. We will come here again the next time we're in Vegas.

-got takeout from here late at night

-they specialize in specialty rolls (you know the ones with all sorts of fish and different sauces covering them)

-would come here again if I was staying at hard rock

-parking lot is kind of busy

My bf and I were staying at the Hard Rock and we walked across the street to get lunch and saw this place and since we are hard core sushi lovers we gave it a try. Their menu is pretty big, they have a lot to choose from..My fav was the Las Vegas roll. I say if you are staying at Hard Rock and are in the mood for some good sushi go there.. prices are okay not too bad (compared to the bay area) lol...
1st time here, the service is great & the restaurant  is so beautiful! Definitely recommend it.

First visit and now I want to be a regular. Best selection of sushi treats and restaurant food. Saki testing alone will bring me back.   Great place to come with friends and order many appetizers. My favorite is soft shell shrimp on a skewer. Great place to order special dishes and expand your comfort zone.

The service is quick and efficent. The food is great. The atmosphere is relaxed and chill, great place to meet friends and have a great time or just take the little lady to a great place for food. Definitely will be back to visit once again.

Three stars it is, because the food is always fresh and tasty. I love the location and food, but the service needs major facelift. I've been here about 5 times in the last 3 months and the last experience was the one that made up my mind to stop coming to this specific location. 

In our seating area we were the first table to arrive and then a few other people arrived about 5 minutes later. We were immediately ready to order, but instead our waiter took their order instead...  [worst] thing a waiter could do.. in my book.

He came to our table 10 minutes later the came back with sushi that was completely drenched in sauce to the point where I could't eat it and the dish they served it on was so darn small  my food was spilling all over the place, so I asked for larger dish... weird... 

The place wasn't packed and it took another 15 minutes to get a check and get out. Ugh... Despite the repeated poor service at this specific joint, I still recommend Kaizen, but at a different location.

Kaizen sits across from the Hard rock hotel nestled in the corner of the CVS plaza. Between Capriotti's and Ferraro's Italian. 

Here is the breakdown according to me. It's in my area.. it's slightly over-priced sushi.. and the service is sometimes good, sometimes they forget things.. lol.. what do you want from a place that is often pumping until 5 am. 

We head over there for a late night sushi fix, and most importantly.. the 2 for 1 .. ANYTHING from the bar.. after midnight. Usually that equals cheap sake and beer.. but it does the trick for cheap. Also I always see Carrot top there.. which is good or bad? You tell me.. it just is :] 

You can find me there on any given evening with a crew or just me and one of my foodie buddies.. mostly for me it's about the liquor and the broiled yellow tail fish collar. Yes... you read that right. if you don't know, now you know.. check it out. It's not that you can't get fish collar at other Asian style eateries, but this one is close by so I'm there most :)

Happy Eating!
Awesome late night sushi place ! Very attentive servers ! Sushi taste so fresh as well.. Both kaizen locations are awesome !

Walked in and was seated almost immediately by the friendly hostess. The ambience was laid back and relaxed. It was busy but you wouldn't notice it much because the service was quick. The noise level was just right. Music wasn't overbearing and the conversations throughout were at a low level. The seating arrangements have options. You can sit at the bar, separate tables, or picnic style table. We had the tuna hand roll, ceviche, and octopus and cucumber salad. The best hands down was the octopus and cucumber salad. It had the perfect blend of sweet, cool, sea, and spicy. The tuna hand rolls were simple but great. No frills, just tuna and rice; the way it should be. The ceviche was delicious but I wasn't too big a fan of the rice noodles inside. But, it was definitely 5 star ready. I will be returning next time I'm in Vegas.

Living in Seattle, I'm spoiled with fresh sushi. Who knew that I would find it in Vegas too?

There are a bunch of different rolls, each drool worthy and the prices are fair. If you're a big fan of mussels, their mussels are huge!!! I love it.

The decor is modern and very spacious. The restaurant is off the strip, but totally worth the trip out there.

Also opens until very late :) aka 4am... for all you party animals you.

My friends and I hit up this place at 4am on Saturday night after some hard partying at Blush. The restaurant is slightly off the strip but it's well-worth the $12 cab ride from the Wynn. 

We had a group of 6 and we were seated right away. Our food came super quickly and everything was really fresh...shocking for 4am! 

I had a cucumber salad that was served in a martini glass (super fun). The clam on top was SO fresh. I also had the crazy boy roll which was delicious as well. 

Very reasonably priced. Our waiter even called two cabs for us after we were done. 

Also a plus: this establishment is non-smoking so it was a breath of fresh air...literally! Will definitely go back next time!
Great sushi...happy hour is great and staff is funny and friendly and let's the customers create their own sushi :)

This place is located right across the street from HR hotel ( home of trendy Nobu). We come here when we have a larger group or a mixed group who like a wide range Japanese food. The fish is very fresh and some really good non traditional rolls for those who like them, The atmosphere is casual, the staff very friendly and the prices are reasonable.
This place is fantastic! Delicious food, great service, and a wonderful atmosphere. I highly recommend.
First time here and this place is great. Food is amazing and atmosphere is good. Will definitely be back
Great food!!! Will come back again. Must try the Jay roll and the tatami roll. Came here all the way from LA.
Awesome food.  Love this place!  It's open late and the service is excellent.  They were great with customizing the rolls to our wishes.  Highly recommend.

Oh yeah my favorite sushi spot away, yet not far from the strip. They have great service, delicious sushi rolls, and nice decor. The sushi is inexpensive to average. It's located right across the street from the hard rock, so it won't take you more than 15 mins to get here if you're staying on the strip. If you are craving good sushi and don't feel like waiting hours in order to get it, just drive or take a can here. It will be worth it!

I was craving sushi and staying down the street from this place, and was just plain not impressed.
To begin with they didnt have a great selection, so I ordered a baked salmon roll, that was TINY and so full of cream cheese that it completely over powered the taste of the salmon.
On top of that they are one of those places that charges you a fairly normal price for a soda, I want to say it was like $2.50 or something... But it's in a can, so no refills. 
Service was slow, they forgot my miso soup. 

Could have been better.
Love the atmosphere, phenomenal customer service, and lots of delicious menu options to choose from. Great location, too. We will definitely keep coming back whenever we're in town!

The Japanese word "Kaizen" brings back memories of my B-school days, when studying operations management in the car industry.  Kaizen means "continuous improvement" - why would any restaurant want to name themselves this?  Maybe Kaizen Sushi is aware of its shortcomings and wants to strive to be the best.  HMMM...

Food & Drinks
I came here with a couple of girlfriends for lunch and we immediately ordered lychee sake.  Points for having this on the menu!  It might be the Boone's Farm of sake, but can't deny that it was goooood!  We didn't want anything too heavy to eat because we had early dinner reservations, so one of my girlfriends had sashimi, the other had a bento box of short ribs, while I had the ahi salad.  As you can see, the unifying thread was NO RICE  (we were going clubbing that night - we didn't want to look TOO bloated!)  Amazingly, these dishes were satisfying - the portions were pretty generous.  Because we ordered from the lunch menu, everything was reasonably priced.   No complaints here!

Atmosphere
Kaizen is located in a little strip mall, so we weren't expecting the place to look anything less than your run-of-the mill sushi joint.  However, Kaizen had some pizzazz - the walls were colorful and rock music was playing.  We felt like we had walked into a bar.  For what it is, Kaizen scores points for atmosphere too - no complaints here either!

Service
This is where Kaizen should practice some Kaizen.  Orders came to the table slowly and randomly.  The bento box came first, which had my friend & I drooling.  My order came last, and by this time I was ravenous!  They should have served our food all at once! 

So I'd give Kaizen 3.5 stars if I could, but I'll round up because their name suggests they are striving for perfection.  As far as the service goes, I should hope so!

we likes this place, clean and taste really good!
delicious, nabeyaki udon is so good!
I will come this place when I come to vegas next time

This is a great sushi restaurant. Beautiful interior and very very clean.

The service is great, they constantly check on you and are very friendly. 

Now the food.... Amazing sushi! Nothing I've tried is bad, miso soup 5/5, salads 5/5 (including a really tasty ginger dressing!) 
All the rolls are to die for! Try this place while in Vegas!!!
My favorite sushi here in Las Vegas! I'm not sure I have had anything I didn't like! And the one on Eastern has happy hour specials!!
I haven't been to this place in a couple years and I forgot how great their food is! Artistic rolls with lots of variety. A must

YUM-o!

my friend & i went here just because we stopped at CVS and was craving sushi. & i tend to be a sushi purist ever since going to Sugarfish in LA but sometimes i want a fatty heap of lobster-crunchy-ricey-mayo- goodness...& hey, I'm vegas! So we go in & mind u, we didnt yelp! it before so we has NO idea what we were getting ourselves into. BUT boy were we pleased. the menu is like a book so good luck choosing one thing. I ended up choosing the Japanese Lasagna, cause well i have never heard of it! and my friend ordered the Silver Plate Roll (for starters we got Monkey Balls and Seaweed salad-- Delish!)... Both dishes were bomb.com but The Japanese Lasagna will rock ur socks off!!! It was soo what i was looking for :)...Sigh, sadly they dont have a place in LA....but I'm sure as hell gonna find a rip-off...or maybe its just a sin city treat? ;)

Had a quick lunch here before heading to the airport (leaving Vegas...so sad).

Thought that they had very inventive rolls, but was disappointed in the complete lack of a lunch special (was there at 1 pm) as well as the service. The waitress was pleasant and helpful, but was the only one working the entire lunch rush and couldn't handle everything. I sat at the bar and waited a good deal of time between each roll, and had empty water glasses the entire time.

I think the service is probably perfectly fine when there are more employees there, and the rolls were certainly tasty. Slightly overpriced in my opinion, but tasty. I'd say this place is worth a try if you're headed to the airport and want somewhere that isn't flooded with tourists.

Sushi at 3:30am!  No, it's not a typo.  This place is actually open until 4am on a Monday night.  And it's the only place any of the bartenders, waitstaff, hosts, taxi drivers, and security guards at Wynn, TI, The Venetian, or Fashion Show mall knew about....  so I'll go ahead and declare this the latest-open sushi place I've ever been to on this continent.  (If you know of anything open later in Norcal, DC, or LV, message me.)

The taxi ride here from the strip was all of like $7.  Of course we spent more than that, because we first tried Tao for sushi, but it was closed.  Then Social House - closed.  Then Ra: cerrado.  Then Hamada: shut, barely.  Then here, after burning a few hundred walking calories and a yuppie food stamp on the taxi.  Once we got here, the staff was very friendly and welcoming.  And the place was actually about a quarter full - with the younger party-looking set.  No one raving drunk though.  The nigiri was a bit more expensive than that would've-been-$7 taxi ride per pair but not exorbitant for Vegas.  Not the cheapest or best I've had, but the salmon, yellowtail, and white tuna nigiri were all fresh enough and they did have some delicious, albeit very thinly sliced toro ($19/pair), again at 3am.  I mean if someone can satisfy my sushi craving at 3am on a Monday night making the fish taste good is gravy.  They also had some white tuna that is the "pure white" type we geigens love and large bottles of Kirin.  And we couldn't help but notice a group of 4 at the bar doing sake bombs dominoes style (which the undergrad in me says looked pretty cool I must admit).  

I doubt 3am sake bombs are even legal in Cali.  Along with most other things in this town.  Viva Las Vegas.
Sushi is great! Good quality food. Restaurant is nice and clean. Absolutely loved the Strawberry Mochi!!

Whenever I go to Las Vegas and need a sushi fix. I only go to Kaizen Sushi. I have been to every sushi restaurant in Las Vegas and Kaizen tasted the best. The store is always clean and the food is super fresh. I would recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family.

Solid place for sushi. Good portions and large menu variety with fast service. My boyfriend and I got the spicy tuna salad which was HUGE (a bit too spicy for my tastes but still tasty). We also got the Kai and Twilight rolls and they did not disappoint. 

All in all, great place if you're nearby.

We ate here on Sunday night after a hard work day at JCK. I loved how I could pick anything I wanted from there enormous menu. I got the spicy tuna salad for which have tuna poke and seaweed salad along with an actual salad below and there amazing dressing. Worth it. Then I tried special roll which was great and it had shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, and yellowtail on top. Then I ordered just a basic spicy tuna roll and added cream cheese as  you can do that here. To top it off I have the mochi ice cream which is great! The only reason why this restaurant did not get 5 star is because the service was piss poor. Get more servers as a Sunday night, off the strip with great priced sushi is gonna be busy. Go here if you want some good sushi! :)

This place doesn't disappoint! Fantastic sushi and price is decent. The only reason I didn't give it 5 is the service is always abit slow and my appetizer usually comes out half way through my roll. Kinda defeats the purpose of an appetizer.

Ended up coming here with a date to avoid the crazy New Years crowd on the strip! I was recommended to come here by one of the pit bosses while gambling. They had stated that this pale was open until 6 A.M. which was a major plus since It was past midnight at that point. Ended up getting to the restaurant around 1. We started off with a bottle of sake called "nothingness" which was pretty good. (Sweeter cold sake) The food was absolutely amazing, everything was fresh and delicious. The service was also very good! Since it was considered happy hour at that time they brought us an extra bottle of sake on the house. It was only a 5 minute cap ride from Planet Hollywood here which wasn't bad at all. I initially had doubts about this place number one because it was off the strip and number 2 because it was open so late, but I am glad I ended up coming here as oppose to anywhere else. The vibe was also very good. A nice place to take a date. For it being a sushi restaurant in Vegas the price was very reasonable, I was expecting it to be about doubled what I ended up paying! I will definitely come back here next time I am in town! I can easily say it is one of the top 5 sushi spots I have been too!
I thought I have reviewed this place many times but it's asking me for one again. This place has consistency and large portions and decent prices.  I send everyone I know there!! No complaints ever!!
First time at kaizen. Arriving at around 5am and there are still many people eating. Although it doesn't have an AYCE menu , price is decent and food quality is still great!
Unique menu. Lots of interesting choices. Simple but cool atmosphere. Quick service and a great place to go before a flight. Have been here 3x.

I love Kaizen!

I'd never been here, but I am always in the area when trolling around for food. Grabbed lunch here the other day for a team lunch at work.

Everything was delicious. The miso soup, the seaweed salad, the various rolls. Try the caterpillar roll, and share it with people. It's foodporn worthy.

Service was fast!

I can't wait to come back.

Sorry this review isn't as novel as my previous ones. I'm close to 400. I don't care. This place is just worth it, and I can't wait to come back!

You would think that when guests request two AYCE menus at the BEGINNING of the meal, the server would correct them. Clearly not the case in this half-assed sister location to Kaizen on Flamingo and Arville (who DOES do AYCE); paid for four to eat for two.
Outrageous pricing for mediocre food and minimal customer service. Get it together.

We are visiting from Oregon and had been here years ago with local & out of state friends. This was our 2nd visit and we love it just as much as the first time.  Everything we ordered was fresh & fabulous!  Great atmosphere and great service.

I was craving sushi during a business trip in Vegas, and feeling super jetlagged and exhausted i just wanted something quick for takeaway before passing out for the night. Kaizen got great reviews and was a quick drive from my hotel, so I called in an order and popped in. The food was okay, but not great. The sushi felt like it wasn't very fresh and it was completely warm by the time I got it home (to be fair, it was 100 degrees outside but the car ride was only 5 minutes and the AC was on... so I don't think that could have been the culprit!). Maybe eating in is a better bet for the future.

Who doesn't love Kaizen!?!?!?  It's convenient, consistent, and the food is fresh!  Service is always top notch and although they don't offer AYCE, I still walk out very full for about $25.  The staff is really polite and always on top of their game, even when it's super busy and they are clearly understaffed.  The waiters and waitresses they have know the entire menu and restaurant very well + their regulars.  The best thing about this restaurant is the layout and seating options.  When I dine with friends where we will be talking a ton and want a more private area, the tables on the left offer a nice view of the restaurant without all of the noise and busyness.  When I come alone I either prefer the bar top or the long tables on the main floor area, depending on the mood I am in.  

I love the music here and although it can seem a little bit loud sometimes when the restaurant is full and Lady Gaga is playing over the sound system to add to the noise, it somehow seems fitting to the energy of the servers here.  

I really do wish Kaizen would start doing an AYCE menu at least during certain hours.  Their sushi is really fresh and if they offered AYCE, I would likely get more nigiri than rolls as their nigiri and hand rolls seem quite pricey for being so small.

Favorite sushi place by far! I enjoy this location and the one in North Las Vegas. Their garlic edamame is definitely my favorite and would recommend it to everyone. I like going to the one in North Las Vegas because the location is more convenient but also because it has all you can eat.

There are times when the thought of leaving the house outweighs the feeling of- if I don't eat sushi right now, I will, in fact, die. I really don't like to get sushi delievered because, it just is never that good, but desperate times call for desperate measures. Plus, I just wasn't ready to die. I used the roadrunner food delievery app and it let me customize my order exactly how I like it (I'm one of those annoying cant order directly off the menu people) . Food was delievered to me exactly how I wanted it and I got to eat with my favorite dining companion, my cat- Ape. I also did not have to wear pants like a civilized person. I took my first nom, and it was delicious!! Cold, fresh and yummy. I also love their "beef tarta" . This place is great. If you can crawl outside with pants on, they are open late and super friendly inside.

First time here at Kaizen. Did not even know it existed in this spot across Hard Rock Hotel on Paradise and Harmon. Ordered the Baked New Zealand Mussels in Dynamite Sauce, Ika Yaki (Grilled Swuid), Crispy Soft Shell Crab for appetizers. 
Very clean atmisphere but intimate with rigbt lightings. Decor is posh and modern. Love the local artist paintings on the wall.
Our server was very welcoming, friendly and was nice to recommend off the menu.
My family and I will be coming back again for sure.
sushi is a little expensive but I order the teriaki bowl for 10 bucks, and every roll is pretty damn good!

Ambience: Solid A here. The lighting is dim, and makes for an intimate feel. Decor is simple with traditional Japanese and modern touches.

Service: It's an overall B to B-. The hostess and wait staff is friendly and just the right amount of attentive. Sushi chef was cold. I am so used to friendly, outgoing sushi chefs, so while he was by no means rude, his customer facing skills leave something to be desired.

Sushi: And of course the most important aspect of. Sushi restaurant. Unfortunately, this is a C to C+. As a frequent sushi nosher and lover or nigiri, I was more than a little disappointed. What I ordered: salmon, yellowtail belly, uni, and unagi. The unagi was the best of the 4. But honestly, it's pretty touch to mess up since its BBQ'd. Flavor was good, although the unagi sauce was cloyingly sweet. The salmon was second best. Standard. Not bad, but not great. Slightly flavorless. The yellowtail belly and uni were terrible.
