I was really looking forward to the buttery fattiness, but found it entirely flavorless and stale (the ends were hard which I've never experience with sushi). To be honest , I choked down the uni. Sad because it's one of my favorites to order. It had an odd metallic flavor that again, I've never experienced. Additionally, the nigiri itself was really sloppy. Most all fell apart as soon as I tried to pick them up with my chopsticks.

Wish I could have given it at least 3 stars, but the food quality is obviously a big factor. I've been here a few times, so this isn't based on a one time experience.

A little pricier than my guy and I like, but we splurge here every once in a while. Or we'll get our taste in sushi and then fill up on capriottis next door. Definitely recommend the banana tempura roll. Its the reason we go here. Its way super weird but way super delicious, trust me. Always had good service here. They're polite about the fact that we order 6 miso soups.
Great sushi spot! The white rose and Unicon rolls were awesome. The kaizen roll was good too. Everything was really fresh. Good service. Prices were pretty good too. Will definitely go back.

Great sushi restaurant, just behind the Hard Rock Hotel on Paradise.  

I live here in Vegas, and like most other locals, I hardly ever eat on the strip.  I will usually only go to the strip to eat at Joes Stone Crab in the Forum Shops.  It's great to find nice restaurants like Kaizen to eat at when you're in the area.

The prices are not half as bad as Sushi places on the strip and the quality is excellent!  

My servers name was Sumi, probably misspelled.  It was the best service I've ever had in any kind of Japanese restaurant, I will definitely be going back again.

The Mister and I are staying at Hyatt Place and wanted sushi and spotted Kaizen from our hotel window. We get here and there is a sign that reads 'Voted best sushi in Las Vegas." We are excited but when we walked in, it was empty at 1 PM on a Saturday and was reluctant to try.

I was pouting because I wanted AYCE sushi but the mister noted quality is more important than quantity and he was right!! I ordered the Kaizen roll...it was such a marriage in my mouth!!! Try it! Also their green tea ice fream doesnt taste powdery but creamy! Their portions are generous as well. The mister ordered sashimi 10 piece and he vouched the fish was fresh.

The place looks like it is more for the dinner crowd judging by the many speakers and projectors.

They got my vote for best non AYCE sushi in Vegas so far!

Kiss of fire roll absolutely to die for!!! I've had the beef tataki as well, can't go wrong with anything here, great vide, great service, my go to spot everything I'm in Vegas. I make sure I stop here! P.s. I live in la and have driven to Vegas ate here and driven back!! A++++++

I must admit I was a little skeptical visiting a sushi restaurant a little off the beaten path on the strip. 

Boy was I wrong!

Excellent service and outstandingly prepared well tasting fresh sushi. Guess where I'm going again on my next visit to the City of Sin

Btw: avocado train is a must have!

Enjoy!

I'm so glad I yelped this place when I was staying at the Hard Rock. I was getting extremely tired of eating american food (ie Cheese Fries and Chicken Strips) at Mr. Lucky's 24/7, me and my friend were totally craving for some rice. =) I was confused by the location on the google map because we exited from the back side of the Hard Rock rather than the front and couldn't see any street signs. After walking up and down Paradise Road we finally were able to find the location. It's really easy to find, just make sure you exit the Hard Rock from the front, walk over to the Hard Rock Cafe and walk across the street towards the CVS pharmacy. A few doors down is the Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi. =) 

I loved that they were really trendy, with trendy decor (70's looking partitioners that split the tables) and they were playing popular upbeat music that got me back into the mood to party again (I was feeling tired from Rehab, I wasn't feeling up to going to Body English later in the night). =)

We got seated right away, the service the waitresses were giving was very attentive, and we got our food right away. =)

The food was DELICIOUS!!! =)

We shared a tempura roll and edamame (they hook up the edamame!) and the chicken teryiaki bowl. But it wasn't your trypical teryiaki bowl... it tasted stir fried so it definitely added more flavor to the entree! =)

Plus the meal ended up being like $20! Super cheap! =)

Even if I wasn't staying at the Hard Rock Hotel I would still come by here again for Sushi... another bonus to this place is that they are open late! I believe on the weekends they are open until 4 or 5am!

A MUST visit if you're craving for more than just american fried food and don't want to make the drive out of the Hard Rock.
Great place and energy, specially Kate gave us extremely nice service, polite and helpful.

Food was mediocre. Service was HORRIBLE! Even though there only a couple of other customers and we sat at the bar. Too expensive for the quality. Take my advice, skip this place and go to Sushi-wa in Henderson or I love Sushi.

Great place to eat and enjoy one of the best sushi restaurants in vegas. I always make it a point to eat here at least once every trip. One of the best things about this place is that it's open so late. It is never too late for a snow-corn roll (my fav) or the always-great rainbow roll. 
Also, the decor is pretty nice, as is the music. they have a live dj there and the service is always great.
Happy hour is awsome here on weekdays !!!  They open late till 4am !!!  Good place to come eat sushi and hangout with friends !!!

This place is better than most sushi places that I've eaten at in San Diego. My girlfriend recommended this place to me and I'm so glad she did! We are staying at hard rock hotel and are only in Vegas for one night but I am really glad that we ate sushi here because it blows all the other sushi places in San Diego out of the water. 
The rolls are all unique and the chefs make the sauces bring out the best flavor in the fish. The tangy and spicy mayo add delicious character to the already melt in your mouth sushi. You win Las Vegas thank you for this amazing place. King of the ocean, double yellowtail are both amazing!
 So is their king crab miso soup, worth every penny!
 The cucumber salad came with a sweet crab garnish and really complimented the basic yet fresh cucumber vinaigrette.
Very delicious food!! Try the garlic edamame ! Great ambiance and friendly staff! This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Vegas!!!

Hands down the best sushi place I've ever been to!!!! Although it is expensive I think you get what you pay for. I would recommend going with at least 3 or 4 people so you can try a bunch of rolls. The place is always busy which is good and they are open realllly late. My favorite roll is the jalapeno popper. Will be back soon.
Love this place the food is awesome the sushi is so fresh, we watched then cut the fish.  Best sushi in Vegas by far.

It was the afternoon after a crazy night and I was hungry and a bit hungover. I didn't want a fancy place. I didn't want a touristy place. We were staying at the Hard Rock so we dedided to check out the strip mall across the street. Kaizen Sushi was closed at that time, and even though I couldn't see what the inside looked like, the sushi craving kicked in.

We came back later on and I am so glad we did. I ordered a couple of rolls, one being The Hungry Roll.. oh my god! it was enormous.. I would have been good with just that!!

We went back another time with a pretty large group of friends and they were very accomodating. I tried some of the baked rolls, which were delicious and not so heavy as my beloved tempura rolls. Eveyone else's food looked good, and no one had any complaints. I had the Lychee martini which was very tasty. We also got the party started with shots with ty ku.. sooo yummy! I wish they had it in L.A.

Overall, I love how it is nice yet very casual. Also, they have such a big selection of rolls!!!!

My only complaint (which wasn't the restaurants fault) is that we had them call a cab for us and we waited for about an hour and they never showed up. We walked over to the Hard Rock and the taxi line was huge. It was hot and it was annoying..... not the restaurants fault, but something to keep in mind!
One of my favorite weekday lunch spots. As a local it's hard to find a decent off strip sushi place that is good and has fair prices. They have awesome lunch specials and a hip fun environment.

When I called they had phone issues I guess? I called 2 or 3 times and it would randomly hang up and they would call me back. But other than that the food is super yummy. It's a little pricey for some of the rolls but it will definitely fill you up! Also open very late so it's a plus.
This is probably one of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. Food is always fresh and the service is always great!

fun and festive sushi spot off the strip. for those staying at the hard rock, this is a must. be careful crossing the street! it is a nice alternative 

sushi rolls are fresh and are made with some flair as well. the portions are fairly large (8 pieces) and make up for the slightly expensive menu.

watching the chefs prepare the sushi is fun too. the staff is very welcoming.

great for groups, or a casual hungover Sunday brunch.

We walked in and for a second, i thought I was in a Italian restaurant. Everything was so fancy and the host looked Italian. Then i saw the nicely formed, eye appealing varieties of sushi on the white plates.  As i looked through the menu, it was so hard to choose which roll to get. I wanted to try them all but my bank account wouldn't let me. The waiter was patient and made some recommendations. As soon as it came to the table we devoured them up, thus no picture was taken.  The rice on each roll was fluffy and not overly sticky, the fish was cold, firm and tasty, the rolls that had tempura waa freshly made, evident from the crunch and warmth of the tempura as you bit into the whole roll. My favorite had to be the roll with fresh tuna and roe. The roe just pops as you bite into it. In all we ordered 5 different rolls and spent over 80 with tip. I don't usually spend this amount for so little food and if I do it has to be spectacular. This place hit it out of the ballfield.
Great off strip restaurant... Decent prices with good saki selection... Sushi was good

I eat here often
For the past 9 years actually
The sushi lasagna is incredible and a must!
Soy paper!!!
Great food and atmosphere!! The customer service also exceeded my expectations. The tempura green tea ice cream is worth every calorie!!

To make the review short, this place is elegant and amazing.  The interior is nice and cozy, the food is great, and there is plentiful sake to choose from. If you are a unlv student, check this place out!

Every time I eat sushi in this city I'm mad at myself. It's always bad. Always. 

This time it was the worst. The yellowtail sushi was boring and the rice was stale. The salmon hand roll; uninspiring. The spider roll came out cold. Not warm, not cool.  COLD. It had been in the fridge. The fried crab was soft and soggy, not warm and crunchy. It was horrible. As in the worst sushi roll ever. I don't even know how the sushi 'chef' looks himself in the mirror. He should be ashamed. 

The server took my order but demanded I also write it down on their silly paper myself to keep track of what I ordered. 

That, and I never did get that glass of water I asked 2 different people for.

In Vegas not really knowing the sushi scene, so I relied on yelpers to give some recommendations.  This is a gem of a place that is solid and creative, about 1 mile off the strip.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are above average.  You'd pay almost twice the amount on the strip.  I'm a huge sushi fan in places all over the country.  Excellent dining experience.

The last time I was in Vegas this was the last place I  ate before my flight. It was delicious!  Best sushi I ever had the avocado train is amazing!!  I went home and craved this place for weeks. 
I loved there fresh ginger not the cheap pink ginger that most sushi places use.  all there rolls are pretty amazing and at a great price for Vegas. 

I just flew in for another convention and this is the first place I stopped. I think the service was great the sushi was Fresh and location is great right next to CVS for me to pick up some stuff before I get to the over priced hotels. I'll definitely be eating here a couple more times before I fly back home.
Really great place for that late night sushi craving, good calm vibe and friendly staff.

I have been to this Kaizen (across from Hard Rock) 3 times and the one in Henderson once, and each time has been consistently wonderful!  My 3 favorite items are the spicy tuna rice crisp (2nd only to Katsu-ya in Studio City, LA, where I think this sushi originated), Korean BBQ Roll and Seared Wahoo Sushi (very rare to see this Hawaiian fish sushi anywhere).  The various  soju/sake martinis are great, the atmosphere is hip and relaxing, and this place opens until 4:00 am, 'nuff said!
Best late night Sushi in Las Vegas.  Great service every time.  I recommend the rattle snake roll.

4.5 STARS

I WISH there was a place like this in LA: what can be better than late-night sushi?!? We always make sure to visit Kaizen when in Vegas...

The Lowdown:

- HAPPY HOUR starts at midnight (!!!)
Prior to midnight this place might be empty, and it sometimes begins to fill up late on weekdays. 

- FOOD - High quality ingredients.
Albacore & salmon sushi melt in your mouth. Actually, everything we've tried is delicious. The shishito pepper appetizer didn't disappoint (a personal favorite, which I often use to help gage the overall quality at sushi joints). I'd say this place is comparable to ever popular Katsu-Ya in LA.

- HUGE MENU
It takes a while to peruse the entire menu and get a feel for the many specialty rolls - there's something for everyone.

- LOCATION
I like the fact that this is an off-strip, "locals' favorite" type of place. 
Very cool, un-touristy crowd.

- PRICES
Its surprising to know that so many people think this place is expensive. Haven't you noticed that EVERYTHING in Vegas is expensive?!? In terms of sushi prices I'd say this joint is average, and the Happy Hour prices are a real bargain!

* WARNING *
CHECK YOUR BILL!
I'm docking half a point because the last time we were here they "forgot" to charge us Happy Hour prices, and gave us a bill with regular prices instead. NOT cool. Of course they fixed it when we spoke up, but if not for this incident Kaizen would be nearly perfect  :(

Great ambience and decore.  We stopped in on a warm summer evening and the temperature inside is cool and refreshing. The food is good.  The gyoza was a bit crispy for our taste but tasted good.  I had the kiss of fire roll.  It was excellent with just the right level of spice from the little slivers of jalapeño.

This is defiantly one of the best sushi places in Las Vegas. Always consistently delicious sushi. I come twice a year for a trade show and I don't miss this place. I look forward to having sushi at Kaizen. The crispy rice is one of the best I've tasted ever. And also the spicy tuna salad is my favorite. 
I live in LA where sushi is king. Thus place is better than any place in LA. A must gem close to Hard Rock Hotel. Serving is always spot on.

I love this place! I come every time I am in Vegas. I have brought lots of friends there and now they do the same. The sushi is great and the prices are fair. The garlic edamame is to die for. I can't get enough!!!

Best Sushi I've ever had.  Yes, I'm sober.  I travel frequently, and this is without a doubt the freshest salmon I've ever had.  
-salmon tataki
-sunset roll
-kiss of fire

You're welcome.

ok this review may have been blurred by my inebriation as well as my company at the time, but it was a damn fine experience.

what better than hot tea, cold sake and fresh sushi at 5am after a silly night of drinking?  i never thought sushi was a good late night food, but i guess anything can when its that late.  yeah, this place is open till 6am on the weekends.  this whole concept intrigued me.  i didn't even mind hearing the new britney cd in its entirety...

for our dinner (breakfast?) she had a house salad with some wild dressing i sampled that was very good.  the best roll we ordered was some scallop roll served in a sauce of curry with mushrooms...awesome.  i deducted one star b/c i was very excited for the korean bbq roll (i'm a huge, huge fan of short ribs) and it didn't do anything for me, too chewy for a roll...was terribly disappointed.  otherwise, food was excellent.

the hot tea was good, i don't know why i drank more but the sake after a whole night of drinking was strangely appealing.  

like i said, i ate up this whole experience.  the newest fan of sushi and sake at 6am!
Amazing place with very tasty sushi! Presentation is 10 star and customer service is impeccable. Also music is very pleasant and relaxing
Great quality sushi for a reasonable price with great chefs! Awesome hidden gem, right across the street of the Hardrock Hotel. A MUST for sushi lovers!

This place is awesome! Great happy hour specials. You gotta try the Spicy Tuna Salad. The staff is friendly, helpful, and attentive. All the rolls are sooo delicious! If you're in Vegas and you like sushi then this spot is it! I am definitely going to be back here when I'm in town. Cheers!

EXCELLENT sushi rolls and a lot to choose from!! Had the krazy boy (deep fried California roll), Tiger eye, and one other. Soo good. Also had the chicken teriyaki bowl which had lots of veggies and rice which was great, as well. Prices very fair and affordable. Great service, they even called a taxi for us after. Will definitely be back. Only a few minutes off the strip.

I like this place a lot because they have great food. I like them even more because they're open late. I've been here a few times after a night out on the strip, I don't know how exactly, but I've made it. I've had rolls and noodles and have enjoyed both with friends.

However, after coming here for a late night [sober] dinner recently I came to realize it really is a good sushi spot away from the strip. Especially since they have great deals - it was half off when we went for dinner.

It's good food, a great deal, chill atmosphere and great service. I must admit though, that i give them extra props for being open late and still delivering great service at such a late hour.

Ok so I am really torn. I came here for my bday party about 2 years ago, and actually had a great time, but came here last night and was really disappointed.

The service was fucking terrible. If you read my other reviews you will see that I am a very forgiving/reasonable person. The host was just plain uninterested and our server could give a shit less. The funny thing is we sat at the bar and the place was not busy. I was blown away, but my friend and I were craving sushi after a couple of drinks, so we decided to go for it.

We ordered a couple of beers and a couple of rolls, which were about 14$ a piece (kinda pricey) but really didnt care because I wanted to let loose. The rolls were really good; in fact we ordered about 5 more between the two of us. 

Ok, so here is the problem.
      1.No interaction from the sushi chefs
      2.The server had a piss poor attitude
      3.I tried multiple times to get recommendations from server and chef with no luck....they just didn't give a shit.

Ive come to a point were i am so sick of incompetent people,uninspired people (hence the reason most of us yelp so we can find no bullshit, highly recommended places to go). Well the unfortunate thing about kaizen is that they have the ability to be great, but the service is just non existent. If this was an instance in which only the sever sucked, I could probably blow it off. But no, this was the whole fucking operation.
    I will never come here again. I have never been so ignored or made to feel so insignificant at a restaurant in my whole life. I will give them 2 stars because the sushi was a sliver above average. Its a shame but the service was unacceptable. Oh and their prices just suck for what you get. Nothing but another glorified "sushi restaurant" in Vegas.

I have been coming her for 4 years. They are the best sushi in Vegas. I love love the silver state roll. They have a. The atmosphere is great and the friendliest staff ever. It's a definite place to visit if you are here.

The fiancé and I were staying at a near by hotel so we decided to give this place a try.  We were really surprised at how fast our rolls were served. Aside from the fast service this was probably the worse sushi I ever had in Vegas. The rice in the rolls was a bit on the hard sticky side, and every time we picked a roll it immediately felled apart. The rolls were on the smaller side and did not justified the value of the higher prices. The fish didn't tasted very fresh, in fact there was a fishy after taste to it. 

I came to the conclusion that the sushi we had was pre-made and had been sitting in a fridge for a while. My suspicion came from the very fast serving after ordering it, literally 3-4 minutes had gone by and we got our first and second roll. Our third roll came in at around the 7 minute mark. The third sushi roll was hot and it tasted like it had been microwaved, probably why the wait time was longer. My fiancé and I had the Philadelphia roll, crunchy roll...nothing crunchy about this, and lasagna roll. I was greatly dissatisfied with the sushi and have no plans of ever coming back here again.

This place has a nice atmosphere, but that's about it. I know it's a fusion restaurant, but I'm not sure what's they're fusing. I didn't order any sushi, maybe the sushi would be better. I'd ordered the teriyaki beef bowl. It just taste like pei wei's food. We also got a udon...however we didn't know they had stir-fry. I thought udon was going to be in a soup. The flavoring of the udon tasted like the vietnamese saracha chilli sauce mixed with sweet and sour sauce. Absolutely gross.  Maybe their sushi rolls are better, but I think they'd overpriced their food and you could get better sushi at other place for better price.

The atmosphere is above standard for a restaurant of similar state. Service was quick and professional. Staff was very knowledgable on the listed items. Very large menu. More standard options as well as more uncommon items. With the heat, they always made sure our drinks were tipped off. Food was phenomenal and lots of good per portion. Would definitely recommend for families or singles.

Great service! Very clean and fast service.. Would highly recommend.. We came in they greeted us quickly and friendly. Was seated right away. We had the T.T. Girls and Japanese Lasagna... Best sushi I've ever had!!

In a city of overpriced oversized greasy meals I am always happy to find some sushi.
Great ahi poke, farmed salmon :( 
Decent variety of rolls. Kinda pricey but I should expect as much since its Vegas and I'm from Vancouver!

Best sushi in Vegas...love this place!!!! The rolls are amazing...cool music/vibe...almost a club scene.  It's understandable why locals come here....
 
Can't wait to come back!!

My favorite sushi place that I intend to go here for my Birthday to have a drink and enjoy the wonderful rolls here. My waitress here last time was ultra attentive and nice. The prices are fair and food is just amazing like I mean really good. It had me dazing in class one time because I wanted to go here to fix my sushi craving.

Recently went here again and it was just as good. I can't get enough of this place! I love that they have a DJ (I don't know if that's a regular thing, I was there at about 12 on a Saturday). The place is open until 6 am on Saturday, which is awesome. It's a really fun place to go and they make the sushi pretty quickly. We ordered the Hawaiian roll (it's very different than it is at other places), the baked salmon roll, 1 oyster shooter, and the Rainbow roll (the total was $45..not too bad). And of course it was all very delicious.

Found this restaurant when we were staying at the Hard Rock Hotel (another story) and needed a place to have dinner. It was within walking distance & after checking it out on Yelp and seeing some good reviews, we gave it a try. Very good sushi & the manager and wait staff were very nice & attentive. We both had sushi & edamame and I also had miso soup.  We were both full when we left & the bill was about $40, including my ice tea and my husband's beer. We would eat here again if we were in the area, but since we would never stay at Hard Rock Hotel again, that most likely won't happen. If you like sushi and are stuck at HRH, this place should be on your list.
Amazing food! Pokie bowl was great! Great service, would recommend to anyone that visits Vegas!! You won't regret it

This place is one of the best sushi spots in Vegas!!!  When this place is packed or just has a few people scattered through the restaurant, the service is always the same......efficient and  amazing!  I've never had to wait more than a minute before someone comes up to greet me which is a rare thing these days.  The sushi rolls are unique, beautiful, and all have such diverse tastes.   When I have gone there by myself the sushi chefs are great at making you feel welcome and are very interactive, they are the same when I have gone with someone as well but are great for the lone ranger who's out looking for a great dining experience. I highly recommend this place for any local or if you are visiting, it will become you new fav sushi spot or at least be added to your list for sure!  LOVE ME SOME KAIZEN!  Keep up the great work you guys!

I really enjoyed this sushi spot!!!  I went here with my girlfriends at midnight on a Sunday night.  The sushi is very fresh and tasty.  I ordered the Salmon Tempura Roll and loved it.  I tried little bites from all my friends' food and it was soooo good. I love how they played music videos! Perfect way to get pumped for a night out.  We walked across the street to party at Hard Rock.  Would definitely go back!

I am not a sushi eater but I had some of the a la carte items like the chicken veggie teppan and it was so good ! 

Definitely great prices, and from what I can tell the all you can eat sushi is a great deal. 

I recommend the cucumber salad and chicken & veggie teppan.

Last meal in Vegas before heading back to LA.
Kaizen was really close to our hotel and on the way to the freeway. 

It wasn't very busy when we got there so we were seated and served right away. We ordered the sashimi lunch combination, the first kiss roll, and the tokyo roll. The server said she accidentally poured two soups instead of one (claiming that the lunch special comes with one soup). She scored brownie points with that move. 

The sashimi combination was alright. The slices of fish were decent. Not the Best sashimi I've ever had but it hit the spot.

The first kiss roll was pretty scrumptious. Not entirely sure what sauce it's served on top of but it was absolutely delightful. 

The Tokyo roll looked scary. I've never seen a raw fish roll look so slimy before. But the server Shima informed us that there was a mustard ponzu dressing on top of it. Me and my boyfriend only ate half of the roll trying to stomach the unusual slime but the waitress insisted that she still discount the roll from the bill.

To make up for the Tokyo roll, our server brought out a deep fried green tea ice cream covered with whipped cream, cherry and drizzles with chocolate sauce. Never having tried this concoction, we were pleasantly surprised with such a treat. Thanks Shima!

One of the best sushi places in town. I love the decor of the restaurant and the staff is always wonderful!
I sushi chefs are great and the sushi always taste fresh. They play great music and the vibe is definitely pleasant. My favorite roll is the rainbow roll... you must try :)
Amazing atmosphere, great attentive service by David, clean, and super delicious. Loved it
Excellent flavors here, ordered a few rolls and wished we would've found this place earlier in our trip!  Try anything with eel, one of the best I've had.

I loved this restaurant. They were extra attentive and accommodating. I got the Kaizen Ceviche -- highly recommended! 

It's really close to the Bellagio where we stayed. It's not too out of the way. 

Definitely come out to Kaizen if you're in the mood for something delicious. 

Kyle
First time here. Really nice atmosphere. Great sushi! I highly recommend the fire cracker roll.
This place is awful. One roll cost almost $17 and was the same quality sushi you would get at Von's. You can get better sushi at a convenience store. Avoid this place.

if your a fan of sushi, but cant stand all the hoopla that comes with the vegas casinos, all you can eat buffet, and ridiculous prices. Then this place is for you.  The first and most important thing is the sushi was delicious! We had sashimi, different rolls, seaweed salad, the works.  the atmosphere is is very easy going, their's no rush to get you out, the servers are very friendly and helpful, and best of all its open until 4am on most weekend nights.
Being from out of town and not being a fan of the vegas lime light. (I only go to vegas for work.)  this place is off the strip, across the street from the hard rock cafe/casino/hotel, in a corner shopping strip.  We asked our waitress (sarah) from Japonais inside the Mirage about a local place off the strip where locals go. She recommended this place.  HEY! Sarah great call thank you. 
i understand there's more than one location, lucky vegas residents.  i will be back to vegas (unfortunately), but now i have a place for sushi were the real people can go.

We come from LA and eat at Kaizen every time we come to LV at least once if not twice!   We are vegetarian and they accommodate us beautifully!   We love the monkey roll, the soba,  the shishito peppers, the veggie  tempura roll, and the jalapeño tempura roll.   The service is always great and the atmosphere is cool.  We love it! We went last night and will probably go back tonight!  ;)

This is my go-to spot whenever I'm out on the strip and craving sushi.  It may not be the most authentic place, but the food is fresh and tasty, service is good, and the prices are extremely reasonable.  The atmosphere is casual and they always have good music playing.  The best part about this place is the fact that they're open really late.  I've been here multiple times and never been disappointed.  Whether it's 7 pm, 12 am, or 5 am, Kaizen is always a good choice.

This was my 2nd visit to Kaizen, the first being a few months ago while visiting Vegas. Both times, we were able to get seated right away, the service was really good and the food even better! This time we sat at the bar and the sushi chef was very friendly and helpful picking some popular items. I'm pretty sure after each bite I said "ridiculous" to my boyfriend. Ridiculous = ridiculously delicious. It wasn't inexpensive, but the rolls are really big and everything tasted fresh and unique. The flavors and sauces were so good that I didn't use soy sauce or wasabi for any of it. Can't wait to go back!
I loved this place! This was my first time out for sushi - one of my friends loves sushi so I decided to go. I'll be coming back. There were so many  choices and the decor was super cute! Very yummy!

Stopped thru for late nite craving and was pleasantly surprised. This place is quaint, chill, and the service was on point, very attentive. 
Sampled several of the rolls (had the "baked Lasagne" to finish the meal. I was thankful The fish was fresh and decent prices comparable any respectable establishment. I'd recommend if your on this side of town.. I believe they have ayce, but not sure, nice set up w televisions and bar special was half price beer.

Stopped in here after Yama Sushi had an 50 minute wait! The decor reminded me of a nightclub. We ordered Gyoza and an assortment of other sushi rolls. The service was pretty good.  All of the rolls were pretty good, but the real standout was Japanese lasagna. it tasted different from Sushi-mon's or even Yama's because it tasted more like it should be called 'Japanese Mac N Cheese'. it was refreshing and interesting tasting. 
The Gyoza was not as awesome. I'm not a fan of deep-fried gyoza.
This place definitely hit the spot for my sushi craving. However upon leaving the restaurant i realized it wasn't the same as Yama sushi. Still good, but not the same.

One of my favorite sushi places, for sure! Hands down, best Japanese lasagna roll I've ever eaten. I had it for the first time there and honestly, no where else compares. I took my friend there for the first time recently and she loved it. Not having had sushi much, I told her to look at the menu, read all the descriptions and pick something with the type(s) of fish she likes. She did and ordered the Alaska roll which she said was really good. They have a great menu and I love how it's decorated. My only complaint is that sometimes the service is a tad slow, but they really do try their best, and that is ok with me. A lady next to me this last time was completely rude to the server but he didn't get upset and was able to pretty much turn it around, which was awesome. I don't mind paying their prices for what I get.. I've never been disappointed!

So I have a bone to pick - W and I walked through the front doors that had a huge sign saying "LUNCH SPECIALS *EVERY DAY*!" When we asked the waitress about the lunch specials, she said there weren't any lunch specials because of CES. If you're going to do that, take that sign out on the front. Otherwise, it's just dishonest, and super irritating.

Ordered to share: miso soup, rock and roll, silver state roll, and the scallop volcano roll. Scallop volcano roll was def the fave and hope to find something at home like it.

What a fun little sushi joint. While we were in Vegas for the long weekend, we had a late night (2am) craving for dinner and of course, almost nothing was still open except buffets and Kaizen sushi. Score one for the sushi joint. A taxi driver recommended the spot to me and I have to say he was on point.

Walking in, it's a small place. But the decor is warm and inviting, as are the staff. They were playing music videos and tables full of people appeared to be having a great time doing sake bombs. 

Their menu is HUGE. It's almost near impossible to make a choice based on all the yummy pictures and descriptions. But I settled on the Japanese steak and veggies (yummy shiitake mushrooms) and my friend ordered the albacore and the beef tataki (sp?) The food was so delicious that even as we stuffed ourselves silly, we made sure to wrap up the leftovers and take them back to the room. 

The price was affordable, service was quick, knowledgable and friendly, and they called us a cab to go back to the room. And did I mention they're open until 3am? Kudos. I'm definitely a fan and will return next time I'm in Sin City.

Friends and I decided to come here for some sushi since it was close to our place where we were staying at. Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi is located in a little shopping center. Inside they have nice decor with TV's, plenty of tables, a projector screen, and the sushi bar being visible wherever you sit at. The lighting is dim but it had a nice feeling to it. I ordered the KAI and Rainbow roll. Both tasted fresh and it was tasty. I thought the prices of the food was decent. The service was great because you didn't need to ask for a refill and the lady was polite and respectful. If you have a craving for sushi try this place out.

Their sushi was AMAZING! I live here in Vegas didn't even know this place existed. Great food HORRIBLE, RUDE SERVICE which makes me not want to go back.. Whet in a week ago about an hour before closing with a party of 6 our waitress IRENE gave us the worst service from the beginning even though she had an auto gratity already added to our check. Half of us at the table work in the industr and couldn't believe her attitude (rolling her eyes after asking questions in regards to the menu,etc.) I would definitely request a DIFFERENT SERVER if i ever went back.  She ruined our 1st time experience there!

Stopped in for some late dinner encouraged by the reviews here but still skeptical. I sat at the end of the sushi bar so I could watch the food being prepared. I was impressed with the care and attention to detail. I asked for an eel hand roll which was made quickly and well. I decided to try one of their crazy fusion rolls and ordered the Unicorn. All the ingredients came together well and the slightly spicy, slightly vinegary sauce really added some kick and acid while letting all the flavors of the fish and shrimp and lobster come through. Staff was friendly, attentive and efficient. Prices were reasonable. Overall I would definitely come here again and recommend it to friends.

This place is great service is fast, on point and haven't been disappointed.  Waiters are friendly and very very helpful.  Food is fresh and delicious, our second time here.  We are from out of town and always looking for good quality sushi and this is it!!!  Highly recommend eating here.  We will continue coming here!!!  We ordered lobster tail miso soup, kiss of fire n hungry roll.  EXCELLENT!!!

When I am in Vegas for business I will usually make sure I check out Kaizen. I have brought co-workers as well as my wife here a few times and no one was ever disappointed. The prices are not as bad as on the strip, but a little higher than off the strip. The sushi menu is very extensive with items you will not find at other sushi restaurants. There are a few all you can eat places in Vegas, which Kaizen Fushion Roll and Sushi is NOT. Overall, I always enjoy coming here and it is easy to find as it is in a plaza across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. They have a few TV's with sports on them usually, and play modern music. The Atmosphere is very modern and clean. I would recommend this place to someone looking for Fusion Sushi.

My wife and I were looking for some place quiet and peaceful off the strip and we found it here!! The food was outstanding!!! Along with the service and presentation!!! We had the "Charlie Roll" and the Lobster Mango Roll fresh and delicious!!! You should check this place out!!!!
The beef tataki is so good, only place I've seen this dish and I loved it. Sunday through Thursday happy hour 12 - 4,  BOGO all alcohol.

It's kind of hit or miss with this place. Decent but I've had much better. Servers are sometimes nice but seems like a lot going on behind the scenes. Chefs are fun but sometimes seem over worked and grumpy. There are actually very few sushi bars I know of that are actually owned by Japanese owners, but when they are, you can be sure that they take the art of sushi making very seriously. This place, not so much.


I tried it again. Fish was fresh and tasty. If only the busboy spoke english, he might've heard me say i didn't want anymore tea. Instead, he reaches over my plate to grab my cup and then proceeds to spill it on my jacket sitting on the seat next to me. Not to mention he ran my food to the wrong person. 

Wish the bussers would learn how to communicate properly...and, why isn't my server bringing my food anyways???

Was looking for a good place to eat sushi, and this one had pleasant reviews by my fellow Yelpers. 
It is located in a plaza with other restaurants, a 24/7 salon, and retail stores. 
I love the ambiance and customer service. They are attentive and helpful. Nicely decorated with elegant simplicity. 

We ordered the avocado train, spicy rainbow roll, and the baked scallop. All in all, we were speechless the whole time we were eating because it was that good! The avocado train had a delightful surprise with an avocado ball at the end of the roll. What is in it, you ask? You gotta order it and find out! The spicy rainbow roll was a good balance of spicy and fresh fish. Lastly I love the sauce on the baked scallop roll. The mushroom and scallops were super good! 

Would definitely recommend this place to friends and family!

Take your time and enjoy the experience... Great sake choices too ;D  It's been a while since I had really great quality sushi; thanks to Mel!  All their rolls are done exquisitely and with great detail.  The menu does provide you ample choices so you should listen to your gut and instincts to choose what you should have.  All in all, the service is extremely attentive and prompt.  If you're not getting your food quick enough, it's most likely due to your indecisiveness in selecting what you want from the menu.  I thoroughly enjoyed myself and would make the effort to wander off the strip to eat here again.  If you're staying at the Hard Rock Casino, it's right across the street in the same complex with CVS.  Enjoy, eat sushi, and please drink some of their wonderful sake too.
Amazing sushi. My favorite was the Hawaiian but I also loved the tuna tataki roll and Mexican fiesta roll. I would definitely come back if I am in Vegas again.
If you're looking for sushi after hours...Kaizen is the place! Good service, clean & the BOMB sushi!! Thanks to the taxi man that took us here, if it wasn't for him I wouldn't of found this place. :)

Thank you Kaizen for the great meal that was needed before our night out dancing. Michael was our server and we applaud him for putting up with us...he was attentive and laughed at our bad jokes. The ambiance wasn't too casual and not too fancy, which was perfect even though we were pretty dressed up. The sushi was DELICIOUS, fresh and nicely prepared. Two girls in our party ordered the miso soup with lobster and loved it. The sushi we ordered was great and filling. The best part about this place was that it wasn't that busy. We assumed it would get busier later into the night, since they are smart and stay open until 6am. 

I plan on returning again to this cute spot off the strip when I'm back in Vegas.

Fast service and close to the fun! Large menu too
With a number of exotic rolls and staples.

Fantastic and authentic sushi, and good sake selection. Staff is very friendly and helpful.
The menu has all the staples and is also very creative, the Spider Mania roll and Monkey Brain are amazing!
I had the chicken katsu bowl for lunch, it was great, portion size was big, tasted great. We ordered a ton of sushi and it was amazing. I recommend the sexy maguro roll.

I come to this place at least twice a month on late Saturday night because it opens until 6 A.M. on weekends. This place is not AYCE but that's because they offer high quality sushi. I like to get the Unagi Bowl and Miso Soup if I'm trying to get something quick to eat. The presentation of the Unagi Bowl is great and it taste absolutely delicious. My favorite roll here is the Rattle Snake Roll and I get it every time I go. I recommend the Salmon Skin Hand Roll or the Philadelphia Hand Roll, bare in mind that their hand rolls are pretty large! They also offer extremely fresh nigiri and they always have a special fresh fish for the day so be sure to ask! When they have special fishes for the day, they are indeed special because I cannot find some of these fishes at any other sushi restaurants. The Hamachi Kama is also a must, it's perfectly seasoned and grilled and it practically melts in your mouth. They are getting ready for a new location at the Linq so they have been training new waiters so be patient if you get one of the new ones! The sushi chefs are also amazing and have fun personalities if you're sitting at the bar. They like to drink, dance and sing while making sushi! Note, this place is a bit pricy because of the quality but it's worth it!

This was a great local find when I was staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and didn't have a car. It's right across the street in an unassuming strip mall. (Plenty of free parking if you're driving, btw!) I was impressed with the hip, modern and clean design. Definitely wasn't expecting this place to be that stylish. 

The hostess was friendly and seated me right away. She also was my server and was very on top of things. The prices are about average, but not as ridiculous as the casino sushi places. The best deal I found was the chicken katsu bowl, which was around $10. It was the most delicious katsu I had in a long time. It was moist and the serving size was perfect. I hate when katsu is dried out and tough, but this definitely wasn't the case here. I had a good miso soup and a roll too. I can't remember the name of the roll, but it delicious. The fish was fresh and the sauce complimented it perfectly. My server came by several times to check on me and refill my beverages. All in all, I had a great experience and I will definitely be back. Saw lots of good dishes going by that I would like to try next time! But, trust me, try the chicken katsu!
I love how this place is open late, the ambience is great and ALL their rolls are good! They have a banana roll which was surprisingly pleasant
We do a lot of sushi while traveling on business. Kaizen is amazing in quality and presentation while being a fraction of the big hotel sushi costs. 5 stars.
perfect! food is great! good service with nice waiters. weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeereeeeeeee

The decor inside was very nice. When you stepped inside, everyone welcomed you even the chefs. You can hear music  playing along with the music video displaying on one of their walls. 

The waiter did not sat us down. He just went off and lay down the menus without even a heads up that it was our table. Seems like he really wanted us to leave, since he came by every minute to ask if we were ready. When we were finally ready to order, the waiter was glancing out the door and was waiting for other customers, which was so rude. One of the workers had to personally go up to the waiter and tell him that we wanted to order. Never experience this kind of situation in my life but it is what it is. 

The food tasted great. If you order stuff that is not in the menu book, the portion is quite big. The busser would always come by and refill our drinks, which was very nice of him. 

When more customers come in, the waiter paid even less attention to us. One of us had to stand up and get him so we can have the same attention as others.

Overall I like their food, but seriously the service is horrible.

We're here from out of town and noticed Kaizen in a shopping center across the street from Hard Rock. The service was friendly and efficient; the food was awesome; the decor was clean, simple, and comfortable. The Chicken curry udon was a huge surprise. DELICIOUS!!  Also had terrific soft shell crab, oysters, sashimi combo plate, and the broiled Saba...All excellent!  Coming back for happy hour...10pm-4am Buy 1 Get 1 Free Alcohol Beverage.
Coming from Texas we have very high expectations for sushi and this met them. Not extremely overpriced and extremely well prepared. Definitely would come back again

Freshest fish. Perfectly steamed edamame (not mushy). Great service. Oh, and ORANGE BLOSSOM ROLL.

That is all you need to know.

Good, not great, food with absolutely horrendous service. Greatly improved service could bump it to four stars, and having just one more server might do it.

Enjoyed the food, but the terribly inattentive service was inexcusable.

Excellent food & good service. The men are Japanese (not Korean) & make delicious rolls without packing it with rice. The flavor is balanced and the rice amount is just right. All the raw fish taste well cleaned and fresh.

The flavors are great. I don't usually do reviews but this place deserves it. Visiting from Los Angeles. Our favorite place there closed and was driving by this place and decided to check it out. Sure glad we did. Tops my list. Your not eating just plain fish here. It's filled with flavors! We will be returning for sure. I would give at 10 starts if i could.

Sushi rolls are soo good here! I really like the presentation of their rolls. A lot of detail and creativity is put into the presentation. I would definitely recommend for late night sushi or any of their other menu items!

my husband and i are complete sushi lovers.  it's not too often we absolutely love a sushi place, but Kaizen Fusion is great!  the environment is trendy with top 40 music videos playing on a large plazma tv.  the rolls are fresh and perfect for one-size bites.  our favorite was the "sexy roll" for spicy tuna lovers. price is reasonable (just a few that are $$), and the service is also friendly.  

afterwards we walk down the street to Hard Rock for some gambling and drinks to end the night.

DELICIOIUS!

And they even have chopped fresh wasabi.   

I got a roll and a bunch of nigiri, and everything was awesome.

Loves it.
The sushi here was horrible! We ordered two rolls, the dragon roll and California roll.... Both were so small! It's not worth your money.
Great customer service! We recommend you the  silver state roll and BBQ roll are really yummy!

WORST customer service ever. I got there one night and paying the bill, I was told my credit card was declined. So I gave another one. The day after I checked my bank account and noticed I was charged on BOTH cards. I called and I was told to wait few days and the charge on the first card would have disappeared. I waited... nothing changed. I wanted to talk with the manager, but apparently this guy is NEVER available. I called and went there in person several times with my bank statements printed out, none could solve the issue. Eventually spoke with the manager, who told me to send to his email copy of my bank accounts with the statement showing (like I have all this time to waste? Do they think Im making this whole deal up for 26$? What about giving me a free meal and PEACE OUT?). I did emailed him all documents...He NEVER answered back. Called again, he was not at the restaurant. I'm so pissed that I've wasted all this time and got robbed. It's just unfair. Be aware of how they treat their clients!
The Sushi is amazing. The service and atmosphere is top notch. I would highly recommend this place.
Creative rolls, speedy service!  The only restaurant I HAVE to return to since living in Las Vegas.  And they have amazing hours for the Vegas lifestyle!
Fast service and delicious sushi! Staying at the Hard Rock and this is conveniently located across the street! Plus its open til 6am on a Sunday!!!

A good friend of mine turned me on to this place...was pretty skeptical at first but was pretty satisfied at the end of the meal which was at 5 am!! The DJ was still spinning and the chefs were still grooving and making my custom made sushi!! Can't complain now can I ? :-) You have to have the King Crab Miso Soup as a starter!! The Jalapeno poppers are great along with the rainbow roll and the lobster rolls! Yummy!!! :-)
Just plain perfection. The sexy roll is to die for.  On our last trip to Vegas, we ate at Kaizen three times.  Skip Nobu across the street, and come here instead.

First time here and came on a Saturday night and was quickly seated. Love the ambiance and the open concept.

I ordered the Baked Salmon Roll and  the tempura appetizer! The food came quickly and both were very good! I love that the rolls weren't huge where they weren't falling off which I love!! The tempura wasn't overcooked either and not too greasy! 

Lastly the service was impeccable! Everyone checked on us and always made sure our drinks were topped off! So glad we came here!! =)

The food was great....but not use to this type of delicacy. The seaweed salad was enjoyable. The ice cream (green tea) was delicious. Staff seemed helpful but lacked in pouring water and keeping the cups full. Other then that I ventured out to try something new. I'll be back to try other things on the menu. Thank you guys.

This place is right across from Hard Rock in a shopping center.  Super good rolls although normal to slightly higher priced but very good.  Service was pretty good, I would definitely come back again.  The desert menu is awesome I have never seen so many options at a sushi restaurant which was really cool.  I had the chocolate truffle and it was really bomb.
Came here randomly late on a Tuesday - the service and decor was good, but the sushi (rainbow roll and kiss of fire) blows. Will definitely not return!
Off the strip and reasonably priced. Friendly wait staff. The saketinis and avocado train are must-haves!! Absolutely delicious.

Well I guess they read my last review because the nigiri sushi list is now taped inside the front cover of the menu!
Another great meal at a very reasonable price per person. We stuffed ourselves for about $40 each. 
Lots of choices. Nicely divided menu by type of roll - fried, tempura, etc.
Much better value than the high end places in the hotels nearby. 
Open late so you can eat a nice meal after a very long day working.
Good place especially for groups.  Pretty solid sushi and although it's in a strip mall, I actually prefer it since the prices are reasonable and it's nice and low key.

I come here to Kaizen all the time!! Great Sushi, great customer service!! There is a Kaizen Sushi near my home and I go there all the time...i even went for my birthday! I definitely recommend Kaizen Sushi!!
Always ALWAYS the best! Kiss of Fire, Orange Blossom, Avocado Train.... and everything else.... just ridiculously awesome!
This place has a nice atmosphere, very nice and clean and the waitresses are great. This place also has a great Happy Hour special and the Raspberry Sake is EXCELLENT!!!
Really freindly and very affordable. Extremely delicious and the service was perfect. This is my 3 rd time and I life in NY.

After wandering around the strip seeing many Pokemon and other characters like a fat guy in a bikini, I really needed something to cleanse my palette. A friend recommended this place.  My group started with the grilled ika which came with a spicy sauce and this awesome scallop mushroom app that was in a cream sauce topped with a charred cheese - do delicious, I just wish I had some to scoop the extra sauce. Then we had a few roll by then the scarring that occurred from the fat bikini was gone. But we stayed for dessert - fried tempura cheesecake and deep fried ice cream.
First Kiss Roll is delicious and service is very attentive. Open late for all you night owls. I come here sometimes twice a week! I would also try the green apple saki ...

Great restaurant just 5 minutes off the strip. The sushi was excellent and moderately priced. The total was probably half what it would have been at a more well known sushi bar in Vegas. Service was also excellent, the waitress was right over when our glasses were low to refill them. Highly recommend and will return next time I'm in town.

The best value food I've had in Vegas- minus the taxi ride to get there. It's located way off strip- in a 'strip mall' across the street from Hard Rock Hotel. If you are staying at the Hard Rock, simply walk across the street to try the ridiculously good spicy tuna roll covered in tuna and dripping with roe sauce that they call the "Sexy Roll". I also tried the Scallop Volcano- a california roll exploding with tons of cooked mushrooms, scallops and spicy yummy sauce.  There are a lot of unique rolls with chicken or other cooked foods inside.  Sit at the bar and talk to one of the cool Japanese sushi chefs.  Good for large groups coming over from the hotels etc...

Decent sushi, but not my favorite. I don't really get the rave reviews. The majority of sushi spots in Vegas are AYCE- and I'm fine going to a place that isn't, but the expectation is that the quality is higher. And while the presentation and service were good, the actual quality of product and freshness of fish seemed average.

When ordering takeout, this spot is great about carefully packing up your order so each roll has it's accompanying sauces alongside- this allows you to control how much is used and prevents the rice from getting soggy on your ride home! 

Menu features a wide range of specialty sushi rolls, and some grilled items and apps as well. Nigiri oddly did not seem to to be that common here. The Kai roll was recommended by staff and the best of what we tried. 

NOTE: Takeout rolls noticeably smaller than what is received dining in.

Let me tell you the BBQ roll is spectacular. I felt like a little baby Buddha was dancing on my tongue. This place is awesome and they even surprised us when they told us that starting at 12am  they had buy one sake get one free. Sake Bombs here we go

The food was delicious! The fish is very fresh and the service was excellent. The atmosphere was comfortable and we were seated pretty quickly, there were so many choices to choose from and they all tasted very good, the price isn't that bad either!
Clean facility, very welcoming environment. Prices are reasonable. The host great very friendly filled with great advice if your not clear on what to order. (IVAN) that's the guy.

I came here for a pre-birthday celebration. The service was great and the rolls were fabulous!  We came back the next day because we enjoyed the rolls so much! Definitely coming back whenever Im in Vegas!

It's really hard to find a great sushi place that's consistent. I purchased a Groupon for this place since it was close by my house. I took a friend for lunch and we were told we don't get the special lunch prices if we use a Groupon. So in the end, it really didn't save us any money. Regardless of that, we were one of two parties there during that time and our rolls were delivered far apart. Plus, all of the rolls were so-so. I wouldn't go again.

Came all the way here bc I wanted to Gangnam kbbq but they were so busy so we headed Kaizen instead. 
We got the Lasagna, BBQ and California roll.
And it tastes absolutely amazing. We loved the bbq roll tho. 
The service was great. We were seated right away and servers would always check on us. Will come back definitely!(:

This place is sooo good.  They have a large variety of rolls, and they are almost all delicious.  It's a great place for a small group of 4-5, and they stay open really late.  We always go when we visit Vegas.  And for the people who don't like rolls, the entrees such as teriyaki chicken and udon are good as well.  They flavor the veggies and udon very well.  

Our favorites:
Lasgana Roll
Avaocado Ball (kinda pricey but totally worth it)

Skip the shitake mushroom roll.

I was so happy to find this place...I was staying across the street at the Hardrock and nursing a major hangover that I had already attended to earlier in the day by ordering eggs benedict from room service ( good room service FYI )...anyway still lagging and trying to decide to rise and shine or hermit in my room when my friend said he was coming over...so oh shit, guess I better get up...he asks me what I want to eat and I say Sushi downstairs....I start getting ready and start imaging what I will order once at Sushi, my friend gets there we head downstairs walk in the sushi spot and God Damn it...I'm 10 minutes too late and they are closing...argh....so they recommended across the street...I'm glad they did.

Yeap its an American style sushi spot ran by maybe Koreans with all kinds of fried sushi rolls...which is exactly what this hungover girl was craving anyway.

Albacore with crispy onions ..Yum
Salmon nigiri...Yum
Shrimp tempura roll...Yum
some kind of bulgogi roll..Yum
and some other specialty roll, can't remember...

Everything I had was delcious and fresh....service was fast and friendly and I felt happy here...the hangover required that I be around only a few people and the HardRock was totally over crowded...

They are open super late for those like me who crave things late at night!
I love this place!  We eat here every time we are in Vegas.  Reasonable priced, great selection, excellent rolls, and super friendly staff.  Have never been disappointed.  We will be back soon!

I found this place using yelp during our recent visit to Vegas.  The great part about this place is the late hours.  Me and my hubby was hungy at a late hour so I yelp the place and was pretty satisfied with the place.  Service was awesome.  It's close by the strip.  Awesome sushi and good food.  I would definitely go back there when visiting =)
The restaurant is close to where we stay and it open late , so come in and give it a try . The server are very nice and take well care with very amazing food

The restaurant is super clean and modern.  Hip and electric Music is playing in the background. Servers are nice and I would recommend this place to anyone.  The sauce can be on the sugary side fyi. Ivan was super nice.    Request him.
Good select of sushi rolls, and they came out pretty quick. Service is good. Restaurant ambiance is higher end, reflecting traditional Japanese with a modern flare.
Love the late hours and amazing menu! The Rose role and crab salad has it in along with the amazing sake selections

Within walking distance of my hotel, this place was a great find!

What I had:

Jalapeno popper roll: This was good but the cream cheese they used had no flavor. The outside was fried lightly and had a great crunch to it, even ordering it for take-out.

Las Vegas Roll: I loved this one. Would highly recommend it! 

Ordering take-out was super easy. The staff is friendly, and it came out pretty quickly. 

Will definitely be back!

Uni was the only thing fresh to me
 Service was great. Just old fish not as fresh. For me i will not return to this restaurant.
Large menu and very accommodating staff. My meal was excellent plus it is bogo after midnight on drinks Sunday- Thursday.

I'll be a regular customer ! Hands down some of the best I've ever had.. Crab salad was beautiful and tasted amazing! Service was excellent!  The avocado train and sunrise roll will be ordered again!! I can't write how good this shit was!
Great selection of sushi rolls. We ordered 4 rolls and a few sides that came out quick! Didn't have to wait on a Wednesday night. Quiet setting made for a relaxing meal.

Absolutely yummy, a little overpriced really enjoyed the atmosphere, wasn't expecting it to look so fun from the outside. We will definitely be coming back! Service was super quick, we got our first two rolls in 5 minutes.

Quite possibly the worst sushi we have EVER eaten.The fish wasn't fresh.it was overpriced and amateur.if you wanna call yourself a sushi restaurant....Learn how to make sushi.And  if you can't afford to keep fresh fish in the house.....don't call yourself sushi chefs.Also.I Ordered the seared beef tataki....It came out ice cold.GROSS food.Save your time and your money.This place should shut the doors before they give someone food poisoning.Word to the wise...they order cheap ahi that is not sushi grade and they use it for sushi.Please bring a roll of toilet paper.Your gonna need it when your colon explodes on your ride home.
Don't eat at this joint.seriously.Unless you have an extra three days to spend running to the bathroom......

This place is amazing. There is a wide variety of items on the menu, even for non sushi lovers. 

The food was extremely tasty, and the service was on point. 

I highly recommend this place to anyone that loves sushi and a good atmosphere.

Worst service ever!! We came here a hour before close and they told us they were doing last call, and we needed to order right away. No problem with that because after a long weekend working 14 hour days so we just wanted food!!! The chefs were standing around and after we put in our order they started cleaning up. After our appetizer came we received our bill to discover they didn't put in our order in for entree. We practically had to beg them to put in our entree order. Anyone makes mistakes and we understand its late but they're open until 4am so they should still serve us, right? As we saw the dread in the two chefs expressions, and saw how old the rice was we decided to cancel our order. The hostess lady was super rude and pushy, trying to push liquor even after I told her I can't drink. The monkey brains were good and the miso soup was yummy, would of been better if they weren't cheap and actually put more wakame and tofu in it. I honestly think if they raised the quality of service and dedicated employees. The workers need to realize that they work in hospitality and are dealing with people so need to treat them how they'd like to be treated.  -September 26th 3 am

This place has a lot of potential, considering the fact that the location is pretty good.  The place attempts at an identity; dimly lit rooms, walls and menus decorated in sleek yet simple design.  Bold and different from other sushi venues in Las Vegas.  Overall, not bad.

Even the food is designed to look cute and all.  You may notice the sushi takes a little bit longer to prepare than other venues, and obviously it's because they're taking their time laying out and arranging the sushi to make it look nice.  Makes up for a nice Kodak moment if you're into that kind of stuff.  It's impressive, but the bottom line is that no amount of decoration can make a delicious meal.  The fact is, the sushi tastes bad. Really bad.

To be fair, the sushi may be OK for first timers or real causal sushi goers, but it just doesn't cut it for me.  The biggest reason is that the rice is terrible.  It doesn't mix well with the sashimi at all.  It's always because the rice is cooked too thin,there's too much rice in the roll, it's not packed correctly with the sashimi, the list goes on and on.

The fish is OK, but not mind-blowing.  The best way to find out if a sushi joint is good is to eat the most perishable fish on their menu.  I always try the Ebi(Shrimp), Ama-ebi(Sweet Shrimp), and Uni(Sea Urchin) as starters.  Try one of these as a Nigiri (Fish and Rice only, with no tacky sauce), and you'll know in a heartbeat if the fish is fresh or not.  It doesn't matter anyways because you shouldn't order Nigiri at a sushi joint that doesn't have AYCE unless you wanna put a hole in your wallet.

The price is pretty overpriced as well.  I know it's near the Strip and everything, but it seems that's all you're paying for at this point.  The food does no help to justify the price of the dishes.

Oh, I just want to point out it took nearly 20 minutes for them to prepare a California Roll.  Unbelievable.  I don't care if it looked pretty because when I'm hungry I can eat anything that looks close to edible.  The thought of waiting another 20 minutes was insane.   I can't imagine how much longer it will take if I ordered it during their peak hours.  If you go there around 10-11pm when they're busy, good luck ever getting your food..

In conclusion, considering that the food comes out looking pretty like a flower arrangement and takes a long time, its more like a lounge-like environment.  Go with a couple friends when you aren't too hungry, have a couple drinks and poke at the pretty food that takes forever to come out.  In that sense, it's an OK experience.  But as far as taste goes, stay awaaaay. 

PRO: Nice decoration, location is OK.  Sushi may be decent for casuals
CON: Sushi tastes bland, dishes takes a really long time to come out, no AYCE

By far the worst sushi restaurant I've ever been too...

My friends and I love sushi so it wasn't a surprise that we came here considering it was right next to our hotel. We got seated really fast and we were kinda excited about the menu since there was a lot of variety. My boyfriend and I ordered 2 rolls since we usually get that amount of rolls at other sushi restaurants thinking it will fill us up. Once my friends and I got our sushi, we were pissed off because the sushi had like 4-6 rolls. We just looked at each other like are you freakin' serious? I had to order another sushi roll because it obviously did not fill me up. When we got our check, it was about $105 since it included gratuity already. My friends and I ended up putting $120 instead of $105 since none of us had change. So we're waiting..and...waiting for our change. The workers during that time were giving us dirty looks cause we were still there and probably wanted to clean our table. So it finally hit us, where the fuck is our change? We asked the lady if we can get our change back and she gave us a dirty look. That bitch thought that extra $15 of our "change" was her damn tip. Like really? The tip that was on the receipt was already $15. So this restaurant tried to get a $30 tip from my friends and I when there was only 6 of us. Really? $5 tip from each person when the food didn't even fill us up? Shake my head at those workers man.

Not really a fan. I wanted sushi in Vegas and wound up here.  It was in a questionable strip mall.  The long tables were kind of cool and they played rave music with the concert videos in the background. The sushi wasn't to my liking.  I thought it tasted fishy, like in a not fresh kind of way.  I don't know, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't really good either.

We ate here when in Vegas for Defcon last year and I LOVED this place! The food was really fresh and the wait staff was really nice and catered to our vegetarian needs.   This experience before I began eating fish again so that was really important to me.  I loved the cucumber Salad (Sunomono) and the way it was served in a martini glass, vegetable rolls, cucumber rolls, avocado rolls, we delicious and plated beautifully as well.  I would definitely come here again especially to hit up the happy hour specials & free sake bombs when you spend $15 :) Yuuuuuummmmy!
Not cheap but very good. Good sake selection. Creative dishes. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. What more do you want?

this place is awesome! i'm always satisfied to find pretty good sushi for good prices, so that i found here ridiculously yummy, beautifully prepared sushi for very reasonable prices, i was totally stoked. 

whatever you do, order the Avocado Train, i think it's called - it will break your heart. the yellowtail with jalapeno is perfection, and the grilled ika is scrumptious!! 

i'll be back every time i visit vegas ...

Had Korean BBQ bento box at lunch it was awesome. The miso soup was tasty, salad crisp dressing was killer and the BBq was as tender as filet mignon, cut it with a fork (yes I used a Fork). Portions were large as well. Service was excellent and very friendly. Korean BBQ is one of my favorites, I've eaten it all over the world including Korea and I've never had better.

In a very convienient location for those staying at the Hard Rock Hotel, and nearby on the strip.  Stay out of the overpriced, overrated Casino sushi joints and take a quick ride down to Kaizen.  The sushi is fresh, staff attentive, and the beer and sake floweth.  

You can have your choice of traditional sushi, sashimi, or get adventurous with one of thier tasty specialty rolls.  The SPICY TUNA SALAD is a must try; large portions of tuna with a fresh mix of greens.

This is one of my favorite sushi spots anywhere, and the best I have had in Las Vegas.
Huge variety of sushi! The people working there are very helpful and energetic. The food was amazing as well! Definitely coming back!

The service is crazy fast and the polar opposite of "chatty"...which I liked. The rolls were tasty and there is a huge selection. Really, the only thing they could improve is to get fountain drinks. I'm annoyed by paying $2.50 for a can of Coke that obviously is not refillable. We were seriously blown away by how fast they got our food out to us.
The rolls are great! Would definitely recommend their Japanese Lasagna! By far my favorite in Las Vegas! Plus their presentation is amazing! Every roll looked photo worthy! Delicious!

I was in town last weekend with friends celebrating my birthday (seriously, I'm still waiting on your presents...). I wanted to grab sushi, and not being a Vegas regular, knew I should check out Yelp to see where all you Vegas Yelpers are going.

Our party of 4 got in relatively early for dinner, about 5:00 on a Sunday, and we were the only ones there. We ordered about 10 different rolls, and they were served at a well staggered interval. I'd say 8 out of 10 were delicious, the other 2 average. The tuna, salmon, crab and more were all delish and fresh. We stayed for a few hours, I think we left after 8:00 since we were eating, drinking and having a great time. The wait staff were great, and were in no rush to get us out the door. In fact, they made sure to tell us they were open until 4 AM...so I guess we could've stayed for a while!

Ambiance was interesting. I dig the hip hop music and videos, and even though the place looks a little low budget inside, the food more than makes up for lack of decor. 

Price was super reasonable, we ended up spending about $50 each, but that's with drinks, all of those rolls and a 25% tip. Great value. I will definitely visit this place again next time I'm in Las Vegas. Thanks Yelpers, for helping out a San Diegan in your fine city.

Total quality management.

Look it up: http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Kaizen

Edamame and cold tofu with ponzu both delivered.

Mountain of salted goodness on the former, rectangles of soybean with sweet homemade ponzu sauce on the latter. Loved both.

Rolls were massive if unmemorable. Rainbow featured an assortment of fish, Mackerel Madness was pretty mad with mackerel and more ponzu sauce.

Yet a week later not much stands out from either.

Reasonably priced and a space that tries to be as cool as possible.

Call it three stars for reaching middle management.

This restaurant made my fiance and I physically ill. It is by far the worst sushi joint I have ever been to. Not only did they completely screw up my takeout order, but they served us bad fish. I called to speak with management and was told I would be called back the next day. I called back the next day after my call wasn't returned, and again, no manager. Same thing for day 3 and 4. Only after threatening to contact the health department was I coincidentally given to the manager. Who offered no apology, and instead offered a $20 credit for next time. Why on earth would I return to a restaurant that made me sick?? Anyway, I was eventually offered a $11.99 cash refund. Which is a complete joke, not to mention insult. I will be contacting the health department this morning, as this is not acceptable. This place should be shut down for criminal negligence.

Nigiri Sushi, Rolls and Sashimi was OK.  I just disappointed in Shrimp Tempura.  That was not tempura, but fried Shrimp.  Shrimp was fried with banko, I had to ask Tonkatsu sauce.
Rools and plates were beautiful, but I think most of dishes are bit over priced for that quality of fish.

Good food, reasonably priced. They were able to accommodate our larger party very quickly which was nice. Service could have been more attentive. Pretty good overall. 

The beef teriyaki bowl & fried chicken sushi roll was really good :)

Love Kaizen. Come here quite often after hours. Good rolls and prompt service. The staff could be more friendly but I'll deal with it for good food at 4am. They should have a children's menu too, kids are not going to eat a whole bowl to themselves.

If you love fusion rolls, this is the place.  Mind you I've only been here once during my trip to Vegas but it was definitely unforgettably delicious.  We only got rolls so I can't say much about their other food.  However, the maki (rolls) were very creative and well combined ingredients.  It isn't cheap but definitely worth the money IMO.  

I would come back here next time I am in the Vegas area.
I am blown away at how awesome they deliver with good food. The avocado train is amazing with the softshell crab the rainbow roll sexy roll, if you love sushi this is heaven on a plate!!

I don't see why people like this place so much! They have horrible service! It's seriously the service that gets them the 1 star. First of all no one was even in the front to greet you.
We ordered two hot teas and NEVER got them, but was still charged for it.
The sushi rolls were good. The food is good don't get me wrong. But the waitresses that work here don't even want to be there. 
Some other waitress that wasn't even helping us in the first place got us water. And apologized for her coworkers mistake. Wait why are you apologizing...? The Asian waitress should be apologizing. Anyways I definitely will not be coming back. Management needs to check up on this because several people are complaining about the service. 

On top of all that another customer walks I'm after us and gets his drinks and food before us? Thanks for the slap in the face.

This place has a Japanese name, but definitely Korean owned.

I suggest to order togo to avoid this situation.
Food and service were excellent! We were seated and served promptly. The kiss of fire roll is a great choice. Will definitely go back next time I'm in town
Very fresh sushi. I had the Mexican roll and ate every bit of it. Fast service and a must to visit!

My wife raved about this place so when I just recently visited, we stopped by.  Not sure why there are any complaints about the service as I thought it was fantastic.  I'm guessing they have been working on their service and improving upon it.  We walked in and  were immediately greeted by a cheerful hostess/waitress (one that actually smiles).  Rolls were awesome, their eel sauce was amazing.  They had an appetizer I had never tried before, they were peppers that were sauteed- very delish!!  
I'd definitely come back foh sho!!!!

I like Kaizen. It's hip, easy to go with a group of friends and they have some interesting rolls to choose from. 
My only issue is that it's a bit pricey for me. Two rolls and a drink - your check is about $40 before gratuity. I'd rather go to an all you can eat sushi restaurant for half that price and pig out! But this place is open super late (4AM) which is a plus for us industry folks who crave sushi right after partying at the club. HEYYY!!!!

Went in for lunch on a weekday. Had the spicy salmon and Sunrise rolls. Rice was pretty stale--being that it was lunchtime, I'm assuming this was last night's rice :-/

The taste and the freshness of both were good. I was the only one in here so service was not surprisingly good and fast.

Would've given 4 stars if they had fresh rice.
Amazing place! The atmosphere is great and the staff is very attentive. The decorations are beautiful and they have several tv's, so it's a great date restaurant or hangout spot.
The first kiss roll is one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had in my life. The spicy tuna crispy rice is really good too
Just go. Just eat here. Sushi is delicious, the atmosphere is super lax, & the service is good.

This is my favorite sushi place of all time. I want to move to Vegas just for the sushi here!! Service is great and the rolls never disappoint! Fish is always super fresh and tasty.  I always get the white rose roll avocado train and my new favorite is the spicy tuna salad. If I could eat here every day I would but i have to make the four hour trip to Vegas just for my yummy sushi rolls :(  love this place and the ambience. Great for night owls like me and also love the music. I rarely leave yelp reviews but I have to for  kaizen! Please move closer to LA!
