Very good tempura and the service was excellent. It is dark when you walk up to the building, but inside the decor is super chic. Great place for a date, girl's night, or to just grab lunch. My friends got sushi, and enjoyed everything!

Came here for dinner for the first time. No wait. ordered our food. our hot sake and beer, appetizer, and one of our entrees came out. Forty minutes later, still no food. We ask our server to check up on it. He never came back. We asked another server and he took care of us. Eventually we got all our food and he gave us 3 more hot sakes on the house, which made it a little better. I was super hungry to begin with, so I was not in a good mood at all and I couldn't enjoy the sushi I ordered because I ate everything so fast. This review is based mainly on poor customer service. Food was average.
This place is so amazing, the staff was super friendly, very clean and inviting. The feel of the place from when I walked in was exactly what I expected, perfect.
This sushi house has a relaxed atmosphere, fresh sushi, and good service. I will be back for sure. Thanks for the free roll!
I love this place. My favorite is the spicy tuna salad. It's like a spicy tuna roll in salad form, minus the rise. I also recommend the grilled peppers and their fancy rolls.

Every time we come to Vegas.. got to go to KaizenSushi.  I'm not a huge "roll" fan but they've got some great ones.
The prices are very reasonable, especially compared to better known sushi bars on the strip.
Came in at 1:30 am, day after Christmas and there were probably 2 dozen people in there.  Didn't realize it was buy one ( beverage), get one free.  One free Sapporo and $23 Sake!! Score!!!
We love to find great sushi spots whenever we travel and we love Kaizen!

When we come to Las Vegas the first place we go for good sushi! The jay roll, the spicy tuna roll and the sashimi were very good and not Strip prices. The service is excellent and the restaurant immaculate. Definitely recommend!

average sushi and rolls, prices are a little bit on the pricey side... but not too bad.

i guess i went on the wrong night or something cus it was pretty crowded with only two waitresses. service was mediocre... it took me reminding the waitress and even the bus boy 3 times for hot sauce!! ughhh..... i was practically almost done with my rolls by the time i got it.

i even heard the table next to us ask the waitress if they were short on waitresses bc no one has taken their order..... :|

Whack. 

The food was decent, but nothing was that memorable.  I would've liked my salmon skin salad to be crispy. 

The bad service overshadowed the experience there. The wait to get change for the bill must have taken over 15 minutes. It's not like my friends and I had a complicated bill either, we paid in cash.

The Mexican bar after the Indian restaurant next door is much better than this place.

My girlfriends who were in town staying on the strip wanted sushi and since I am a local and have a car I demanded we leave the strip and go here. We ordered the avocado train roll, the unicorn and another I don't remember the name of... But let me just say not only was the presentation of the rolls great, the flavor was amazing! They were beyond happy with this place which made me feel good. The venue is clean and I really like the set up. Some intimate tables on the side but the middle has big long benches for a unique seating expierence. Would be great for a big group! The server was incredibly friendly and helpful with his suggestions for what we should order. I am looking forward to coming here again.
This was an enjoyable experience... Sushi was great and they were playing hip hop?!? Like Whoa!!!! I am definitely coming back!!
By far the cutest location. The sushi is amazing & the staff is always professional. Clean! & the cheese cake is a must try!
Amazing sushi! Highly recommend it. One of the best sushi spots out here in Vegas! Nice environment with kind staff.
Decent place... rolls have way too much rice. I mean jeez the rolls were huge! Needed a knife to cut them in half. Flavor was good though. Service was extremely slow.

No doubt the best in Vegas. Top notch quality in terms of food, taste, presentation, service, environment, EVERYTHING! As a recent transplant to Vegas, this is absolutely my go-to place for sushi, a la carte or AYCE!
Tonight enjoying different pieces of sushi and a rainbow roll. Thank you Charlie for the Mackerel recommendation!

BOO. So disappointed.

Came here around 8 on a Saturday night after Yama's Sushi had a 30 minute wait.
Soon as we came, we were seated immediately which was good because we had a party to go to at 10.

Each of my friends ordered a hot/cooked dish and a specialty roll; I ordered the chirashi (sashimi sampler on rice) because I didn't want to be too full for the night's festivities.

In 15 mins, my friends each got their cooked meal - seafood curry, chicken katsu, and chicken teriyaki donburi. Told my friends to eat as my food was surely to come out soon.
I watched my friends eat as I drank water; and watched more and more people come into the restaurant. 
Before I knew it, my friends were done with their meals. And I started noticing that the groups of people that came after us were getting their sushi. This was about 30 mins after ordering.
We kept looking for our waitress for the next 5-10 minutes but, no one came into our section. We, finally, had to wave down the hostess to check on our sushi.

My friends' specialty rolls, finally, came. But, at that point, their food had already settled and they weren't hungry. 
Finally...after an hour of waiting, my food came. By that time, I didn't even wanna eat it.


For a city that has all these AYCE and stellar sushi spots, Kaizen should be lucky to be open. And with service like this; forget it!

The general consensus was that the food was ok with the exception with a few items that was better.  They were very accommodating to the 14 girls we had.  The biggest complaint I have is that the rice fell apart in my rolls.

My new favorite sushi place!  I tried it for the first time this weekend and liked it so much I went back the next night.  They are open late, the sushi tastes wonderful, and the prices are fair.  I can't wait to visit Vegas again so that I can eat here.
Wow I love food and I had the blast here food was amazing the Korean bbq roll was just incredible very recommend I will visit again and soon

I recently stayed at the Hard Rock on a trip to Vegas, and considering the fact I was on a limited budget, I was very happy to find good affordable sushi across the street from my hotel!

The sushi there wasn't amazing or anything, but it was good and definitely cheaper than a lot of the alternatives in the area.
Love this place!! Food is always fresh and the service it great. They are open late, so we end up here all the time.
Good food, service, and atmosphere. The only thing I didn't like was how loud the music was. The sushi and service more than made up for it though.
Food was good , service was even better. We ordered the Kai sushi roll and the Nevada roll . sushi is just typical sushi to fix your cravings .

This is one of my FAVORITE Sushi spots here in Vegas!! The very 1st day I flew into Vegas, my roommate Jef brought me to the Kaizen in Henderson and I automatically fell in love!

Kaizen is a very great sushi spot especially for one of the best HAPPY HOUR spots to go to after 12am-4am when your hungry and drunk! Can't beat a buy1get1 for Beer and Sake and $2 Hand Rolls!!

Workers: Very friendly staff and theyre always down to drink with you especially the chefs!! They always make sure you have a great time!

Menu: Its SUSHI!! Its a bit pricey but its worth! Try it and let me know! "First Kiss Roll" is my favorite Special Roll on that menu.. Pretty much everything on the menu is a great pick and I always bring all my out of towners to this spot and they always ask me to take them back again!

Location: Right across of Hard Rock Hotel and down the street from the Macarran Airport! Cant ask for any better. Better than it being off the strip than on the strip or in a high end Casino!

Check it out!!
I've been three visits now.  Super great place.   Food is fantastic.  Ambiance is nice and service great.   I'll be back!

Their food was great! We had the salmon skin salad. Ate the whole thing. We also order their rolls. Very good too. You will not be disappointed! We are from SF Bay Area. Next time we visit Vegas, this will be our must go Japanese restaurant !
Best sushi place in Vegas .. And one of my personal favorites .. Everything tastes on point with good quality Service and friendly staff !! The satisfy my sushi cravings!!

Been here before food is ok not the best sushi rolls in town for sure . This time I sat at the bar And sushi chefs were totally out of touch and I practically had to yell at them to get my rolls, but the retarded thing is me and my friend were the only guys at the freaking bar.

BEST SUSHI PLACE IN THE CITY. I've been here multiple times and the rolls meet all expectations. Freshness, Flavor, Presentation, Large Rolls, High End quality. Nice little setup too! The service is a little bit average but who cares! Drink and have some rolls :)
This restaurant has good decor, nice ambiance and looks very clean and hip!  Food is excellent so stop by and get your sushi fix on!  Service is excellent by Ivan!!
Late night fun with buy one get one free sake. Sushi is good fun place to be plus it's open late so that's a real plus

Amazing!! This is by far my favorite sushi restraunt in Vegas. The menu is insane so many choices and so delicious. You have to try the Monkey Brains, weird name but its honestly the best thing on the menu!
Love this place. Best sushi best service and less expensive than competitors The atmosphere is very enjoyable you can't go wrong  favorite sushi place in Vegas

One of the best Sushi places I've been. I'm a big fan of Spicy Tuna Salad and theirs is the BEST!!! 
A MUST try resto

Excellent sushi!!

This place is located across from the Hard Rock in the CVS Plaza. It is a cool place with a nice atmosphere as far as sushi places go.

It is not an AYCE place and it will cost you quite a bit of cash if you eat like you are at an AYCE place, but the sushi is excellent and the staff is very friendly. I use to get sushi to-go from here all the time when I worked in the area.

Highly recommend!

This place is not bad. I found it late night and decided to sit at the bar. I usually NEVER sit at the bar, but it looked inviting , and very casual, it was a friday night, around 11pm or so. They were playing techno music, I actually like the atmosphere. My date and I came in a for quick bite, and this was pretty fast and not very expensive. Both time that I have been there it has not drained my wallet for what i got. 1st time here i got a shrimp tempura roll ( 7bucks), not bad. and a cucumber roll(4 bucks). My date got the shrimp killer. ( around 8). Not bad at all. 

Second time I went i ordered to go, and I got a vegetable tempura roll,(7bucks) which i found to be VERY GOOD! They put avocado in it. I tried the spicy scallop roll, but I did not care for it. It has some kind of a red mixture, somewhat like tomato. I dont know. I have had better. Everything else was very good!.
Shrimp tempura roll. vegetable tempura roll. scallop roll, cucumber roll all came out to 24 dollars to go. I know i dont order extravagant rolls but thats cause im allergic to some of the stuff in those. So for me veggies rolls are wonderful. Ill prob come back again, because they pay attention to my fish allergy.
I come here alone sometimes after work, and I never feel weird. The sushi chefs talk to me, and they said they would remember my allergy if I came back, that makes me feel SO GREAT!
Hands down the best sushi in vegas. Been going here for years! Also be sure to try the avocado train or the scallop volcano roll! Awesome staff!

if you want a great dinner and late night place for multiple occasions, definitely check out kaizen. i think they have multiple locations. i've been there a few times for get-togethers and bachelor parties. very reasonably priced, food is definitely good grubs! i recommend the grilled rice sushi roll, i don't know the name but it is delic...! also, the snowcorn roll is my favorite. ask for the raw wasabi, its off menu, great little accent to the norm. very convenient location.

Best sushi on the west coast.  Fish is always fresh and the Korean BBQ roll is fantastic.  Located across from Hard rock.  This place is a must try. Inexpensive especially compared to the strip and a good staff too. Also they are open until 5am so after a late night of drinking definitely the place to be.
